fields.name: Gannon University
fields.about:
Founded in 1925 as Cathedral College, Gannon University is a private Catholic institution located in Erie, Pennsylvania. It became a university in 1979 and merged with Villa Maria College in 1989. Affiliated with ACCU, NAICU, and a U.S. space-grant institution, Gannon ranks #227 in U.S. News & World Report (2022).

Campuses & Programs
Gannon has two campuses—Erie, Pennsylvania (main campus) and Ruskin, Florida (focused on healthcare programs). The university offers 67 bachelor’s, 6 associate’s, 29 master’s, and 6 doctoral degrees, along with 20 cooperative and 8 pre-professional programs.

Achievements & Alumni
Recognized as a “Great College to Work For” in 2021, Gannon has a strong alumni network of over 47,000. Notable alumni include banker Vikram Pandit, politicians Ryan Bizzarro and Joe Schember, and several professional athletes.

Student Diversity & Recruiters
With over 4,700 students, Gannon is known for being LGBTQ+ friendly among Catholic institutions. Student media has won national awards, and top recruiters include Deloitte, Siemens, Cleveland Clinic, Komatsu, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

fields.name: Cornell University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1865, Cornell University is a private Ivy League research university in the USA, known for innovation—like using hydroelectric power on campus since 1883. It is affiliated with the Association of American Universities, SUNY, and the Association of Public & Land-Grant Universities. In 2022, Times Higher Education ranked Cornell #22 globally and #11 in the US.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Academics
Cornell’s main campus in Ithaca spans 2,300 acres with 608 buildings featuring unique architecture. The university offers 80 majors, 100 graduate fields, and 18 minors across eight undergraduate and four graduate faculties. Notable programs include Business Inclusion & Diversity, Leadership Development, and International Management. Cornell awarded the world’s first journalism degree and the US’s first veterinary medicine degree.

Achievements and Alumni
Cornell has 26 green-certified buildings, including five LEED Platinum. It was the first US university to endow professorships in American History, Musicology, and Literature. The alumni network exceeds 250,000, featuring 47 Nobel laureates and numerous Fulbright, Marshall, and Gates Scholars. Famous alumni include Ratan Tata, Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Toni Morrison, and Freeman Dyson.

Student Diversity and Careers
With 24,027 students from 116 countries, Cornell supports strong career services ensuring high employment rates. Graduates work at top firms like Goldman Sachs, Facebook, IBM, Boeing, and Accenture.

fields.name: CQUniversity
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
CQUniversity (CQU), based in Rockhampton, Australia, was founded in 1967 as the Queensland Institute of Technology. It pioneered distance education in 1974 and expanded campuses across Queensland before gaining full university status in 1992. Today, CQU has over 30,000 students and is part of the Regional Universities Network. It is the only Australian university recognized by Ashoka U as a Changemaker Campus. CQU ranks in the top 800 globally by Times Higher Education and top 650 by QS, and is noted among the best universities under 50 years old.

Campuses, Courses, and Infrastructure
CQU has the largest campus network in Australia, with locations in every mainland state, including Adelaide, Brisbane, Perth, Sydney, and even Jakarta. It offers over 300 programs from certificates to postgraduate degrees, with strengths in Engineering, Medicine, Psychology, Health, Business, Law, and Education. Many courses include internships and work placements to prepare students for employment.

Achievements and Alumni
Ranked #1 in Australia for learning resources and student support, CQU excels in teaching quality and research. It is recognized by Excellence in Research Australia (ERA) for world-class studies in 22 fields, focusing on practical, impactful research such as Indigenous health, future farming, and intelligent systems. Notable alumni include actor William McInnes, politician Dale Last, and author Alana Mann.

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
CQU serves a diverse student body of 30,000+ from 1000 countries, with over 5,000 international students. It offers flexible study options including distance learning. The university has strong industry partnerships with companies like Microsoft, Deloitte, Westpac, and PwC, providing valuable recruitment and research opportunities.

fields.name: Crandall University
fields.about: Crandall University, operated by the Canadian Baptists of Atlantic Canada, is a liberal arts institution founded in 1949 as the United Baptist Bible Training School. It was renamed Atlantic Baptist College in 1970 and stood as the only English-language university in Moncton throughout the 1990s. In 2009, the school adopted the name Crandall University in honor of Rev. Joseph Crandall, a distinguished Baptist minister in the Maritime region. The university offers a wide variety of degree and certificate programs across Arts, Business Administration, Technical Education, Science, Organizational Management, and Theology. It is recognized as the largest faith-based university located north of Boston and east of Toronto. Crandall’s faculty includes professors and scholars from prestigious institutions worldwide, such as Oxford, Notre Dame, British Columbia, Illinois, Ottawa, Toronto, Manchester, and Penn State. Notably, it is one of only two Canadian universities with a study abroad partnership with the University of Oxford. Additionally, Crandall collaborates with universities in Alberta and China to offer short-term student exchange programs.
fields.admission_requirements:
Application Process:

Apply online through Crandall University’s application portal

Pay a non-refundable CAD 100 application fee

Submit all required documents

Wait for admission decision (typically within 10 business days)

If accepted, receive Letter of Acceptance (LOA)

Use LOA to apply for a Canadian study permit

Pay tuition deposit to confirm enrollment

Documents Required:

Completed application form

Official transcripts from all previous schools

English proficiency test scores (one of the following):

IELTS: minimum 6.5 (no band below 6.0)

TOEFL iBT: minimum 90

CAEL: minimum 70

Duolingo: minimum 115

PTE Academic: minimum 56

Copy of valid passport

Proof of application fee payment

Additional documents (if applicable):

Resume or CV

Statement of Purpose (SOP)

Letters of recommendation

Employer reference letter

10th and 12th grade mark sheets

fields.name: Georg August University of Gottingen
fields.about: The University of Göttingen, officially called the Georg August University of Göttingen, is a prestigious public research university located in Göttingen, Lower Saxony, Germany. Founded in 1734, it is one of the oldest and most renowned universities in Germany. The university is known for its strong emphasis on research, particularly in the fields of natural sciences, humanities, and social sciences. It has a rich academic tradition and has produced numerous Nobel laureates. With a diverse international student community, it maintains partnerships with leading institutions worldwide. The university is also a member of the U15 group of major research-intensive universities in Germany

fields.name: Curtin University
fields.about:
urtin University: Overview

History & Rankings
Founded in 1966 as the Western Australian Institute of Technology, Curtin University is a leading global institution known for innovation, industry partnerships, and high-impact research. It is a member of the Australian Technology Network and Open Universities Australia. Curtin ranks among the top 1% of universities globally, placing #194 in the QS World Rankings, 251–300 in Times Higher Education, and #156 by U.S. News (2022).

Campuses & Programs
Curtin has five campuses in Australia and four international ones in Dubai, Malaysia, Singapore, and Mauritius. Its main campus in Perth blends 1960s architecture with green landscapes. Curtin offers over 150 courses across Engineering, Business, Law, Architecture, Agriculture, and more. With 80+ global partner institutions, students have broad international exchange opportunities.

Achievements & Alumni
Curtin was Australia’s first University of Technology and remains research-driven. It boasts the best graduate outcomes in Western Australia and has produced notable alumni like actress Judy Davis, musician John Butler, and journalist Natalia Cooper.

Diversity & Employers
Over 13,000 international students from 100+ countries study at Curtin. The university emphasizes diversity and gender equity, earning the Athena SWAN Bronze award. Top recruiters include IBM, Tesla, Apple, Shell, and Disney.

fields.name: George Brown College
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1967, George Brown College is one of Canada's largest public colleges, located in Toronto, Ontario. It is affiliated with CCAA, CICan, Universities Canada, and CBIE. The college has been ranked the #1 research college in Canada multiple times by Research Infosource Inc.

Campuses & Programs
George Brown has three campuses—Casa Loma (main), St. James, and Waterfront. It offers a wide range of programs including diplomas, certificates, apprenticeships, and undergraduate/postgraduate degrees across seven academic centres such as Business, Health Sciences, Arts, Culinary, and Engineering.

Achievements & Alumni
The college has been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers and a leading research institution. Notable alumni include actress Katherine Barrell, chef Jamie Kennedy, author Bonnie Stern, and YouTuber Gigi Gorgeous.

Student Diversity & Support
Serving over 25,000 full-time and 61,000 continuing education students, including 3,270 international students from 95 countries, George Brown supports its students with scholarships, bursaries, and work-study opportunities.

fields.name: Dakota State University
fields.about:
Dakota State University: Overview

Founded in 1881 in Dakota Territory as a teacher education school, Dakota State University (DSU) now focuses on technology and cybersecurity, preparing students for diverse careers. Accredited by CAEP, ACBSP, CAHIIM, and the South Dakota Department of Education, DSU ranks #82 Regional Universities Midwest, #131 Top Performers on Social Mobility, and #20 Top Public Schools (US News).

Located in the traditional lands of the Oceti Sakowin tribes, DSU offers programs in Accounting, Business, Computer Science, Cyber Operations, Health Informatics, Education, and more.

Recognized as one of South Dakota’s Best Online Colleges (2020) and a Military Friendly® School (2020-2021), DSU boasts notable alumni like Richard Barrett Lowe, Miles Beacom, and Shantel Krebs.

With students from over 52 countries, DSU fosters a diverse community enriched by student media like Trojan Times and KDSU radio, and active student governance. The university maintains a 99% job placement rate and regularly hosts events and webinars to support student success.

fields.name: George Washington University
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1819 by Baptist pastors and originally named Columbian University, it was renamed George Washington University (GWU) in 1904. Accredited by the Middle States Association, GWU is affiliated with CUWMA, NAICU, ORAU, and SURA. It ranks #355 in QS World Rankings and #63 among U.S. National Universities (U.S. News & World Report).

Campuses & Programs
GWU operates three campuses: Foggy Bottom (main), Mount Vernon, and the Virginia Science & Technology Campus. Located near key Washington, D.C. institutions, GW offers over 75 majors. Popular programs include Social Sciences, Business, Engineering, Health Professions, Computer Science, and Journalism.

Achievements & Alumni
GWU leads in sustainability research and community impact initiatives. It has a global alumni network of over 310,000, including notable figures like Turkish spokesperson İbrahim Kalın, journalist Brian Williams, and former Croatian president Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović
Student Diversity & Careers
With over 21,000 students—including 4,000+ international students—and 2,000+ faculty, GWU fosters a diverse academic environment. Its Career Services center connects students with top employers like Amazon, Deloitte, IBM, Microsoft, and Google.

fields.name: Georgia Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1885, Georgia Tech is a leading public research university in Atlanta, USA. Known for its strong focus on science and technology, it ranks #88 (QS 2022), #45 (THE 2022), and #58 (U.S. News 2022). It is affiliated with major organizations like AAU, ORAU, and the National Space Grant Program.

Campuses & Programs
Georgia Tech has campuses in Atlanta (main), France, and China, along with online learning options. It spans 400 acres and includes 28 schools under six colleges, offering programs in Engineering, Design, Sciences, Business, Liberal Arts, and Computing, with 37 majors and 46 minors.

Achievements & Alumni
With over $1 billion in annual research funding, Georgia Tech ranks among the top 10 U.S. public universities. Notable alumni include Nobel Laureate Kary Mullis, U.S. President Jimmy Carter, and Panama’s former President Juan Carlos Varela. Its football team, the Yellow Jackets, has won four national titles.

Student Life & Careers
Home to over 29,000 students, Georgia Tech offers 400+ student organizations promoting diversity and inclusion. Its Atlanta location connects students to top employers, startups, and global companies, enhancing career opportunities post-graduation.

fields.name: Dalhousie University
fields.about:
Dalhousie University: Overview

Founded in 1818, Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, is one of Canada’s oldest and most prestigious institutions. Known for its quality education and diverse research opportunities, Dalhousie’s motto emphasizes knowledge through learning, innovation, and community service. It is affiliated with global bodies like the Association of Commonwealth Universities and Universities Canada.

Dalhousie’s Faculty of Health partners with leading hospitals such as QEII Health Sciences Centre and Nova Scotia Hospital. Its sports teams compete in U Sports, ACAA, and CCAA. The university ranks among Canada’s top 15, placing #12 in QS Canada Rankings and #272 globally (QS 2022).

Campuses and Academics

Dalhousie operates three campuses in Halifax—Carleton, Sexton, and Studley—and an Agricultural Campus in Bible Hall, plus medical facilities in Saint John, New Brunswick. With over 19,000 students worldwide, it offers 200+ programs across 13 faculties including Health, Law, Engineering, Arts, and Science. Dalhousie prides itself on low student-faculty ratios and strong ties to industry and research.

Research and Community

Dalhousie collaborates with nearly 100 countries on research addressing global challenges in areas like Healthy Communities, Sustainable Ocean, and CleanTech. Its ITS department supports advanced research and technology infrastructure. Students engage in NCAA Division I athletics, cultural activities, internships, and volunteer work. Notable alumni include astronaut Kathryn D. Sullivan, former Canadian PM R.B. Bennett, author Lucy Maud Montgomery, and psychologist Donald O. Hebb.

Diversity and Careers

International students from over 115 countries make up about 25% of the student body, alongside growing Indigenous and LGBTQ+ communities. Over 300 students study abroad annually through exchange programs. Dalhousie graduates are employed by top companies like Microsoft, IBM, Bell Aliant, and Rogers Telecom.

fields.name: Dallas Baptist University
fields.about: Dallas Baptist University began in 1898 as Decatur Baptist College in Decatur, Texas—the first two-year junior college in the state—founded by the Baptist General Convention of Texas. In 1965, the college relocated to Dallas, becoming Dallas Baptist College. By 1970, it transitioned into a four-year institution and began awarding bachelor’s degrees. In 1985, it was renamed Dallas Baptist University, reflecting its expanded academic scope, including graduate programs. Under President Gary Cook's leadership (starting in 1988), DBU grew significantly in enrollment, facilities, and endowment. The campus expanded to over 368 acres, featuring Georgian-style architecture and adding regional centers. Today, DBU serves over 4,100 students, offering undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral programs with a mission to produce Christ-centered servant leaders. In 2024, it received a landmark $20 million gift, renaming its business school the Don and Linda Carter School of Business.
fields.admission_requirements:
Admission Process
Complete the online application (no fee for undergraduates).

Submit official high school transcripts.

(Optional) Submit ACT/SAT/CLT scores – recommended for scholarships.

Write and submit a personal essay.

Submit letters of recommendation (required for some scholarships).

Receive an admission decision via email or portal.

Confirm enrollment and pay enrollment deposit.

📄 Required Documents
Completed application form.

Official high school transcript (final transcript after graduation).

ACT/SAT/CLT scores (optional through 2025).

Essay/personal statement.

Recommendation letters (if applying for scholarships).

For transfer students: college transcripts and possibly high school transcript (if <24 credits).

Additional Requirements for International Undergraduates
 Additional Steps
Submit passport copy.

Provide proof of English proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or PTE).

Provide financial documents (bank statement or affidavit of support).

Complete visa process (I-20 issued upon acceptance).

Submit health records (TB test, meningitis vaccine, immunizations).

Additional Documents
Passport copy.

TOEFL (≥71), IELTS (≥6.0), Duolingo (≥95), or PTE (≥48).

Bank statement/financial affidavit.

Immunization & medical forms.

Visa documents.

fields.name: Dartmouth College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1769 by Rev. Eleazar Wheelock, Dartmouth is the ninth-oldest U.S. college. A private, Ivy League institution, it offers undergraduate programs and graduate schools in Business, Engineering, and Medicine, plus 16 graduate arts and sciences programs. Dartmouth is affiliated with groups like the University of the Arctic, Matariki Network, AAU, and Space-Grant. It ranks #99 globally (Times Higher Education 2022), #13 in U.S. colleges, and #191 (QS World Rankings).

Campus and Academics
The 269-acre rural campus in New Hampshire sits above the Connecticut River. Dartmouth runs on a year-round quarter system with four 10-week terms. Known for strong undergraduate programs, Greek life, and traditions, it offers diverse degrees through its Guarini Graduate School, Geisel Medical School, Thayer Engineering, and Tuck Business School, including joint degrees.

Achievements and Alumni
Dartmouth was the first U.S. research university to award more engineering bachelor's degrees to women than men. It won the ABET Innovation Award for its race car design program. Thayer professor Fossum won the 2017 Queen Elizabeth Prize for inventing the CMOS image sensor. Notable alumni include Dr. Seuss, Mindy Kaling, and Daniel Webster.

Student Body and Opportunities
Dartmouth enrolls 6,444 students, with 977 international and 32% graduate students. The faculty totals 836, mostly domestic. The Student Employment Department helps students gain work experience, skills, mentorship, and income during their studies.

fields.name: De Montfort University (Dubai Campus)
fields.about: De Montfort University (DMU) has its origins in Leicester, United Kingdom, where it was founded in 1870 as the Leicester School of Art. Over time, it expanded to include technical and commercial education, eventually becoming Leicester Polytechnic. In 1992, it was granted university status and renamed De Montfort University, in honor of Simon de Montfort, a historical figure known for establishing one of the earliest forms of parliamentary democracy in England. Building on over 150 years of educational excellence, DMU expanded internationally and launched its first overseas campus in Dubai in September 2021. The Dubai campus was initially located in Dubai International Academic City and offers the same UK-accredited degrees in areas such as business, law, cybersecurity, design, and engineering. To accommodate its growing student body and strengthen ties with industry leaders, DMU Dubai moved in 2024 to a larger, state-of-the-art campus in Dubai Internet City. This international expansion reflects DMU’s commitment to delivering high-quality British education on a global scale.
fields.admission_requirements:
Admission Process:
Choose the course you want to study

Apply online at: applydubai.dmu.ac.uk

Upload all required documents

Pay the application fee (AED 500)

Wait for your offer letter (conditional or unconditional)

Pay tuition deposit (usually 50% of 1st-year fees)

Apply for student visa (if needed)

Complete registration (online and at the campus)

Start your classes

Documents Required:
 Academic transcripts and certificates

 Passport copy

 English test result (like IELTS or TOEFL)

Personal statement (why you want to study)

CV or resume (for postgraduate courses)

1 or 2 reference letters (school/college or work)

 Portfolio (only for design, art, or architecture courses)

Translated documents (if not in English)

Financial proof or sponsor letter

Passport-size photo

fields.name: Deakin University
fields.about:
Deakin University Overview

Founded in 1974 and named after Australian Prime Minister Alfred Deakin, Deakin University was Victoria’s 4th university and the first to specialize in distance learning. It is affiliated with the Australian Technology Network, ASEAN higher education bodies, and the Australian National Business School. In 2022, Deakin ranked #283 globally (QS), #218 (US News), and #251 (Times Higher Education).

Campuses and Programs

Deakin operates four campuses—in Melbourne, Geelong, Waurn Ponds, and Warrnambool—with the largest in Melbourne. Three campuses are urban; one is suburban. Each is near gyms, cafes, medical stores, and shops for student convenience. The university offers over 150 postgraduate and 100 undergraduate courses across 10 schools, including Business, Law, Medicine, Engineering, IT, and Humanities.

Achievements and Alumni

Known for excellence in teaching, research, and inclusivity, Deakin invests heavily in technology to enhance distance learning. It has won awards like the QS Wharton Reimagine Education Global Award. Notable alumni include journalist Emma Alberici, politician Julie Attwood, and AFL player Tim Callan.

Student Body and Careers

With over 64,000 students—44,000 undergraduates and 17,500 postgraduates—and 11,000 international students, Deakin offers strong student support through the Deakin University Student Association (DUSA). Graduates commonly find roles at firms like KPMG, Deloitte, ANZ, and the University of Melbourne.

fields.name: Delft University of Technology
fields.about:
History, Rankings, and Affiliations
TU Delft, founded in 1842 as a Royal Academy for civil engineering, is the oldest and largest technical university in the Netherlands. It became a polytechnic in 1864 and gained full university status in 2005. Ranked among the world’s top 20 engineering universities in 2019, it holds the highest rank in the Netherlands and was #57 in the QS World University Rankings 2022.

Campus and Courses
The university campus spans 161 hectares, larger than Delft’s city center, featuring green spaces, cycle tracks, labs, botanical gardens, and student facilities. TU Delft offers 16 Bachelor's and 33 Master's programs, all accredited by NVAO, along with doctoral degrees. The university also hosts numerous tech events, competitions, and research activities.

Achievements and Alumni
TU Delft ranks in Europe’s top 20 universities and top 3 in the Netherlands. It boasts over 7,000 research publications and notable alumni, including Nobel laureates Jacobus Henricus van 't Hoff and Simon van der Meer, and industrialist Gerard Philips.

Students and Industry Connections
With over 19,000 students and 3,300 researchers supported by 2,200 staff, TU Delft promotes international diversity and industry-ready skills. Leading companies like Google, Siemens, and Apple actively recruit from the university.

fields.name: Georgia State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1913 as a night school, Georgia State University evolved into a major urban public research university in Atlanta. It's affiliated with organizations like Oak Ridge Associated Universities, UIA, PIT-UN, and is a Space Grant College. In global rankings, it falls within #751-800 (QS), #401-500 (THE), and #477 (US News).

Campuses & Academics
GSU has 6 campuses and 12 colleges/schools, offering over 200 degree programs across 100+ fields, 30+ associate degree pathways, and 70+ study abroad options in 30+ countries.

Achievements & Alumni
Following its 2015 merger with Georgia Perimeter College, GSU grew to 7 campuses and over 54,000 students—the largest in Georgia. With a 252% increase in research funding and a $2.8B economic impact, it ranks among the fastest-growing research universities in the U.S. Notable alumni include musician ABRA, activist Yolo Akili, and artist Amalia Amaki.

Student Body & Career Opportunities
International students make up over 5% of the 30,000+ student body, representing 100+ countries. The university’s Career Service Center connects students with employers like Amazon, IBM, Deloitte, Coca-Cola, Delta Airlines, NCR, and AT&T through career fairs and support services.

fields.name: DePaul University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1898 by the Vincentians as St. Vincent’s College, DePaul University is the largest Catholic research university in the U.S. It became DePaul University in 1907, admitted its first women students in 1911, and earned academic accreditation in 1916. Known for a global, urban education, DePaul is affiliated with ACCU, NAICU, CIC, and Space Grant. It ranks #124 nationally and #1303 globally (US News 2022).

Campuses & Programs
DePaul has two Chicago campuses: Lincoln Park, near Lake Michigan, houses Liberal Arts, Sciences, Education, Music, Theater, and the main library; Loop Campus, in the business district, hosts Communication, Digital Media, Law, Public Service, and Business colleges. The university offers 130+ undergraduate majors and 175+ graduate programs, plus online courses and continuing education.

Achievements & Alumni
With over 23,000 students, DePaul is classified as an R2 Doctoral University and recognized as one of the nation’s Most Innovative Schools (US News) and Best Value Colleges (Forbes). It has received diversity awards and ranks #22 for best workplaces for women and diverse managers. Notable alumni include former Chicago Mayor Michael A. Bilandic, basketball player Stanley Brundy, and actor Tom Amandes.

Student Diversity & Career Opportunities
DePaul enrolls about 22,000 students, including 1,300 international students from 60+ countries, with women comprising over 50%. The university emphasizes career readiness, with 90%+ graduates employed within six months. Major recruiters include JP Morgan Chase, Accenture, EY, Deloitte, Google, Amazon, Microsoft, United Airlines, and McDonald’s.

fields.name: Georgian College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1967, Georgian College is Ontario’s first college recognized by Ashoka U as a changemaker institution for social innovation. It is accredited by the Canadian Association for Co-operative Education (CAFCE) for 12 co-op programs—the highest standard in Canada.

Campus & Courses
With seven campuses across Ontario, including its largest in Barrie, Georgian offers programs from apprenticeships to bachelor’s and graduate certificates. It has 13,000 full-time students, including 4,500+ international students from 85+ countries.

Achievements & Alumni
Georgian boasts an 85.8% graduate employment rate, consistently exceeding the provincial average for over 20 years. It has been named Ontario’s top co-op college and has over 90,000 alumni worldwide.

Student Diversity & Placements
Students at Georgian represent 85+ countries and speak over 110 languages. About half are under 25, and gender distribution is equal. The college emphasizes practical learning, career readiness, and strong employer satisfaction.

fields.name: Ghent University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1817 by King William I, Ghent University is one of Belgium’s top institutions and ranks among the world’s top 100 universities. It is affiliated with CESAER, EUA, The Guild, and the S Group. Global rankings place it at #141 (QS), #96 (THE), and #92 (US News).

Campus & Academics
Located in Flanders, with a Global Campus in South Korea, Ghent University has 11 faculties and over 130 departments, offering 200+ programs. It is known for cutting-edge research in biotechnology, microelectronics, aquaculture, and history.

Achievements & Alumni
Ghent supports major research networks like the Belgian Coordinated Collections of Microorganisms and the VIB. Notable alumni include Leo Baekeland (inventor of Bakelite), historian Wim Blockmans, and biotech pioneer Thierry Bogaert.

Student Diversity & Career Support
International students make up over 14% of the 49,000+ student body, with 6,800 students from 100+ countries. The Career Service Center connects students with top employers like Deloitte, UZ Ghent, and KU Leuven through career fairs and resume-building support.

fields.name: DeVry University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
DeVry University, founded in 1931 by Herman A. DeVry in Naperville, Illinois, began as the DeForest Training School in Chicago. It gained university status in 2002 and is owned by Cogswell Education LLC. Accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, Council of Higher Education Accreditation, and others, DeVry ranks #119-157 among regional universities in 2022.

Campuses, Programs, and Courses
DeVry operates 45 campuses across 17 U.S. states, including California, Texas, New York, and Illinois. It offers associate, undergraduate, and graduate programs through five schools in fields like Business, Social Sciences, Technology, Media, Liberal Arts, and Healthcare.

Achievements and Alumni
Known for its top-ranked online programs (per Newsweek), DeVry provides over $57 million annually in financial aid. Notable alumni include politician Sean David Wiley, wrestler Adeline Maria Gray, and game designer Steve Cartwright.

Student Body and Employers
With around 18,000 students (13,000 undergrad, 4,000+ grad) and a 14:1 student-faculty ratio, DeVry’s diverse campus attracts recruiters from major companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Google, IBM, and JPMorgan Chase.

fields.name: Douglas College
fields.about:
Douglas College Overview

Established in 1970, Douglas College is the largest public degree-granting college in British Columbia. It offers undergraduate degrees and career-focused programs in arts, sciences, business, healthcare, and human services.

Campuses and Academics

The college has two campuses: the main one in New Westminster and another in Coquitlam (David Lam Campus). It houses six academic faculties, including Business, Health Sciences, Humanities, and Science & Technology. Students can choose on-campus housing at New Westminster or nearby off-campus options.

Student Life and Achievements

Douglas hosts a vibrant, diverse student community, with international students from around the world. Its varsity teams, the Royals, compete in sports like basketball, soccer, and volleyball, with Roary the Lion as their mascot. Notable alumni include poet Elizabeth Bachinsky and author Carleigh Baker.

Career and Diversity

Douglas emphasizes global diversity and has strong graduate employment rates, with many students placed shortly after completing their studies.

fields.name: Drew University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1867 in Madison, New Jersey, Drew University began as Drew Theological Seminary. The College of Liberal Arts (originally Brothers College) was established in 1928, and the Casperson School of Graduate Studies opened in 1955. Drew is affiliated with several educational organizations, including the National Association of Schools and Colleges of the Methodist Church. In 2022, U.S. News ranked Drew 111th among top liberal arts colleges.

Campus, Facilities, and Academics
Drew’s scenic wooded campus, called the Forest, is a 10-minute walk from Madison train station, offering easy access to Manhattan. The university supports 20 NCAA Division III varsity sports and offers free fitness facilities and recreational events like Quidditch and Dodgeball. Academically, Drew includes the College of Liberal Arts (offering 50+ Bachelor’s degrees), the School of Theology, and the Casperson School of Graduate Studies, which provide Master’s and PhD programs. Theological studies and graduate programs receive national acclaim. Drew also offers 16 pre-professional and 18 dual-degree programs.

Achievements and Alumni
With over 150 years of history, Drew has grown from 12 students to 2,200. It has been named “Best Value” by the Princeton Review for four years and ranks among Kiplinger’s top 100 Best College Values. The Princeton Review also lists Drew among the top 50 "Colleges That Create Futures." The strong alumni network supports internships and job placements. Notable alumni include Clint Bolick, Damon DiMarco, James Fiorentino, Hae Jong Kim, and Kevin Murphy.

Diversity and Employers
Drew enrolls over 2,000 students annually, including 380+ international students, mostly undergraduates, fostering a diverse campus community. Prominent recruiters include IBM, VISA, the United Nations, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

fields.name: Drexel University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1891 by Anthony J. Drexel, Drexel University is one of America’s 15 largest private universities. It became a full university in 1970 and is known for its strong cooperative education programs. Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, Drexel is affiliated with AITU and NAICU. It ranks #103 nationally and #354 globally (US News 2022) and is placed #651-700 in the QS World University Rankings.

Campuses and Programs
Drexel has six campuses, including University City, Centre City, Queen Lane, Academy of Natural Sciences, Malvern (Lebrow College of Business), and West Reading (College of Medicine). The university offers over 80 undergraduate majors and 120 graduate programs, taught by experienced faculty, emphasizing both academics and practical learning.

Achievements and Alumni
Drexel supports a $20 million endowment for clinical research and hosts diverse research programs. Its entrepreneurship program combines education with real-world experience. Graduates have a 94% employment or further education rate, earning 15.1% above the national average. Notable alumni include Violet Oakley (artist), Paul Baran (Internet pioneer), Josh Woodland (barcode inventor), NBA player Michael Anderson, and Rohm and Haas CEO Raj Gupta.

Student Diversity and Employers
With about 14,000 students and a 17:1 student-faculty ratio, Drexel welcomes 18% international students from six continents. The Student Centre for Diversity and Inclusion supports LGBTQIA, AHALANA, and international communities. Top employers recruiting Drexel graduates include Facebook, PwC, Deloitte, Amazon, and Accenture.

fields.name: Dublin Business School
fields.about:
Dublin Business School (DBS)
Founded in 1975 as an Accounting and Business College, Dublin Business School is a private institution located in Dublin, Ireland. Renamed in 1999 after acquiring LSB College, DBS is known for its career-focused education in a calm residential setting. Its programs are accredited by QQI and affiliated with HETAC and Liverpool John Moores University.

Campus and Courses
DBS operates across six campuses in Dublin, with its main hub on Aungier Street. Facilities include modern classrooms, labs, libraries, and cafes. The school emphasizes sustainability and energy efficiency. DBS offers a range of Master’s degrees, postgraduate diplomas, and undergraduate programs designed to equip students with industry-relevant and transferable skills.

Notable Alumni and Industry Links
DBS prioritizes accessible, high-quality education aligned with professional standards. Prominent alumni include songwriter Paul Connolly and media personalities Ray Shah and Ann Gleeson. Graduates are recruited by top firms like Google, Microsoft, Accenture, and Bank of Ireland.

Student Diversity
Hosting students from over 75 countries, DBS offers more than 70 programs tailored to international learners.

fields.name: Harrisburg University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 2001, Harrisburg University is the first independent, non-profit university established in Pennsylvania in over 100 years. It is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and ranked #131–171 among Regional Universities North by U.S. News & World Report. A new Health Science Education Center with 260,000 sq. ft. of academic space is currently under development.

Campus, Programs & Facilities
Harrisburg University offers modern infrastructure, including residence halls, labs, and libraries, with a satellite campus in Philadelphia opened in 2017. The Philadelphia campus focuses on interactive media, computer science, and graduate programs in design and technopreneurship. The university emphasizes sustainability and offers affordable private education with degrees at the bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral levels across various disciplines.

Achievements & Alumni
HU specializes in applied sciences, engineering, and technology programs. Its accreditation was recently reaffirmed. Notable alumni include Timothy DeFoor, Pennsylvania’s Auditor General.

Diversity & Recruiters
With nearly 7,000 students from 102 countries, HU boasts a highly diverse student body. Top recruiters include Telcom Insurance Group, Mitsubishi, Honda, and Sony.

fields.name: Harvard University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1636, Harvard University is the oldest university in the U.S. and a prestigious member of the Ivy League. Originally called "New College," it was renamed after Rev. John Harvard. With nearly 400 years of academic excellence, Harvard has produced numerous Nobel Laureates, Pulitzer Prize winners, and global leaders. It is affiliated with AAU, NAICU, AICUM, and is a U.S. space-grant university. Globally, Harvard ranks #1 in US News, #=2 in THE, and #5 in QS World Rankings (2022).

Campus, Infrastructure & Courses
Located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard spans 209 acres and includes the iconic “Harvard Yard.” The campus features 28 libraries—the largest private library system in the world—and 15 museums. Harvard comprises an undergraduate college, 12 graduate/professional schools, and the Harvard Radcliffe Institute. It also offers global access to learning through HarvardX, its online platform with 4M+ learners. Programs span humanities, law, science, business, medicine, and more.

Achievements & Alumni
Harvard is known for groundbreaking research and a history of innovation. It introduced medical studies in 1782, law in 1816, and continues to evolve with global learning initiatives. Its alumni network exceeds 400,000 and includes 48 Nobel Laureates, 32 heads of state, and global icons like John F. Kennedy, Mark Zuckerberg, Natalie Portman, and Sheryl Sandberg.

Student Diversity & Career Opportunities
Harvard hosts over 23,700 students from all 50 U.S. states and 180+ countries. It teaches 80+ languages and supports inclusion and belonging. With over 5,000 scholars and 16,000+ students in Harvard Extension School, it offers broad academic access. Top employers include Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Apple, BCG, IBM, and Tesla. The Office of Career Services supports students in internships, job searches, resume building, and career mentoring.

fields.name: HEC Montreal
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1907 in Montreal, HEC Montréal is Canada’s first business and management school. It pioneered the Case Method in collaboration with Harvard University in 1932 and welcomed its first female student in 1943. The school holds prestigious accreditations from EQUIS, AACSB, and AMBA, making it one of the few business schools with the triple crown of accreditation. It is affiliated with Universities Canada, Conférence des Grandes Écoles (CGE), and CBIE. HEC Montréal consistently ranks among the top 5 business schools in Canada and within the top 100 globally for business education.

Campus, Infrastructure & Programs
Located at the Côte-Sainte-Catherine Campus, HEC Montréal features modern classrooms and advanced learning facilities. It offers a wide range of programs including:

BBA

MBA and Executive MBA (in collaboration with McGill University)

MSc in Administration

Master of Management, International Arts Management, and Doctorate in Administration

Graduate diplomas, short-term programs, and professional certificates
Online learning options are also available for many courses.

Accomplishments & Notable Alumni
HEC Montréal is internationally recognized for excellence in business education. Its MBA program ranks #2 in Canada (Bloomberg Businessweek) and #84 globally (The Economist). Forbes ranked it 17th worldwide among non-U.S. business schools in 2016. The school boasts 87,000+ alumni, including:

Antonio Arnault – CEO, Berluti

Louis R. Chênevert – Former CEO, United Technologies

François Desjardins – CEO, B2B Bank

Student Diversity & Recruiters
With 14,299 students, including 3,746 international students from 142 countries, HEC Montréal has a diverse and global student body. The school has a strong international exchange program and high employability rates. Top recruiters include:
Desjardins, Deloitte, KPMG Canada, National Bank of Canada, and others.

fields.name: Dublin City University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Dublin City University (DCU), founded in 1975 as the National Institute for Higher Education, became a university in 1989. In 2016, it merged with the Church of Ireland College of Education, All Hallows College, Mater Dei Institute of Education, and St Patrick’s College. DCU is endorsed by organizations like the AACSB, EUA, and IUA. It ranks 19th globally for graduate employment, with a strong position in Ireland. DCU's QS ranking improved slightly from 422nd in 2017 to 439th in 2021.

Campuses and Courses
DCU operates five campuses: the main campus (50 acres), Sports Campus (35 acres), DCU Alpha Innovation Campus (10 acres), St Patrick’s Campus, and All Hallows Campus. Key faculties include Business, Engineering & Computing, Humanities & Social Sciences, Education, and Science & Health. Popular programs include Engineering, Business, Nursing, Psychology, and Biotechnology.

Accomplishments and Alumni
DCU hosts Ireland's first purpose-built university nursing school and the European Master of Business Informatics program. It also administers Ireland's actuarial exams and the Graduate Management Admission Test. Recognized in international rankings, DCU is the only Irish university in the QS Top 50 for young institutions. Notable alumni include Google CMO Sr. Lorraine Twohill, politician Enda Kenny, and humanitarian Orla Tracey.

Student Diversity and Visiting Companies
DCU's student body includes over 15% international students from 70+ countries. The university fosters global education through exchanges and collaborative programs. Companies like Accenture, Amazon, Pfizer, Deloitte, and the Central Bank of Ireland regularly attend DCU’s job fairs.

They aren’t just entering the workforce—they’re stepping into roles as future leaders, ready to make a meaningful impact on the global business landscape.

fields.name: Goethe University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1914 in Frankfurt, Germany, Goethe University is a public institution known for its inclusive governance model. It was elevated to university status in 1932 and ranked #311 in the QS World University Rankings 2021.

Campus & Academics
With over 48,000 students, including 7,500 international learners, Goethe offers full-time and part-time programs across disciplines like Finance, Law, Humanities, Sciences, Psychology, and Health. The university spans four campuses: Westend (main), Bockenheim (library and labs), Riedberg (natural sciences), and Niederrad (medical faculty).

Achievements & Alumni
Goethe University is known for interdisciplinary research and accessible, high-quality education. Notable alumni include Nobel laureate Paul Ehrlich, social psychologist Rolf van Dick, and Walter Hallstein, the first President of the European Commission.

Student Diversity & Career Support
With a strong international student presence, the university fosters global learning and innovation, supported by expert faculty and a wide range of academic and research opportunities.

fields.name: Duke University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Duke University, founded in 1838 by Quakers and Methodists, moved from Trinity to Durham, NC, in 1892. Accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACSCOC), Duke is consistently ranked among the top global universities. In 2022, QS ranked it 52nd, US News ranked it 9th, and THE ranked it 23rd.

Campus and Programs
Duke's main campus spans 9,000 acres with three sub-campuses: East Campus for freshmen, West Campus (720 acres) for undergraduates, and Central Campus (200 acres). It also has a marine lab in Beaufort, NC, and the Sarah P. Duke Gardens. Known for its Gothic architecture, Duke offers a low student-to-faculty ratio of 8:1, with 75% of classes having fewer than 20 students. The university has 10 schools, including the Fuqua School of Business, Pratt School of Engineering, and the Duke School of Medicine.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Duke boasts notable academic achievements, including producing three Rhodes Scholars (2002, 2006) and spending over $1 billion annually on research. The university is home to three Turing Award winners and 13 Nobel Laureates. Well-known alumni include Carlos Boozer, Melinda Gates, and Ron Paul. Duke researchers also developed the first practical invisibility cloak in 2006.

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
With students from over 120 countries, Duke offers diverse academic and cultural experiences. Its highly selective admissions process (5.7% acceptance rate) reflects its strong reputation. Duke’s excellent career services connect students with top employers, including Microsoft, Accenture, and Deloitte.

fields.name: Golden Gate University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Established in 1901 as the YMCA Evening Law School, Golden Gate University (GGU) pioneered California's first evening law program. Today, GGU is a leading institution for professional education in Business, Law, Taxation, and Accounting. It is accredited by WASC (WSCUC), alongside institutions like Stanford and UC Berkeley, and ranked #163 in PayScale’s College Salary Report.

Campuses & Courses
GGU has campuses in San Francisco (main), Silicon Valley, and Seattle. The San Francisco campus is located in the financial district with access to libraries, legal clinics, and public transit. The Seattle and Silicon Valley campuses offer evening and weekend classes in programs such as Taxation, HR Management, and Executive MPA.

Achievements & Alumni
Accredited by WSCUC, ABA, and AALS, GGU was among the first to launch online programs in 1996. It has over 68,000 alumni, including notable names like Richard Belluzzo (former COO, Microsoft), Joan Blades (co-founder, MoveOn.org), and J.J. Jelincic (CalPERS).

Student Diversity & Recruiters
GGU serves 583 undergraduates, 1,800 graduate students, and 700+ law students. About 62% of students are from diverse backgrounds, 64% are women, and 12% are international students from 47 countries. The average student age is 34. Recruiters include Accenture, Microsoft, Lenovo, and NID.

fields.name: Gonzaga University
fields.about:
Located in Spokane, Washington, Gonzaga University is a private Roman Catholic institution founded in 1887 and granted university status in 1912. Accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities, it is recognized as one of the top multidimensional universities in the U.S.

Spread across 152 acres near the Spokane River, the campus features 105 buildings, including two major libraries: Foley Center Library and Chastek Law Library. The university emphasizes academic excellence, personal growth, and social justice rooted in Catholic tradition.

Gonzaga offers a wide range of programs in fields such as Law, Medicine, Nursing, Divinity, Liberal Arts, and Dentistry. It also supports an Army ROTC program and collaborates with Bishop White Seminary for priesthood training. In addition to academics, the university promotes student engagement through various intramural and club sports.

fields.name: HEC Paris
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1881, HEC Paris is one of Europe's most prestigious business schools. Located in Jouy-en-Josas, a suburb of Paris, it spans a 250-acre campus. In 1988, HEC co-founded the CEMS network alongside ESADE, Bocconi, and Cologne University. It is affiliated with CGE and Paris-Saclay University.
HEC Paris ranks #1 in Europe in the Financial Times European Business Schools 2021 and holds the #1 global ranking for its Executive MBA program.

Infrastructure, Campus & Courses
Just 16 km from Paris, the HEC Paris campus features modern facilities including dining venues, sports grounds, and scenic lakes.
It offers a wide range of programs including MBA, Masters in Management, MSc programs, PhDs, executive education, and Summer Schools with specializations in finance, geopolitics, fashion, entertainment, and more. The school is also known for its strong research in partnership with institutions like IP Paris.

Accomplishments & Alumni
HEC Paris is home to 120 world-class professors and top-tier research centers like HI! Paris, S&O Institute, and the Innovation & Entrepreneurship Center.
Its MBA program is ranked #11 globally by Financial Times 2022.
The 68,000+ alumni network includes:

Emmanuel Faber (Business Leader)

Nadia Fettah Alaoui (Finance Minister of Morocco)

Édith Cresson (France’s first female Prime Minister)

Student Diversity & Recruiters
HEC Paris welcomes 4,500+ students in degree programs and 8,000+ executives annually.
Students come from 111+ countries, and the school has 125+ academic partners worldwide for exchange programs.
Top recruiters include Google, Amazon, L'Oréal, BCG, Atos, and more.

fields.name: Heidelberg University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Heidelberg University, officially known as the Ruprecht Karl University of Heidelberg, is a prestigious public research university established in 1386, making it the oldest university in Germany and one of the oldest in Europe. It is also recognized as the third university in the Roman Empire. The institution became co-educational in 1899, although teaching had commenced the same year it was founded.

Throughout its long history, the university has played a pivotal role in shaping academic disciplines. In the 19th century, it significantly expanded its academic portfolio by adding Natural Sciences, Medicine, and Astronomy to its core disciplines.

Heidelberg is a founding member of several distinguished academic networks, including:

League of European Research Universities (LERU)

Coimbra Group

European University Association (EUA)

It also maintains strategic affiliations with numerous research and educational institutions such as:

Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)

University Hospital Heidelberg & Mannheim

Confucius Institute at Heidelberg University

German-American Institute

European Center for Linguistics

In terms of global reputation, Heidelberg consistently ranks among the top universities:

#63 in QS World University Rankings 2022

#=42 in THE World University Rankings 2022

#54 in U.S. News Best Global Universities 2022

These rankings reflect its academic excellence, strong research output, and commitment to international collaboration.

Visit the official university website.

Click on ‘Apply Now’ or ‘Register Here’ depending on the program type and your applicant status.

Proof of English language proficiency (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) or German proficiency (depending on the program)

Letters of Recommendation from academic or professional references

Statement of Purpose (SOP) detailing academic interests and career objectives

fields.name: Hochschule Bremen - International Graduate Center
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 2004 in the city of Bremen, Germany, Hochschule Bremen – International Graduate Center (IGC) is an interdisciplinary graduate school specializing in management and leadership education. It was the first graduate school in Germany to offer an MBA degree.

IGC holds prestigious international accreditations from:

AACSB (Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business)

EFMD (European Foundation for Management Development)

It is also part of the International Business School Alliance (IBSA), collaborating with:

ESSCA School of Management, France

University of Hertfordshire Business School, UK

Cameron School of Business, University of North Carolina Wilmington, USA

Faculty of Economics, University of Valencia, Spain

Additionally, the University of Bremen, to which IGC is affiliated, ranks in the 571–580 band in the QS World University Rankings.

Infrastructure, Campus, and Courses
Located in Bremen, often referred to as the “City of Science”, the IGC campus features modern infrastructure, including:

Academic blocks

Libraries

Sports and recreation centers

The center offers six full-time international MBA and Master’s programs, all taught in English. Program durations range from 1 to 2 years, designed to prepare students for leadership roles in global business settings.

Accomplishments and Alumni
IGC produces over 2,000 graduates annually. The school has earned recognition from:

The HRK (German Rectors' Conference) in 2012

Acknowledgement for efforts in Sustainability and CSR in 2014

Notable alumni include:

Hannah Weatherman – Supply Chain Analyst

Akshat Dhankhar – Engineer

Selma Shiyanga – International Recruitment Consultant

Luis Fernando Quiceno and Fjorinda Baholli

Student Diversity and Visiting Companies
IGC boasts a vibrant student body of 500+ international students from 60 countries. This diverse environment enhances global exposure and cross-cultural learning.

Top companies that recruit from IGC include:

Andersen Lab

Lufthansa

Amazon

Deloitte

Volkswagen Group Services

fields.name: Hochschule Fulda University of Applied Sciences
fields.about:
Location:
Fulda University of Applied Sciences is situated in the historic and culturally rich city of Fulda, located in the state of Hesse in southwest Germany. The city offers a blend of academic vibrancy and scenic charm, making it an ideal location for student life.

Establishment:
The university was established in 1974 and is recognized as the fifth state University of Applied Sciences in Hesse. Since its inception, it has grown into a prominent institution for applied sciences and research.

Academic Programs:
Fulda University offers over 60 study programs across eight academic departments, including:

Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees

Integrated and dual degree programs

Part-time and continuing education courses

These programs are tailored to equip students with practical knowledge and interdisciplinary skills that are relevant in today's global workforce.

International Outlook:
The university maintains a strong international presence, with 1,862 international students enrolled from around the world. It provides a welcoming, globally-oriented campus environment and numerous English-taught programs, making it highly attractive for students seeking international education in Germany.

Research Excellence:
Fulda University of Applied Sciences is among Germany’s leading research-focused universities of applied sciences. With a team of over 160 professors and 850 employees, it plays an active role in applied research and development, fostering innovation across multiple disciplines.

fields.name: Hochschule Furtwangen University
fields.about:
Establishment & History:
Founded in 1850 by Robert Gerwing as a clock-making school, Hochschule Furtwangen University (HFU) is among the oldest and most historically significant institutions in Germany. Having endured both World Wars and the civil war, HFU evolved into a technical institution and later split into two divisions – academic and training – post World War II.

Campuses & Academic Structure:
HFU operates across three campuses:

Furtwangen Campus (Main): Offers programs in Digital Media, Health & Safety, Computer Science, Mechanical and Medical Engineering, Business Information Systems, and Business Administration and Engineering.

Villingen-Schwenningen Campus: Focuses on Medical Engineering and Business Administration.

Tuttlingen Campus: Established in 2009, this campus offers programs centered on Industrial Technology.

Programs & Disciplines:
HFU provides 50+ bachelor’s and master’s programs across disciplines such as:

Engineering

Computer Science

Medical and Health Sciences

Digital Media

Business and Industrial Technology

The university follows a research-oriented curriculum that integrates practical learning experiences.

Accreditations & Affiliations:
HFU holds prestigious accreditations from:

ACQUIN (Accreditation-Certification and Quality Assurance Institute)

ASIIN (Accreditation Agency for Engineering, Informatics, Natural Sciences, Mathematics)

Affiliations include:

GATE-Germany

International Organization of Lake Constance Universities (IBH)

Trinational Metropolitan Upper Rhine Region (TMO)

Global Partnerships:
With partnerships with over 142 international universities, HFU fosters strong global academic exchange and collaboration.

Student Body & Faculty:

Total students: 6,073

Full-time faculty: 571

Rankings & Recognition:

#62 in Germany (DAAD Ranking)

Recognized particularly for excellence in Computer Science and Business Administration

fields.name: Hult International Business School
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Hult traces its roots to the Arthur D. Little School of Management (1964, USA) and Ashridge Business School (1959, UK). It gained full accreditation in 1976 and is now globally recognized, holding triple accreditation (AACSB, AMBA, EQUIS). It ranks #17 by The Economist and #19 by Times Higher Education for global business education.

🌍 Campuses & Programs
Hult operates 7 campuses in 6 countries, including major hubs in Boston, London, San Francisco, Shanghai, Dubai, New York, and the Ashridge Estate (UK). It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and executive education, all taught in English and accredited in both the US and UK.

🏆 Achievements & Alumni
Hult is the first U.S. business school with triple accreditation and won the Best Business School Careers Strategy award (2020) by AMBA & BGA. Notable alumni include Htin Kyaw (former President of Myanmar), Luis Abinader (President of the Dominican Republic), and Gary Smith (CEO of Ciena).

🌐 Diversity & Career Opportunities
With over 2,700 students from 130+ countries, Hult fosters a truly global learning environment. Its strong industry links attract top recruiters like Amazon, Google, and Deloitte.

fields.name: Humber College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1967, Humber College was part of Ontario’s initiative to offer accessible, career-focused education through its Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology. Over time, Humber has evolved into a dynamic institution at the intersection of industry, education, and society. It is affiliated with Colleges and Institutes Canada, Universities Canada, Canadian Bureau for International Education, and the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association. As of recent rankings, Humber holds the 6th position among Canada’s Top 50 Research Colleges.

Campus, Infrastructure & Courses
Humber has three main campuses—North, Lakeshore, and Orangeville. It was the first Ontario college to offer a joint Nursing Diploma with the University of New Brunswick and to earn a Silver rating in STARS (Sustainability Tracking Assessment Rating System). The college comprises six faculties, offering a wide range of full-time, diploma, and specialized Bridge Training programs in areas like Engineering, Business, Media, Health Sciences, and Liberal Arts.

Accomplishments & Alumni
Humber boasts Ontario’s most successful collegiate sports program and was recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers in 2016. Radio Humber was Canada’s first station to play 100% Canadian content. Notable alumni include Greg Wells (Music Producer), Nathan Fielder (Comedian/Actor), and Nicole Arbour (YouTuber/Comedian).

Student Diversity & Recruitment
Humber attracts over 71,000 applications annually, including 4,100+ international students from 100+ countries. Its culturally diverse environment is supported by strong industry connections, with top recruiters like Amazon, Walmart, CISCO, MAGNA, FESTO, and KUKA hiring from campus.

fields.name: Durham College
fields.about:
History and Overview
Founded in 1967, Durham College (DC) has a long-standing commitment to student success, practical education, and strong community ties. Originally opening with 205 students in 16 portable classrooms, DC has grown significantly, offering programs in applied arts, business, and technology. The college was part of a provincial initiative launched by then-Education Minister Bill Davis to establish career-focused institutions across Ontario.

Campuses and Programs
DC has main campuses in Oshawa and Whitby, with additional outreach in Uxbridge, Port Hope, Port Perry, Beaverton, and Bowmanville. It offers a wide range of full-time programs in fields like business, IT, media, arts, science, skilled trades, health, and engineering technology, as well as certifications and online courses in areas such as cooking, sewing, and fashion.

Facilities and Infrastructure
Durham campuses are equipped with modern amenities including housing, health services, recreational facilities, food outlets, and transportation. It shares infrastructure with Ontario Tech University, enabling advanced digital learning tools and wireless access.

Affiliations and Rankings
Durham College is affiliated with organizations such as the Canadian Bureau for International Education, Colleges and Institutes Canada, and the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association. It ranks among Canada’s top 50 research colleges, according to Research Infosource Inc.

Alumni and Achievements
DC has produced notable alumni including Loraxian Inc. founder Roland Kielbasiewicz, drag performer Sheldon McIntosh, Krautchan.net CEO Brandon Nolan, and aero-medical transport advocate Patricia O’Connor.

Diversity and Employer Connections
The college celebrates cultural and equity-focused events like Black History Month, Pride, and International Women’s Day. The Office of Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion fosters an inclusive environment. Employers that frequently hire DC grads include Lakeridge Health, OPG, GM, Rogers, Scotiabank, and RBC.

fields.name: Humboldt University of Berlin
fields.about:
History and Affiliations
Founded in 1810 by Wilhelm and Alexander von Humboldt under a royal decree by King Frederick William III of Prussia, Humboldt University of Berlin (HU Berlin) is one of Germany’s oldest and most prestigious universities. Originally launched with faculties of Theology, Law, Medicine, and Philosophy, it quickly gained global prominence as a hub of intellectual and scientific advancement.

Despite challenges during the World Wars and division of Berlin, HU Berlin retained its academic legacy. Today, it’s affiliated with several research and educational institutes, such as:

Institute of Agricultural and Urban Ecology Projects (IASP)

Institute for Research on Cooperatives

Institute for Quality Management in Education (IQB)

Centre Marc Bloch

Rankings (2023)
Ranking Body	Position
QS World University Ranking	131
Times Higher Education (THE)	82
US News & World Report	61

Campus, Infrastructure, and Faculties
Humboldt University comprises nine faculties, including:

Law

Mathematics & Natural Sciences

Life Sciences

Philosophy I & II

Theology

Economics & Business Administration

Humanities & Social Sciences

Medicine (Charité – in partnership)

Student Diversity & Top Recruiters
HU Berlin is home to students from over 100 nations, offering an inclusive and multicultural learning environment. It partners with global employers and institutions for student placements and internships.

Top Recruiters include:

Queen Mary University of London

AMERA International

European College of Business and Management

International Development Ireland

Humboldt University (internal placements)

Notable Alumni
Some of the university’s most distinguished alumni include:

Karl Marx – Philosopher, Political Theorist

Max Planck – Physicist, Nobel Laureate

Angela Merkel – Former Chancellor of Germany

Hannah Arendt – Political Theorist

Robert Koch – Nobel Prize-winning Microbiologist

Otto von Bismarck – First Chancellor of the German Empire

Scholarships for International Students
Scholarship	For Whom	Value
Deutschlandstipendium	Bachelor’s & Master’s	€300/month (min. 2 semesters)
Elsa-Neumann-Scholarship	Doctoral candidates	€1,350/month + €100 for materials
Humboldt Research Track Scholarship	Master’s to Doctorate students	€800/month (+child benefits)
Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters	PG & PhD students	€1,000/month + travel/installation
Hani Zeini Scholarship	UG & PG students	One-time €915

Part-Time Job Opportunities
Students at HU Berlin can work part-time in roles such as:

Research Scholar – €33/hour

Support Staff – €25/hour

English Tutor – €26/hour

Research Assistant – €19/hour

Production Assistant – €11/hour

Post-Study Work Options in Germany
Graduates can apply for an 18-month post-study work visa (Aufenthaltserlaubnis zur Arbeitsplatzsuche) to find employment in their field. Requirements include:

Proof of degree completion

Financial means

Health insurance

Application to the local Foreigners' Office (Ausländerbehörde)

Popular Employment Sectors
Marketing & Sales

Legal and Teaching Professions

Finance and IT

Public Health & Medical Fields

Aviation and Logistics

Student Visa Options for Germany
Visa Type	Duration
Standard Student Visa	3 months (extendable)
Student Applicant Visa	3–6 months (pre-admission)
Language Course Visa	Up to 12 months

Founded in 1960 in Allendale, Michigan, GVSU was established to meet the region's need for a state-funded college. It is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and consistently ranked among the top Midwest public universities by U.S. News & World Report. Key rankings include:

#3 Top Public School

#8 Most Innovative Schools

#20 Best Colleges for Veterans

#21 Best Value Schools

#58 Top Performers on Social Mobility

#60 Best Undergraduate Engineering Programs

GVSU's main campus spans 1,322 acres in Allendale. Additional campuses include the Robert C. Pew Campus and Health Campus in Grand Rapids, Meijer Campus, Detroit Center, and regional centers in Muskegon, Traverse City, and Battle Creek. The university offers 146 programs across disciplines like Arts, Sciences, Business, Health, Data Science, Sociology, and Sports Management.

Achievements & Alumni:
Recognized for sustainability, GVSU has been listed among The Princeton Review’s “Most Environmentally Responsible Colleges.” With over 130,000 alumni worldwide, the university fosters strong alumni relations through scholarships, career support, and engagement programs.

Student Diversity & Outcomes:
GVSU hosts over 22,000 students from 67+ countries, with an average class size of 26 to ensure personalized learning. About 90% of graduates are employed or enrolled in graduate programs shortly after completing their degrees.

fields.about:
History & Rankings:
Established in 1971 and named after Sir Samuel Griffith, the university pioneered Australia’s first degrees in environmental science and Asian studies. It ranks among the top 2% of universities worldwide, with QS rankings at #290 (2022) and #300 (2023), and Times Higher Education rankings between #201–300.

Campuses & Courses:
Griffith has five campuses across South East Queensland—Gold Coast, Logan, Mt Gravatt, Nathan, and South Bank—plus a digital campus. It offers 200+ undergraduate and postgraduate programs with modern facilities and on-campus housing options.

Achievements & Alumni:
Griffith is known for innovation and research, with world-standard output in 50+ disciplines. It has won the most Australian Awards for University Teaching since 2012. Notable alumni include pop icon Dami Im and disability advocate Dr. Antoni Tsaputra.

Diversity & Career Outcomes:
Home to over 8,500 international students and 200,000+ alumni from 130 countries, Griffith supports LGBTIQ+ students through inclusive initiatives. Top recruiters include Deloitte, BHP, Rio Tinto, and Virgin Australia.

fields.name: Eastern Michigan University
fields.about:
Eastern Michigan University (EMU)
Located in Ypsilanti, Michigan, EMU is a public research university founded in 1849 as Michigan State Normal School. It became the first U.S. normal school to offer a four-year curriculum in 1899 and was renamed Eastern Michigan University in 1959. EMU is currently ranked #299–391 in National Universities by U.S. News.

Campus and Academics
EMU’s 800-acre campus includes 122 buildings with modern classrooms, labs, libraries, and sports facilities. It offers undergraduate, graduate, and online programs across various colleges, including Arts & Sciences, Business, Education, Health & Human Services, Engineering & Technology, the Graduate School, and the Honors College. All programs are accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.

Achievements and Alumni
EMU is recognized for excellence in teacher education and has one of the top 25 animation and gaming programs in the U.S. Faculty include many PhD holders and industry experts. Notable alumni include actor Jeff Daniels, physician John Harvey Kellogg, NFL star Antonio Gates, and NBA player Earl Boykins.

Student Life and Career Opportunities
The university supports student development through cultural events, sports, internships, and industry workshops. It attracts a diverse international student body. Top employers of EMU graduates include Ford, Amazon, Quicken Loans, and Michigan Medicine.

fields.name: École Normale Supérieure (ENS)
fields.about:
École Normale Supérieure – PSL (ENS Paris)
ENS Paris is a prestigious grande école located in the Latin Quarter of Paris and a founding member of the Paris Sciences et Lettres University (PSL). Established in 1794 during the French Revolution to train secondary school teachers, it was later reestablished by Napoleon and evolved into one of France’s leading academic institutions.

Affiliations and Rankings
ENS is part of the elite PSL Research University and a member of both the Conference of University Presidents and the Conference of Grandes Écoles. It ranks #23 in QS World University Rankings, #72 in ARWU, and #36 in UniPage.

Campuses and Facilities
ENS has three campuses: its historic Latin Quarter site, the Jourdan campus near Parc Montsouris, and the Montrouge campus. Facilities include libraries, student housing, and sports amenities.

Departments and Courses
ENS offers interdisciplinary education across around 15 departments, including Sciences, Literature, Philosophy, Economics, Social Sciences, Geography, and more. Students benefit from close involvement in research and personalized academic guidance.

Notable Alumni
ENS has produced renowned scholars and Nobel laureates, especially in mathematics and physics, including Évariste Galois, Henri Cartan, Jean-Pierre Serre, Cédric Villani, and Ngo Bao Chau.

Academics and Opportunities
ENS emphasizes foundational knowledge and interdisciplinary learning. Many top companies recruit from ENS, offering strong career opportunities for graduates.

fields.name: Ecole Polytechnique
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1794 during the French Revolution, École Polytechnique began as the École Centrale des Travaux Publics to address France's need for engineers and administrators. Today, it stands as one of France's most prestigious engineering schools, known for scientific excellence and public service. The institution is affiliated with the Conférence des Grandes Écoles (CGE) and the Ministry of the Armed Forces. It is ranked #61 globally in the QS World University Rankings and graduate employability rankings.

Campus, Infrastructure & Programs
Located 20 km south of Paris, the 160-hectare campus offers a vibrant environment with top-tier facilities, including a central library and cultural spaces. École Polytechnique offers a variety of high-level programs in science, technology, and engineering.

Achievements & Alumni
Renowned for cutting-edge research and innovation, the school has received numerous academic awards and recognitions. Its alumni network spans nearly 30,000 worldwide, with notable graduates including Bernard Arnault (CEO, LVMH), philosopher Auguste Comte, and mathematician Siméon Denis Poisson.

Student Life & Career Opportunities
With around 3,600 students from 70+ countries, the school fosters a close-knit international community. Over 250 student organizations offer diverse activities. Career prospects are strong, with 64% of students securing jobs before graduation and full employment within six months. Top recruiters include Google, McKinsey & Company, EDF, and Deloitte.

fields.name: EDHEC Business School
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1906 by entrepreneurs from northern France, EDHEC Business School’s name stands for "École des Hautes Études Commerciales du Nord." Its headquarters, known as "La Campagne," feature a historic Anglo-Norman manor originally built for the Motte Duthoit family. EDHEC holds triple accreditation from EQUIS, AACSB, and AMBA, and has ranked among the top ten European business schools by the Financial Times for four consecutive years.

Campuses and Programs
EDHEC operates campuses in Lille, Nice, Paris, London, and Singapore. The Lille campus, an eco-friendly and entrepreneurial hub, hosts the EDHEC Young Entrepreneurs Incubator and offers extensive facilities including lecture halls, sports areas, and restaurants. Popular programs include MBA, Finance, and Management.

Achievements and Alumni
EDHEC fosters innovation and integrity through applied research and diverse academic programs. With a multicultural community of 100 nationalities, it maintains strong global ties through exchanges and an active alumni network of over 160 ambassadors and 80 clubs. Notable alumni include Delphine Arnault, Jean-Jacques Goldman, and Sacha Poignonnec.

Student Diversity and Careers
With around 8,600 students representing over 110 nationalities, EDHEC offers courses in English and French. More than 80 student organizations encourage inclusion and entrepreneurship. The Career Centre connects students with top recruiters like EY, Deloitte, L'Oréal, Amazon, Accenture, Goldman Sachs, and J.P. Morgan.

fields.name: Edith Cowan University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Edith Cowan University (ECU) began in 1902 as Claremont Teachers College, Western Australia’s first tertiary institution. Over time, several colleges merged into the Western Australian College of Advanced Education, which became ECU in 1991. ECU is affiliated with the Association of Southeast Asian Institutions of Higher Learning and ranks globally between #401-700 across major university rankings in 2022.

Campuses, Facilities, and Courses
ECU has three campuses in Western Australia’s South West Region: Joondalup (headquarters), Mount Lawley, and Bunbury. Each offers modern facilities including 24/7 computer labs, libraries, wireless internet, and secure study spaces. On-campus housing is available at all locations. ECU comprises eight schools, such as Business and Law, Engineering, Medical Sciences, and the Western Australian Academy of Performing Arts, offering over 100 courses.

Achievements and Alumni
Since 1902, ECU has earned recognition for its impact, ranking in the top 50 globally for Gender Equality, Health and Wellbeing, and Quality Education in the 2021 Times Higher Education Impact rankings. Notable alumni include Ahmed Adeeb (former Vice President of the Maldives) and Darren Beazley (sports administrator).

Student Diversity and Career Support
ECU enrolls over 31,000 undergraduates, with 7,000 international students from 100+ countries. Women make up 56% of the student body. The university is known for preparing graduates to excel in demanding global job markets, with strong employer demand for ECU alumni.
