fields.name: Eindhoven University of Technology
fields.about:
Eindhoven University of Technology Overview

Founded in 1956, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e) is a leading public technical university in the Netherlands, second only to Delft University of Technology. Known for blending scientific curiosity with practical skills, TU/e ranks among the top 1% of universities globally for industry collaboration.

TU/e is part of several international networks like 4TU, CESAER, and EuroTech, maintaining strong ties with institutions such as Tokyo Institute of Technology and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. It is ranked 120th worldwide by QS World University Rankings 2022, placing 15th in the Netherlands.

The campus, located in Brainport Eindhoven—Europe’s tech hotspot—features 15 modern buildings, including an auditorium and sports center. TU/e offers bachelor’s and master’s programs across 10 departments, including Engineering, Applied Physics, Computer Science, and Industrial Design, with a focus on leadership and professional growth.

A top research university, TU/e collaborates closely with tech giants like Philips, ASML, and NXP. It helped establish EuroTeQ, a consortium of leading science and tech universities aimed at innovative engineering education. Notable alumni include journalist and hacker Jacob Appelbaum, politician Camiel Eurlings, and software developer Ton Roosendaal.

With around 13,000 students—16% international—TU/e supports strong student development and industry connections. Graduates find quick employment, especially in fields like Masters in Science, with an average salary of $76,000. Key recruiters include Philips, Shell, Rabobank, and Signify.

fields.name: Emily Carr University of Art and Design
fields.about:
Emily Carr University of Art and Design Overview

Founded in 1925 as the Vancouver School of Decorative and Applied Arts, Emily Carr University was British Columbia’s first institution to offer professional programs in arts, design, and media. It was renamed in 1978 to honor Canadian artist Emily Carr and gained university status in 2008. The university is affiliated with the Canadian Bureau for International Education and the Association of Independent Colleges of Art and Design, and ranks #24 globally by QS in its subject area.

Campus and Programs

Located primarily in Vancouver, Emily Carr University features modern facilities including smart classrooms, studios, and advanced labs. It offers 11 bachelor’s degrees, 2 master’s programs, professional certificates, and specialty courses across art, design, media, social sciences, sculpture, illustration, photography, communication design, and visual arts.

Achievements and Alumni

Emily Carr is the only Canadian arts and design university ranked in the QS top 50 worldwide (2021). In 2014, it became Canada’s first arts institution to receive Canada Research Chairs. Notable alumni include novelist and artist Douglas Coupland, artist Stan Douglas, and actress Annie Liu.

Student Body and Support

The university enrolls over 2,000 full-time students and attracts international students from 35 countries. It actively supports Indigenous and students of color through dedicated programs and funding. The student gender ratio is approximately 24% male to 76% female. Career Services help prepare students for future opportunities.

fields.name: Engineering Institute of Technology
fields.about:
Engineering Institute of Technology (EIT) Overview

Founded in 2008 and linked to IDC Technologies, which has trained over 500,000 engineers globally since 1991, EIT specializes in professional engineering education. It offers 15 advanced diplomas, certificates, and a professional doctorate, with programs recognized by Australia’s Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency and South Africa’s SAQA.

Campuses and Programs

EIT has campuses in Perth and Melbourne, featuring modern facilities like Wi-Fi classrooms, libraries, and student support. Most courses are offered online, with some bachelor’s and master’s degrees available on campus. Schools include Electrical, Electronic, Mechanical Engineering, and Engineering Management. Popular programs include Masters in Civil, Mechanical, and Electrical Engineering.

Achievements and Alumni

Since 2014, EIT’s qualifications have been officially recognized in South Africa, showing its international acceptance. Students can earn Australian government-accredited degrees online worldwide. Alumni work at top companies such as NASA, Rolls Royce, and BP.

Student Body and Career Outcomes

EIT serves students from over 140 countries, having trained more than 500,000 professionals. Graduates earn an average salary of AUD 72,000 (approx. INR 41 lakh) and often secure roles at leading global organizations.

fields.name: ESCP Europe Business School Paris
fields.about:
ESCP Business School Overview

Founded in Paris in 1819, ESCP Business School is the world’s oldest business school and one of Europe’s most prestigious. It's best known for its Master in Management (ranked 5th globally) and Master in Finance (ranked 2nd worldwide) by the Financial Times.

ESCP focuses on developing future business leaders through strong academics, practical learning, and global exposure. Students are encouraged to engage in extracurriculars, leadership roles, and entrepreneurial initiatives like Junior Enterprise. The school also has strong corporate partnerships that support regular internships.

Student life is dynamic, with democratic student governance and events throughout the year. Comfortable housing options are available, offering a homely environment. ESCP graduates go on to achieve great success in the global business world.

fields.name: ESSCA School of Management
fields.about:
ESSCA School of Management Overview

Founded in 1909 in France, ESSCA evolved from offering two-year degrees to four-year programs and gained affiliation with top organizations like AACSB, EQUIS, and Conférence des Grandes Écoles. It ranks #141-151 globally and #56 by Financial Times in Masters in Management.

Campuses and Programs

ESSCA has four campuses: Angers (main), Paris, Budapest, and Shanghai. The Angers campus features modern classrooms, labs, and a media library, while Paris focuses on research and international students. ESSCA offers Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in finance, marketing, and management.

Achievements and Alumni

ESSCA pioneered France’s 5-year “Grande École” program and is committed to sustainability, actively reducing its carbon footprint. Notable alumni include Victor Schulte (Investment Banking), Victoria Yazbeck (Amazon), and Margaux Lavaud (Goldman Sachs).

Student Body and Industry Links

With over 7,000 students and 150 faculty, ESSCA welcomes a diverse international community. The school promotes inclusion and fights discrimination through dedicated initiatives. Partner companies include Barclays, Goldman Sachs, and Amazon.

fields.name: Essec Business School
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
ESSEC Business School, founded in 1907 in Paris, is one of France’s top business schools. It holds the prestigious “triple crown” accreditations—EQUIS, AACSB, and AMBA—and is affiliated with CY Cergy Paris University and the Conférence des Grandes Écoles. QS ranked ESSEC 28th globally by subject in 2022.

Campuses and Courses
ESSEC has four campuses: two in France, one in Singapore, and one in Morocco. The main campus offers modern facilities in a central location for easy access. ESSEC provides undergraduate, postgraduate, doctoral, and executive education programs in areas such as Business, Finance, International Business, and Analytics.

Achievements and Alumni
ESSEC was the first European business school accredited by AACSB. Its Master of Science in Management and Master in Finance programs both ranked 3rd worldwide by the Financial Times. The school promotes entrepreneurship and research, with alumni excelling as CEOs and political leaders—like Jean-Luc Biamonti (Goldman Sachs) and Charles Konan Banny (former Prime Minister of Côte d’Ivoire).

Student Body and Recruiters
With over 6,000 students from 37 countries and 162 faculty members, ESSEC offers 100+ student clubs and strong career services. Top recruiters include Orange, Deloitte, Amazon, Accor, and L’Oréal.

fields.name: Esslingen University of Applied Sciences
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Esslingen University of Applied Sciences, founded in 1868 in Esslingen am Neckar, Germany, began as a mechanical engineering school in Stuttgart before moving to Esslingen in 1914. In 2006, two local institutions merged to form the current university.

Campuses and Courses
The university has three campuses: City Campus (main hub), Hilton Campus (home to English programs), and Goppingen Campus (newest site). It offers around 25 undergraduate and 12 postgraduate programs across 11 faculties, including Engineering, Natural Sciences, Management, Social Work, and Health Care. Numerous research centers support student projects.

Accreditations and Alumni
Esslingen is accredited by Baden-Württemberg’s Ministry of Science, FIBAA, and ASIIN. Notable alumni include Werner Dieter and Ludwig Dürr.

Student Diversity and Recruiters
With over 6,300 students and 220 faculty, Esslingen hosts a diverse international community and maintains a balanced gender ratio. Top recruiters include Amazon, Google, and Oracle.

fields.name: ETH Zurich
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
ETH Zurich, founded in 1855 by the Swiss government, is a leading university in technology, engineering, mathematics, and science. It aims to train top engineers and scientists while fostering collaboration between industry and research. ETH Zurich is a founding member of the International Alliance of Research Universities and part of the CESEAR network, boasting many notable alumni.

Campuses and Programs
The university has two main campuses in Zurich—Hönggerberg and the city center—and additional sites in Switzerland and Singapore. ETH offers over 70 programs across Architecture, Engineering, Natural Sciences, Management, and Social Sciences. Its modern facilities include research labs, green spaces, and vibrant social areas.

Achievements and Alumni
ETH Zurich played a key role in Switzerland’s industrial development and continues to excel globally. It has produced 22 Nobel laureates, including Albert Einstein. The university ranked 8th-9th worldwide in Engineering and Technology by Times Higher Education in 2016-2017.

Student Diversity and Employers
ETH promotes a diverse international community with active student associations, such as the Indian Students Association (InSAZ). Leading employers hiring ETH graduates include Roche, UBS, Google, Novartis, and the Swiss Armed Forces.

Founded in 1973 as EU Business School, now European University, it was acquired in 1999 by Dr. Kirk Craen. The school is accredited by recognized bodies like IACBE and ACBSP, and joined AACSB in 2006. QS rates it four stars, ranking its on-campus MBA among the top 140 worldwide and its online MBA 20th globally.

Campuses & Programs
EU has campuses in Montreux, Geneva, Barcelona, Munich, and online. These cities were chosen for their vibrant business environments. The Barcelona campuses offer modern facilities in central locations with easy transport access. Programs include business foundation, bachelor's, master's, MBA, and DBA, all taught in English.

Achievements & Alumni
QS Stars gave EU a four-star rating. The online MBA ranks #1 globally, with presidential MBAs also highly ranked. Alumni have launched successful ventures and gained recognition, including Forbes 30 Under 30 honors.

Diversity & Recruiting
Named a global leader in diversity by QS Global MBA Rankings 2019, EU boasts students from over 100 countries, with an average of 3+ languages spoken. Top companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google actively recruit its graduates.

History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1893 as Armour Institute and renamed Illinois Institute of Technology in 1940, Illinois Tech is Chicago’s only tech-focused university. Recognized for its innovation and value by Forbes, Money Magazine, and The Princeton Review, it is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and is a member of AITU and NAICU. It ranks #351–400 in THE 2022, #444 in QS, and #729 in U.S. News global rankings.

Campus, Programs & Infrastructure
Located on the historic Mies Campus in Chicago, Illinois Tech is known for its architectural landmarks and proximity to Lake Michigan. The university comprises 7 colleges offering 40+ undergraduate and 60+ graduate programs in Engineering, Law, Architecture, Computer Science, Business, Design, and more. Courses emphasize hands-on learning and industry readiness.

Achievements & Alumni
Illinois Tech ranks #1 in Illinois and #32 nationally for social mobility (Opportunity Insights). It is featured in Money Magazine as a top-value institution. Notable alumni include Martin Cooper (mobile phone inventor), Susan Solomon (MIT scientist), and Phyllis Lambert (architect), among others. The alumni network includes over 86,000 graduates worldwide.

Student Life & Recruiters
With students from 106 countries, the campus hosts a vibrant international community. 56% of graduate students and 16% of undergrads are international. The university offers 150+ student organizations, 17 NCAA teams, and 660+ annual events. Top recruiters include Amazon, Tesla, JP Morgan, Boeing, Accenture, and Mayo Clinic.

fields.name: Illinois State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1857 as Illinois’ first public teacher training school, Illinois State University became a full university in 1968. With over 20,000 students, it balances a small-college feel with large university resources. Known as a top producer of teachers, ISU is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission. It ranks #202 nationally by U.S. News and falls within #401-500 in Times Higher Education’s 2022 US College Rankings.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Academics
Located in Bloomington-Normal, about 130 miles from Chicago, the campus features green spaces and the Milner Library with over 1.4 million volumes. Academically, ISU has six colleges—including Business, Education, Fine Arts, and Nursing—offering 200+ programs from bachelor’s to doctoral levels, plus certificates and diplomas.

Achievements and Alumni
ISU boasts one of the highest graduate retention rates in the U.S. and recently raised $25.1 million in private funding, awarding thousands of scholarships. It’s recognized for community engagement and ranks among the Midwest’s best value colleges. Notable alumni include actress Jane Lynch, basketball player Doug Collins, and actor Sean Hayes.

Student Diversity and Employers
ISU’s 20,000+ students represent 74 countries and 47 states, with nearly 58% female and 25% from underrepresented groups. The university supports diversity through 50+ cultural organizations and a vibrant Multicultural Center. Graduates are recruited by top employers such as Boeing, IBM, Deloitte, JP Morgan, Accenture, and more.

fields.name: Indiana State University
fields.about:
Overview of Indiana State University
History & Accreditation
Founded in 1865 as Indiana State Normal School, Indiana State University (ISU) originally trained teachers. It gained university status in 1965 and now serves over 10,800 students. ISU is a public institution with a private-school feel, accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and affiliated with the U.S. space-grant program. It ranks within the #299–391 range among National Universities (U.S. News & World Report).

Campus & Academics
ISU’s 465-acre campus is located in Terre Haute, about 70 miles from Indianapolis. The university offers 100+ undergraduate majors, 90+ minors, 75+ graduate programs, and 70+ online courses across five colleges and a graduate school. Fields of study include Arts & Sciences, Business, Education, Health & Human Services, and Technology. Students benefit from hands-on learning through research, internships, and global programs.

Achievements & Alumni
ISU was named among the Top 50 “Best Bang for the Buck” colleges in the Midwest by Washington Monthly. The Sycamore Graduation Guarantee ensures tuition coverage beyond four years if students meet academic progress. The university has invested over $400 million in campus upgrades and contributed 1.25+ million hours in community service. Its alumni network includes NBA legend Larry Bird and actor Michael Evans Behling.

Student Life & Careers
ISU is home to a diverse student body, with 30% coming from outside Indiana and representation from all 50 states and 65+ countries. One in four students is from an ethnic minority background. With 260+ student organizations, the campus encourages engagement and inclusion. ISU graduates are hired by leading companies such as Amazon, Disney, Apple, PepsiCo, Toyota, and Infosys.

fields.name: Indiana University
fields.about:
Indiana University: Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1820, Indiana University (IU) is one of the oldest public universities in the U.S., with its flagship campus in Bloomington. IU operates nine campuses across Indiana, including a core campus in Indianapolis that collaborates with Purdue University. It is a member of prestigious associations like the AAU, ORAU, URA, and the U.S. Space-Grant program. Known for academic excellence and innovation, IU is also the first university to offer a degree in Philanthropy. It ranks #167 in Times Higher Education, #311 in QS, and #141 in U.S. News Best Global Universities (2022).

Campuses, Infrastructure & Programs
IU Bloomington is the largest campus, with seven campuses and two statewide centers in total. The university offers a wide range of programs, particularly renowned for its Business and Music schools. Other popular areas include Arts & Sciences, Journalism, Education, Nursing, and Public Affairs. IU has active international partnerships in Asia, Europe, and Latin America, providing students with global research, study abroad, and internship opportunities.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
IU has received numerous teaching awards and ranks in the global top 10 for several academic disciplines. It also hosts over 1,000 free music and arts performances annually. Recognized as one of the most LGBTQ+ friendly colleges (#8 by College Magazine), IU boasts a global alumni network of over 750,000. Prominent alumni include Wikipedia co-founder Jimmy Wales, Grammy-winning violinist Joshua Bell, and film producer Michael Uslan.

Student Life & Career Opportunities
Home to over 7,200 international students from 160+ countries, IU promotes diversity and inclusion through 20+ Living-Learning Centers, 750+ student organizations, and 380+ study abroad programs. Graduates are recruited by top employers such as Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Deloitte, Oracle, and Salesforce.

fields.name: Instituto Marangoni
fields.about:
Istituto Marangoni: Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in Milan in 1935 by tailor Giulio Marangoni, Istituto Marangoni became a professional art school in 1942 and shifted focus to fashion design, product development, and marketing in the 1980s. Recognized by Italy’s Ministry of Education, it is ranked among the top global fashion schools—#9 by CEOWorld Magazine and within the QS WUR by Subject 2022 (ranked #101–150).

Campuses & Courses
Blending classic Italian culture with modern design, Istituto Marangoni has campuses in Milan, London, Paris, Shanghai, and newer locations in Florence, Shenzhen, Mumbai, and Miami. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and short courses in areas like fashion design, styling, marketing, branding, and multimedia. Programs are enhanced through strong industry partnerships.

Achievements & Alumni
The school has produced top fashion professionals such as Franco Moschino (Moschino founder), Rahul Mishra (Woolmark Prize winner), and Alessandro Sartori (Zegna). Many alumni have worked with major fashion houses like Gucci, Prada, Versace, and Louis Vuitton.

Student Life & Recruiters
With 4,000+ students from over 100 countries, Istituto Marangoni fosters a diverse, international learning environment. Leading fashion brands—including Dior, Chanel, Armani, Inditex, H&M, and Hugo Boss—actively recruit from its campuses.

fields.name: INTO - The University of Western Australia
fields.about:
UWA College Overview
UWA College is a pathway program designed to help international students transition smoothly into the University of Western Australia (UWA). Established in partnership with INTO, it offers foundation and diploma courses that guarantee entry into UWA, a top 100 global university and a member of Australia’s prestigious Group of Eight. In 2023, UWA ranked #90 in QS and #401-600 in Times Higher Education World University Rankings.

Campus & Programs
Located on UWA’s main campus in Perth, UWA College provides modern facilities and direct access to university life. Students receive guidance from experienced teachers and mentors while studying foundation programs, English pathways, and diplomas in Commerce and Science that lead directly into UWA’s second-year undergraduate courses.

Reputation & Alumni
UWA ranks among the top 1% of universities worldwide with a 5-star rating for teaching quality. Its 130,000-strong alumni network includes Nobel Laureates, former Prime Ministers, and notable figures like playwright Dorothy Hewett and comedian Tim Minchin.

Student Life & Careers
UWA College fosters a diverse, multicultural environment with access to university clubs, societies, and resources. Graduates often continue to UWA’s bachelor’s programs and go on to work for global companies such as Rio Tinto, EY, Deloitte, Amazon, Google, and Microsoft.

fields.name: ISM - International School of Management
fields.about:
International School of Management (ISM), Germany – Overview
About ISM
The International School of Management (ISM) is a private, state-recognized business school headquartered in Dortmund, Germany. Accredited by FIBAA and the Ministry of Science of North Rhine-Westphalia, ISM is known for its strong focus on applied sciences, innovation, and global business leadership.

Campuses & Programs
ISM operates seven campuses across Germany: Dortmund, Frankfurt/Main, Munich, Hamburg, Cologne, Stuttgart, and Berlin. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and MBA programs with a focus on international business and practical learning. Popular courses include B.Sc in International Management, MSc in Data Science, and an MBA in General Management.

Facilities
Campuses feature modern classrooms, tech-enabled labs, libraries, and seminar halls, blending traditional German education with contemporary tools and methods.

Achievements & Alumni
ISM partners with over 190 global universities and offers 15+ English-taught programs. With a student-faculty ratio of 7:1, over 90% of graduates secure jobs within six months. Notable alumni include Haoze Lou (Germany), Yi Ting Tsai (Taiwan), and Luis David Padilla Marmolejo (Mexico).

Diversity & Careers
Around 1,200 international students from 80+ countries study at ISM. Top recruiters include Amazon, Deloitte, BMW, PwC, EY, KPMG, Deutsche Bank, and Siemens, often participating in ISM’s annual career fairs.

Jacobs University Bremen – Overview
About
Jacobs University Bremen is a private, English-speaking research university located in Bremen, Germany. Founded in 1999 as the International University of Bremen, it was later renamed following a major investment by the Jacobs Foundation in 2006. The university collaborates with Oxford International Education Group to offer preparatory programs and is fully accredited by the Science Council and ACQUIN.

Rankings

#1233 Best Global Universities

#471 in Europe

#63 in Germany

Campus & Academics
Jacobs offers a dynamic campus life with modern sports facilities, cultural events, and international festivals. It provides undergraduate, graduate, executive, and doctoral programs in fields like Business, Engineering, Data Science, Biotechnology, Economics, Physics, and International Business. Colleges on campus include Krupp, Mercator, College III, and Nordmetall.

Global Partnerships & Alumni
The university has exchange and dual-degree programs with top institutions like the University of Edinburgh, NYU, University of Oslo, and Kadir Has University. Notable alumni include business leader Rytis Vitkauskas and computer scientist Razvan Pascanu.

Student Diversity & Careers
Jacobs hosts over 1,600 students from 110+ countries, with 75% being international. Program enrollment includes bachelor's, master's, PhD, and preparatory students. Top recruiters include Amazon, Google, Facebook, Bosch, EY, KPMG, and Intel.

fields.name: Jagiellonian University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Jagiellonian University in Krakow, Poland, is one of Europe’s oldest universities, founded in the 14th century by King Casimir III. Originally focused on Medicine, Law, and Liberal Arts, it now educates over 40,000 students worldwide. The university is part of major European academic networks like the Coimbra Group and EUA. It ranks #501-600 globally in Times Higher Education and #293 in QS World Rankings (2022).

Campus, Courses, and Facilities
Jagiellonian offers a wide range of programs across 15 faculties, including Medicine, Law, Physics, Computer Science, Philosophy, and Management. It houses one of Poland’s largest libraries with 6.5 million volumes. Students have access to mental health support through the Student Centre for Support and Adaptation.

Achievements and Alumni
As the world’s 13th oldest university, Jagiellonian has a strong legacy in medical research, contributing to breakthroughs in cardiac surgery, neurology, and urology. Notable alumni include scholars and scientists like John Cantius and Albert Brudzewski.

Student Diversity and Employer Connections
Jagiellonian embraces diversity across culture, identity, and background to foster creativity and talent. Graduates are recruited by top companies such as Capgemini, HSBC, Shell, EY, Cisco, and Revolut.

fields.name: James Cook University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
James Cook University (JCU) was founded in 1961 and officially established in 1970 by Queen Elizabeth II. It is the second-oldest university in Queensland and a member of the Innovative Research Universities (IRU) network. Ranked among the Top 25 in Australia and Top 300 globally (THE 2022), JCU has strong research links in 124 countries and an annual research income of over $67 million.

Campuses, Courses & Infrastructure
JCU operates main campuses in Townsville, Cairns, Brisbane, and Singapore, offering over 80 undergraduate and postgraduate programs. It is known for strengths in environmental science, health, medicine, veterinary science, and agriculture. Facilities include award-winning research centres such as AITHM, The Science Place, and a state-of-the-art dental clinic.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
JCU is a leader in sustainable research and tropical health. Distinguished alumni include Alex Jia (CEO, Longrich), Rachel Carling-Jenkins (politician), David Crisafulli (politician), and Rose Evaster-Aderolili (UN official).

Diversity & Career Opportunities
A participant in the Athena SWAN Charter, JCU promotes gender equality and diversity in STEMM fields. The university welcomes students from 111 countries, with over 4,000 international students. Graduates work at top organizations such as Queensland Health, Rio Tinto, BHP, AECOM, and University of Queensland.

fields.about:
Johannes Gutenberg University Mainz (JGU) is one of Germany’s largest and most prestigious research universities. A member of the German U15 group, it was originally founded in 1477 and re-established in 1946. JGU offers a wide range of programs across more than 10 faculties, including Social Sciences, Law, Media, Business, Sciences, Theology, and more.

The university uniquely integrates a School of Music, an Academy of Fine Arts, and a specialized Faculty of Translation Studies in Germersheim, focusing on multiple European and non-European languages.

With over 500 professors and 11 departments, JGU is equipped with advanced research facilities, including an electron accelerator, research reactor, medical centers, and a botanical garden. Its campus also features sports stadiums and recreation facilities, providing a holistic student experience.

fields.name: Johns Hopkins University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1876, Johns Hopkins University (JHU) was the first research university in the U.S., aiming to merge education with discovery. Guided by its founding belief that knowledge grows through research, JHU has become a global leader in academics and innovation. It's affiliated with top organizations like the AAU, URA, and Space-Grant colleges. Globally, JHU ranks #25 in QS, #13 in THE, and #9 in U.S. News (2022).

Campuses, Programs & Facilities
JHU’s main campus is in Baltimore, with additional campuses across Washington, Maryland, and internationally in Italy and China. The historic Homewood campus offers a scenic, student-friendly atmosphere. With 400+ courses across 260+ majors, JHU provides undergraduate, graduate, doctoral, and certificate programs in fields like Science, Engineering, Business, Music, Education, and Health.

Research, Innovation & Alumni
JHU is known for pioneering breakthroughs in genetic engineering, water purification, and cancer research. It supports innovation through Fast Forward, Social Innovation Labs, and Tech Ventures. The university boasts 29 Nobel Laureates and alumni like Woodrow Wilson, Mike Bloomberg, and Rachel Carson.

Student Life & Diversity
JHU welcomes students from over 60 countries, fostering diversity and inclusion through its Center for Diversity and Inclusion. The campus hosts 400+ student organizations, cultural events, and activities from robotics to international relations. Top employers like Pfizer, BCG, Deloitte, and KPMG actively recruit JHU graduates.

fields.name: Johnson & Wales University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1914 as a business school by Gertrude I. Johnson and Mary T. Wales, Johnson & Wales University (JWU) has evolved into a career-focused university known for its excellence in culinary arts, hospitality, business, and health. Officially becoming a university in 1988, JWU currently operates two campuses—in Providence and Charlotte—after previously operating campuses in North Miami and Denver.

Campuses, Infrastructure, and Courses
JWU offers over 60 undergraduate and postgraduate programs through six colleges, including Business, Culinary Arts, Hospitality, Health & Wellness, Engineering & Design, and Arts & Sciences. The Providence campus features active student life, residence halls, and access to Rhode Island’s cultural and coastal attractions. The Charlotte campus includes state-of-the-art culinary labs and a modern student center near the city’s entertainment hubs.

Achievements and Alumni
JWU is globally recognized for its culinary education and is also advancing in areas like health, sustainability, STEM, and communications. Its Discovery program helps students explore academic options before choosing a major. Notable alumni include celebrity chef Emeril Lagasse, PR strategist Dirk Shaw, and entrepreneur Lena Kwak.

Student Diversity and Recruiters
Hosting students from over 125 countries, JWU supports international learners through its English Language & Culture Academy (ELCA) at the Providence campus. ELCA students have full access to campus resources. Top employers hiring JWU graduates include Marriott International, Fidelity, Walt Disney, Walgreens, and TJX Companies.

fields.name: Justice Institute of British Columbia
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1978, the Justice Institute of British Columbia (JIBC) is a leading public safety educator in Canada. Located in New Westminster, JIBC offers specialized training and education in justice and public safety. It is affiliated with the ACCC and ranks #8299 globally, #2201 in its continent, and #124 nationally by Webometrics.

Campuses, Programs, and Infrastructure
JIBC has six campuses across Victoria, Okanagan, Chilliwack, Pitt Meadows, and Maple Ridge, each tailored to local community needs. The institute supports Indigenous students and partnerships through its Office of Indigenization. Programs focus on criminal justice, community and social justice, health, and public safety, many of which meet international standards. Graduate programs are offered via the Centre for Liberal & Graduate Studies.

Achievements and Alumni
JIBC honors outstanding contributors with its Award of Excellence in Applied Research. Notable alumni include Navi Dosanjh (Abbotsford Police), Ashley Long (firefighter), Ryan Vena (founder of Street Saviours Outreach), and Helen Wale (quality analyst at Community Living BC).

Student Diversity and Employer Connections
JIBC celebrates diverse student and staff backgrounds, reflecting the communities it serves. Employers such as BC Emergency Health Services and BC Public Service regularly recruit from JIBC.

fields.name: Kansas State University
fields.about:
Kansas State University (K-State) Overview

Founded in 1863, Kansas State University is the oldest public institution in Kansas and the first operational land-grant university in the U.S. It is a public research university with campuses in Manhattan (main), Salina (Polytechnic Campus), and Olathe (Innovation Campus).

Campuses and Academics
K-State offers programs through nine colleges and 65 departments, covering fields such as agriculture, engineering, business, architecture, veterinary medicine, and aviation. It offers 65 master’s and 50 doctoral programs. The Salina campus specializes in technology and aviation, while the Olathe campus focuses on research in food safety, animal health, and plant science.

Rankings and Recognition
The university is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and ranked #801–1000 by QS and THE World University Rankings (2022). Since 1986, K-State has produced the most Truman, Goldwater, Rhodes, Marshall, and Udall Scholars among U.S. public universities.

Campus Life and Alumni
K-State is home to museums like the Marianna Kistler Beach Museum of Art and K-State Insect Zoo. Notable alumni include Geraldine L. Richmond, National Medal of Science winner, and former U.S. Senator Sam Brownback.

Student Diversity and Careers
The university hosts over 20,000 students, including 2,000 international students from 120+ countries. Major recruiters include Microsoft, Deloitte, T-Mobile, Koch, and Netsmart.

fields.name: Karlsruhe Institute of Technology
fields.about:
Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT) Overview

Founded in 1825 as a polytechnic modeled after Paris’s École Polytechnique, KIT became a full university in 1967, granting it the ability to award doctorates. It is affiliated with major research and academic networks including TU9, the German Research Foundation, and the European Universities Association. KIT ranks #136 globally by QS, #180 by Times Higher Education, and #216 by US News.

Campus and Academics
The main Campus Nord, established in 1956, was originally a nuclear research center. KIT has 11 faculties covering fields such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, and Humanities.

Achievements and Alumni
KIT holds excellence status under the German Universities Excellence Initiative and ranks top in Germany for engineering and natural sciences research. Notable alumni include painter Herbert Wetterauer and accelerator physicist Rolf Wideröe.

Student Body and Industry Connections
Over 20% of KIT’s 23,000+ students are international, representing 120+ countries. The university’s Career Service Centre organizes fairs and supports job placement. Leading employers recruiting KIT graduates include Bosch, SAP, Mercedes-Benz, Siemens, BMW, Porsche, IBM, and Google.

fields.name: Kazan State Medical University
fields.about:
Kazan State Medical University Overview

Founded in 1814, Kazan State Medical University (KSMU) is Russia’s third oldest medical school and a top government-funded institution. It is recognized by the WHO, ECFMG (USA), and several global medical councils. In the 2023 Times Higher Education Impact Rankings, KSMU ranked among the top 200 universities for health and well-being.

Campus and Programs
KSMU offers a 6-year MBBS program, including a mandatory 1-year internship, taught in Russian and English for international students. The university features modern facilities, including a hospital, library, sports complexes, and research centers. It is known for affordable tuition and is recognized by the National Medical Commission (NMC) and WHO.

Achievements and Alumni
With over 200 years of history, KSMU has contributed significantly to medical research and healthcare. Notable alumni include politicians and leading medical professionals who have influenced healthcare policy in Russia and beyond.

Student Body and Global Reach
Each year, over 700 students from 57 countries enroll, making KSMU a diverse international hub. The university employs more than 1,500 staff and supports around 5,500 medical students and residents. KSMU also offers clinical and research training opportunities worldwide, in over 30 countries.

fields.name: Kent State University
fields.about: Kent State University, a public research institution founded in 1910, is located in Kent, Ohio, and spans 866 acres. It has 7 regional campuses across the state. With nearly 29,000 students enrolled, KSU offers over 340 undergraduate and 200 graduate programs. The university emphasizes innovative fields like Environmental Science, Aerospace Engineering, and Business Analytics. Its Advanced Materials and Liquid Crystal Institute leads research in wearable tech, nanomaterials, and fuel cells. KSU has received the Healthy Campus Award for promoting student well-being and provides scholarships averaging over $6,000 annually.

fields.name: Kharkiv National Medical University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Kharkiv National Medical University, established in 1805, is Ukraine’s leading medical education center. Originating from the Medical Faculty of V. N. Karazin Kharkiv National University, it has over 200 years of history. Renowned 19th-century medical pioneers performed groundbreaking surgeries here. The university includes historic facilities like the anatomical theatre (since 1887) and four clinics built in 1896. It partners with Kharkiv City Student Hospital and other medical centers. Ranked #26 overall and #5 among Ukrainian medical schools on SCOPUS, it also holds #47 in Ukraine’s UNESCO “TOP 200.”

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
Located in Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city, the university offers MBBS, BDS, Pharmacy, and Nursing programs. It features six dormitories and modern teaching buildings with 65 well-equipped departments. Clinical training starts in the third year at affiliated hospitals, where students gain hands-on experience. The campus has advanced medical labs, computer classes, and a comprehensive library. Postgraduate education is also available.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Known for excellence in surgery, anatomy, dentistry, and radiology, Kharkiv National Medical University boasts a rich cultural and academic heritage. It maintains global partnerships with institutions in the USA, Poland, Israel, China, the UK, and others. The university emphasizes both professional and personal student development through workshops and events.

Student Diversity and Career Support
Attracting students worldwide due to affordable tuition and living costs, the university has graduated over 7,500 international alumni. Students can study in English or Russian, joining peers from Asia, Africa, and Europe. The university equips graduates with strong skills and career planning resources, making them highly employable and respected medical professionals globally.

fields.name: KTH Royal Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1827, KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm is Sweden’s largest and top-ranked technical university, currently ranked #89 globally by QS World Rankings 2022. It hosts international students and researchers and operates campuses in Stockholm and Södertälje. Since 2002, part of its Engineering Sciences in Chemistry, Biotechnology, and Healthcare has been based in Flemingsberg.

Infrastructure, Campuses & Courses
KTH’s main campus is in Ostermalm, with a smaller campus in Södertälje. It offers undergraduate, graduate, and about 60 international master’s programs in engineering, natural sciences, architecture, and more, mainly taught in English. The university prioritizes research and education aimed at sustainable innovation and collaborates with other universities to enhance research.

Accomplishments and Alumni
KTH’s global alumni network supports connections between graduates, students, and industry. Notable alumni include physicist Christer Fuglesang, Spotify CEO Daniel Ek, and actor Dolph Lundgren. The alumni office organizes events and digital platforms to maintain strong ties and support career development.

Student Diversity and Industry Partnerships
KTH enrolls over 13,500 students, including 1,657 researchers. Women make up 35% of the student body, and 21% are international. The university partners with companies like Databricks, Brimore, Better.com, Hawker’s Co, and Custex.

fields.name: KU Leuven
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1834 as the Catholic University of Belgium, KU Leuven moved to Leuven in 1835. In 1968, it split into the Dutch-speaking Katholieke Universiteit Leuven and the French-speaking Université catholique de Louvain (in Louvain-la-Neuve). Leuven is one of the oldest Catholic universities, with a strong theological heritage. KU Leuven ranks among the world’s top 100 universities: #42 in Times Higher Education 2021, #70 QS World Rankings, and #87 Shanghai Rankings. It is affiliated with major European university networks like CESAER and the European University Association.

Infrastructure, Campuses & Courses
The main campus is in Leuven, featuring faculties, libraries, the UZ Leuven hospital, sports facilities, and historic sites like the UNESCO-listed Groot Begijnhof. The university also has satellite campuses in 11 Belgian cities including Brussels, Ghent, and Antwerp. KU Leuven offers numerous English-language programs and holds online open days for prospective students.

Accomplishments and Alumni
KU Leuven leads in research commercialization, with an early-established tech transfer office (LRD) supporting patents, licenses, and spin-offs. It was named one of the world’s top five most innovative universities by Reuters in 2017—the only non-US institution on the list. Notable alumni include businessman Leon Bekaert, medical scientist Peter Carmeliet, and university president Koen Lamberts.

Student Diversity and Partnerships
KU Leuven educates over 27,000 students from 127 countries. In 2006, it was ranked 76th globally and 24th in Europe by the Times Higher Education supplement.

fields.name: Kwantlen Polytechnic University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Kwantlen College was established in 1981 after splitting from Douglas College. It gained authority to offer Bachelor’s degrees in 1988 and became Kwantlen University College in 1995. Now known as Kwantlen Polytechnic University, it’s Canada’s only polytechnic university, serving over 20,000 students annually. It is affiliated with several organizations, including the International Association of Universities and the Association of Universities and Colleges of Canada, facilitating student transfers across Canada and beyond.

Campuses, Facilities & Programs
Kwantlen has five campuses in British Columbia: Surrey (main campus), Richmond, Langley, Cloverdale, and Newton Town Centre. Programs range from Fashion, Design, and Business to Horticulture, Sciences, Trades, and unique offerings like British Columbia’s only Brewing Diploma. The university offers over 120 courses, many with co-op or work experience components, plus tuition-free English language studies.

Achievements & Alumni
Kwantlen is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP). In 2021, it was recognized as one of Canada’s Best Employers for Recent Graduates and BC’s Top Employers. It is the first Canadian institution to offer Traditional Chinese Medicine Acupuncture. Over 200,000 graduates form a strong alumni network worldwide, including notable figures like Kim Baird and Chris McCue.

Student Body & Industry Connections
With more than 20,000 students, including 6,000 international students, Kwantlen is diverse and gender-balanced (47% male, 53% female). The university supports global engagement through exchanges, co-ops, and study abroad programs. It also offers resources like the free monthly “KPU Campus Well” newsletter. Key recruiters include Walmart, Google, and FoodX Technologies.

fields.name: La Trobe University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Established in Melbourne, Australia, La Trobe University was officially founded by the Victorian Parliament in 1964, with classes beginning at the Bundoora campus in 1967. Initially focused on Liberal Arts and Science, La Trobe expanded its offerings following a 1987 merger with the Lincoln Institute of Health Sciences. It is accredited by the prestigious AACSB for its business programs. In global rankings, La Trobe is placed #362 by QS, #201–250 by THE, and #330 by U.S. News & World Report (2022).

Campuses, Courses & Infrastructure
La Trobe has seven campuses across Victoria and New South Wales, offering students the choice of urban or regional study environments. Recognized for its strong research programs under the ERA framework, the university offers diverse undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in areas such as IT, Engineering, Law, Business, Arts, and Social Sciences.

Achievements & Alumni
La Trobe ranks #1 in Victoria and #6 nationally for graduate competencies, with an employability rate of 86.6%. It's in the top 1% of universities globally for career-focused education. The alumni network includes over 230,000 graduates worldwide, with notable names such as actor Bob Morley, journalist Virginia Trioli, and footballer Daniel Arzani.

Diversity & Industry Links
La Trobe has a vibrant student body of 37,000, including 8,000 international students from countries like China, India, Singapore, and Nepal—making up about 39% of the total. The student body is 60% female and 40% male, with a student-faculty ratio of 33.8. Students gain industry experience through placements with organizations such as Bendigo Bank, VicTrack, and the Department of Ecology.

fields.name: Lakeland College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Lakeland College, located in Alberta, Canada, was established in 1911 and is one of North America’s largest post-secondary agricultural schools. It evolved from the Vermilion School of Agriculture (1913) to Vermilion Agricultural and Vocational College (1960), then Vermilion College, before becoming Lakeland College in 1975. The college is affiliated with ACCC, CCAA, AACTI, and CBIE. It ranks between #117-153 among Canadian universities and holds various positions in global and regional rankings, including #33 for social mobility by US News & World Report.

Campuses, Facilities, and Programs
Lakeland has two campuses: the main campus in Vermilion and a satellite campus in Lloydminster (established 1990). Facilities include libraries, theaters, sports complexes, and five dedicated research buildings. Programs offered include one- and two-year certificates, diplomas, degrees, and online courses. Popular fields of study include Agricultural Sciences, Business, Environmental Sciences, Fire and Emergency Services, Human Services, and Petroleum Technology. Some programs are also available in French.

Achievements and Alumni
Lakeland has earned awards for milk quality (2015-2018), academic excellence, and athletic achievements. Over 1,000 students have received scholarships and bursaries. Notable alumni include Canadian politicians Rick Fraser and Doug Cherry, and curler Jill Shumay.

Student Diversity and Career Support
The college welcomes a diverse student body with about 854 men and 1,144 women, including international students. The Student Employment Centre helps connect students to employers through job postings, career fairs, and interview prep. Top employers include Walmart, ADM, Sarah Bush Lincoln, and Patterson Companies, Inc.

fields.name: Lamar University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1923 as South Park Junior College with 125 students, Lamar University in Beaumont, Texas, now serves over 15,000 students with 139 degree programs. As part of the Texas State University System, it offers affordable tuition and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools. Lamar is recognized nationally by U.S. News & World Report and QS World University Rankings.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
Located on a 300-acre campus, Lamar offers 139 programs across five bachelor’s colleges, one graduate college, and an honors college. Students can study fields such as Business, Engineering, Arts and Sciences, Education and Human Development, and Fine Arts at undergraduate, graduate, and PhD levels.

Achievements and Alumni
Lamar has produced notable alumni in diverse fields like music, acting, engineering, politics, and professional sports. The university’s baseball program has earned national recognition. It’s also classified as a Research University by the Carnegie Foundation, among only 29 public U.S. institutions to receive this honor.

Student Diversity and Career Support
With 159 student organizations and representation from 62 countries, Lamar fosters an inclusive community where 48% of students are people of color. The university awards over 2,000 scholarships totaling $10 million annually. Its career services team supports student and alumni job placement and networking with top employers.

fields.name: Lambton College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Lambton College, founded in 1966 in Southwestern Ontario, is known for quality post-secondary education. Starting with 45 students, it has grown into a key regional institution supporting local industry needs. It’s affiliated with CCAA, ACCC, AUCC, and CBIE.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
The main campus is in Sarnia, with additional campuses in Mississauga and Toronto for international students. Facilities include the South Building, Skilled Trades Training Centre, and the Sustainable Smart Home. Lambton offers 112 programs, including 51 undergraduate options, with strong emphasis on practical work experience.

Achievements and Alumni
Lambton has won multiple awards for applied research and innovation. Its alumni network includes over 34,000 graduates, with notable figures like Judy Foote and politicians Michael McGinnis and Rex Isaac. The college fosters global skills through expert faculty and networking opportunities.

Student Diversity and Career Support
Lambton promotes diversity, equality, and student engagement through clubs and community activities. International students enjoy a welcoming environment and participate in events for personal growth. Top recruiters include Walmart, RBC, TD, and CIBC.

fields.name: Langara College
fields.about:
Langara College Overview

History & Affiliations
Established on April 1, 1994, Langara College became an independent public institution under the Provincial College and Institute Act. Located on the traditional territory of the Musqueam people in Vancouver, it began as the King Edward Centre of Vancouver City College in 1965. Langara is affiliated with ACCC, CBIE, and CUP (academics), and PACWEST and CCAA (sports). As of 2022, it ranked 7,453 globally by University Ranking Web.

Campus & Programs
Langara has two campuses in Vancouver, featuring modern facilities including 8 main buildings, labs, a library, gym, daycare, and more. The college offers over 90 programs and 850+ courses across five main areas: arts, business, science and technology, health, and social sciences. Popular degrees include Business Administration, Nursing, International Business Management, Bioinformatics, and Recreation Management.

Achievements & Alumni
Langara’s School of Nursing was named "School of the Year" by the CNSA, and its School of Management ranks among Canada's top six. The college emphasizes sustainability and human rights. Notable alumni include actor Daniel Doheny, writer Alison Acheson, politician Ujjal Dosanjh, and journalist Gary Mason.

Student Body & Employers
Serving over 23,000 students, including 6,300+ international students from 102 countries, Langara boasts a diverse and inclusive campus. Top employers recruiting from Langara include Amazon, TELUS, RBC, EA, Vancouver Coastal Health, and The University of British Columbia.

fields.name: Laurentian University
fields.about:
History & Affiliations
Founded in 1957 as the University of Sudbury and renamed Laurentian in 1960, this bilingual university embraces a unique tricultural mandate. Located on the traditional lands of the Atikameksheng Anishnawbek and Wahnapitae First Nations, Laurentian offers undergraduate to doctoral programs in both English and French. It holds the highest post-graduation rate in Ontario and is affiliated with institutions like CMRU, SNOLab, AUCC, and IAU. In 2022, it ranked #1326 globally by US News.

Campus & Programs
Set on 765 acres near Lake Laurentian Conservation Area, the campus blends nature with learning. Laurentian offers 106 interdisciplinary programs across five faculties: Science, Engineering & Architecture; Management; Health; Education; and Arts. Thirty-three programs are available in French, making it a strong choice for international students.

Achievements & Alumni
Laurentian is Ontario’s first bilingual university and ranks #2 in Canada for online learning. It raised $104M for the Metal Earth Research Project. Notable alumni include sports administrator Alex Baumann, actress Janaya Stephens, and politician Mike Harris. David Paquette, a management consultant and leadership coach, is another prominent graduate.

Student Life & Employers
With students from over 73 countries and 50+ clubs, Laurentian fosters a vibrant campus community. The graduate employment rate is 94% at six months and 97% after two years. Leading employers include City of Greater Sudbury, Vale, RBC, Scotiabank, Desjardins, and BMO.

fields.name: Lawrence Technological University
fields.about:
History, Rankings & Affiliations
Founded in 1932 by Henry and Edsel Ford, Lawrence Technological University (Lawrence Tech) is a private institution in Michigan specializing in engineering and technology education. It was originally called the Lawrence Institute of Technology and became Lawrence Tech in 1989. Now located in Southfield, Michigan, the university is among the top 10% of U.S. universities and is accredited by organizations like ABET and NASAD. It partners with universities worldwide and its athletic teams, the Blue Devils, compete in NAIA and WHAC. The Times Higher Education ranked it #352 in U.S. colleges in 2022.

Campus & Programs
Located in suburban Southfield, near major U.S. cities and a hub of business activity, Lawrence Tech offers over 100 undergraduate and graduate programs across four colleges: Architecture & Design, Arts & Sciences, Business & IT, and Engineering. The university also provides dual degrees, online graduate programs, and professional certificates.

Achievements & Alumni
Lawrence Tech has earned recognition from Forbes, Princeton Review, and the Brookings Institution for graduate salaries, educational quality, and career preparation. Its alumni network exceeds 35,000, including notable figures such as Ford’s Lewis Veraldi and architect Harvey Ferrero.

Student Life & Career Support
With over 3,000 students from 46 countries, including 191 from India, Lawrence Tech fosters a diverse campus community. Students can join various clubs and benefit from career services like resume help, internships, and interview prep. Major companies like Stellantis, Magna, and Nissan regularly recruit from the university.

fields.name: Leibniz Universität
fields.about:
Leibniz Universität Hannover, located in Hannover, Germany, was founded in 1831 and became a university in 2006. It is one of Germany’s oldest and largest science and technology universities, situated in a peaceful residential area that fosters focused learning. The university emphasizes accessible, high-quality education.

Leibniz Universität offers a wide range of full- and part-time programs in fields like Accounting, Humanities, Social Sciences, Law, Psychology, and more. Its courses are designed to develop practical skills that prepare students for future careers and societal impact.

The campus spans over 160 buildings and has seen investments exceeding half a billion euros to provide modern facilities, labs, and libraries. The university is also committed to sustainability, using advanced technologies to reduce energy use and carbon footprint.

fields.name: Leiden University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Leiden University, founded in 1575 by William of Orange, is the oldest university in the Netherlands and a prestigious European institution. It is a member of the Coimbra Group and a founding member of the League of European Research Universities. In global rankings, it stands at #128 (QS 2021) and #71 (Times Higher Education).

Campus & Programs
Instead of a single campus, Leiden’s facilities are spread throughout the city, with a large campus in The Hague housing most faculties including Sciences, Law, Social Sciences, and Humanities. The university offers over 100 programs across 50+ departments and maintains 29 research institutes.

Notable Alumni & Community
With over 109,000 alumni worldwide, Leiden counts Dutch royalty and notable figures such as Prime Minister Mark Rutte and physicist Hendrik Lorentz among its graduates. The university hosts nearly 30,000 students from 129 countries and employs around 6,700 staff.

fields.name: Les Roches International School of Hotel Management
fields.about:
Founded in 1954 as Les Roches International School, the institute is situated in the canton of Valais, Switzerland. In 2016, it was renamed Les Roches Global Hospitality Education, transitioning from its former title, Les Roches Hotel and Tourism School. Today, it stands as one of Switzerland’s leading hospitality universities. The school attracts a diverse student body from around the world, offering a variety of programs across multiple disciplines. Notably, it is the primary hospitality institution in Switzerland to conduct all classes in English.

In 1985, a fire severely damaged the main campus, prompting a relocation to new facilities in 1987. Les Roches maintains strong connections with the tourism, commerce, and hotel industries, supported by an advisory board representing four major hotel groups. Students benefit from practical training through internships facilitated by the university as part of their hotel management courses.

Les Roches Global Hospitality Education is accredited by the Commission on Institutions of Higher Education (CIHE) of the New England Association of Schools and Colleges. The institution offers a range of academic programs, including undergraduate and graduate degrees, short-term courses, and executive education. Some of the key programs include:

Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)

fields.name: Lewis University
fields.about:
Overview of Lewis University

Founded in 1932 as Holy Name Technical School under the Chicago Archdiocese, Lewis University began with a focus on aviation technology—now its renowned College of Aviation, Science, and Technology. A comprehensive Catholic institution sponsored by the De La Salle Christian Brothers, Lewis combines liberal arts, values, and professional training.

Located 35 miles southwest of Chicago in Romeoville, Illinois, Lewis sits on a 410-acre campus housing over 6,200 students with 12 residence halls and modern facilities including its own airport. It’s Illinois’ eighth largest private nonprofit university, offering 80+ undergraduate majors and 37 graduate programs. Popular fields include Aviation, Cybersecurity, Business, Nursing, and Data Science.

Lewis holds affiliations with the Higher Learning Commission, ACCU, NAICU, CIC, NCAA Division II, and GLVC. It ranks #19 regionally by U.S. News (2022) and is placed #351-400 globally by Times Higher Education (2022). The university is recognized for military student support and boasts a global alumni network of 40,000+, including notable professionals in sports, law enforcement, and the arts.

The student body is diverse—40% minorities—with 59% White, 20% Hispanic/Latino, 7% Black, and 6% Asian students. Women make up 51% of enrollment and degree recipients. Employers such as Mayo Clinic, Amazon, Boeing, Ford, JP Morgan, KPMG, and Tesla regularly recruit on campus.

fields.name: Linkoping University
fields.about:
Overview of Linköping University

Founded in 1975 as Sweden’s sixth university, Linköping University (LiU) has grown with campuses in Linköping, Norrköping, and Stockholm. The region has a rich educational history dating back to the medieval era, with schools linked to Linköping Cathedral and early teacher training colleges. LiU is affiliated with the European University Association and the European Consortium of Innovative Universities and is accredited by the Swedish Higher Education Authority.

LiU ranks #329 in the QS World University Rankings and is recognized by U.S. News as #350 globally, #151 in Europe, and #10 in Sweden.

Campuses and Programs

LiU’s main campuses are in the Östergötland region, combining historic sites with modern facilities and beautiful natural surroundings. The university offers around 30 international programs, mainly two-year master’s degrees worth 120 ECTS credits. A free bus service connects the campuses.

Research, Alumni, and Student Life

Linköping University is known for interdisciplinary research and strong ties to industry, fostering innovation across fields. It emphasizes student-centered learning and equality. The university boasts over 110,000 alumni worldwide, including notable figures like Åsa Lindhagen and Carl-Henric Svanberg.

With nearly 36,000 students (including 10,700 distance learners) and over 300 professors, LiU offers a vibrant campus life, earning the “Student City of the Year” award three times. Top employers recruiting graduates include Volvo Cars, IKEA, EY, Netlight, and Accenture.

fields.name: Linnaeus University
fields.about:
Linnaeus University: Overview

History & Rankings
Established in 2010 through the merger of Växjö University and Kalmar University College, Linnaeus University is named after renowned scientist Carl Linnaeus. Located in Växjö and Kalmar, the university fosters innovation at the heart of Sweden’s entrepreneurial region. It is accredited by the European University Association (EUA) and SUHF. Linnaeus University ranks #1233 in US News’ Best Global Universities and falls within #601–800 in THE Impact Rankings 2022.

Campus & Courses
The university has two campuses, designed in a walkable, American-style format and surrounded by nature. The Växjö campus includes Videum Science Park, home to over 100 companies that support research and innovation. Facilities include sports centers, restaurants, and scenic areas like lakes and Teleborg Castle. Linnaeus offers 150+ degree programs and 1,300 courses at the bachelor’s and master’s levels, along with professional training programs.

Global Ties & Notable Alumni
With partnerships across 80+ countries and 500+ institutions, the university has a strong global network, including a notable collaboration with IKEA. It hosts around 44,000 students, with 2,000 international learners. Distinguished alumni include Seychellois minister Rolph Payet, Oscar-winning filmmaker Malik Bendjelloul, and Ukrainian journalist Andriy Tsaplienko.

Student Life & Career Opportunities
International students make up about 5% of enrollment. Student life is vibrant, with over 70 clubs, sports groups, and social events. Major employers like IKEA, Volvo Cars, Deloitte, and the Swedish Police Authority actively recruit graduates.

fields.name: Lomonosov Moscow State University
fields.about:
Lomonosov Moscow State University: Overview

History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1755 by scientist Mikhail Lomonosov, Lomonosov Moscow State University (MSU) is one of Russia’s oldest and most prestigious public research institutions. It is accredited by the National Medical Commission (NMC) and the World Health Organization (WHO). Globally recognized, MSU was ranked 84th by QS, 93rd by ARWU, 189th by THE, and 266th by U.S. News in 2021. It also placed 43rd in 2008 and 45th in 2012 in HRLR’s global graduate performance rankings.

Campus, Facilities & Courses
Located on Moscow’s Sparrow Hills, MSU offers full-time undergraduate, master's, and specialist degrees—mostly taught in Russian. The university features state-of-the-art infrastructure, 39 faculties, 15 research centers, and unique venues like a botanical garden, zoological museum, and Earth sciences museum. It regularly hosts events such as Tatyana’s Day, Graduation Day, and Science Festival.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
MSU is internationally recognized for its high-quality, affordable education, attracting thousands of Indian and international students each year. It collaborates with research institutes, clinics, and medical universities, and is listed by ECFMG and WDOMS. MSU boasts 13 Nobel laureates, 6 Fields Medalists, and 1 Turing Award winner among its affiliates. Famous alumni include Anton Chekhov, Mikhail Gorbachev, and Andrey Kolmogorov.

Student Diversity & Global Engagement
MSU hosts around 38,000 students, including 4,000 international learners and 5,000 academic staff. With visitors from over 90 countries, the university supports a global academic environment and maintains a low student-faculty ratio to ensure personalized learning.

fields.name: Maastricht University
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1976, Maastricht University is one of the Netherlands' youngest yet most prestigious international universities. Known for its strong focus on global education, it holds affiliations with EUA, AMBA, YERUN, and other academic bodies. With over 400 global partnerships, it ranks 6th in THE Young University Rankings and 19th in the QS Top 50 Under 50.

Campuses & Courses
Located in southern Netherlands, Maastricht University emphasizes its “International Classroom” concept, fostering academic and cultural integration. The Inner City Campus hosts programs in Business, Law, Arts, and Social Sciences, while Randwyck Campus focuses on Health, Medicine, Psychology, and Sciences. Courses are offered in English and Dutch across Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, and professional levels.

Alumni & Achievements
With over 80,000 alumni worldwide, the university is known for producing leaders across disciplines, including politicians Sabine Uitslag and Jeroen Lenaers, scientist Jean Pieters, and TV host Kelly Weekers. It also leads the YUFE alliance, uniting young European universities.

Diversity & Student Life
Over half the student body and 40% of staff come from 100+ countries, creating a vibrant multicultural environment. The university celebrates Diversity Day and supports integration through clubs, buddy programs, and social events. In 2020–21, 58% of its students were women.

fields.name: Macquarie University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Macquarie University was founded in 1964 and named after Lachlan Macquarie, an early governor of New South Wales. It opened in 1967, quickly attracting more students than expected. As Sydney’s third metropolitan university, it was chosen to honor a significant Australian figure rather than a geographic name. Macquarie was the first Australian university to fully align its degrees with the Bologna Accord. It ranks around #200 globally in QS, THE, and US News 2022 rankings.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
The university serves over 40,000 students and 2,000 staff across 126 hectares near Sydney’s CBD and Australia’s largest tech hub. Its City Campus offers modern facilities in downtown Sydney. Over the past decade, Macquarie has invested more than a billion dollars in infrastructure. It has four campuses—three in Australia and one in China—and five faculties: Arts, Business and Economics, Human Sciences, Medicine and Health Sciences, and Science and Engineering. Collaborations with major employers like NSW Government, Accenture, Deloitte, and Adobe help tailor degrees to industry needs.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Ranked in the top 2% of universities worldwide, Macquarie is known for producing graduates in high-demand fields and research in the global top 1%. It won the Employability Award at the AFR Higher Education Awards for its innovative Bachelor of Arts. The alumni network spans 140 countries, with over 215,000 graduates including notable figures such as comedian Chris Lilley and politician Rob Oakeshott.

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
Macquarie has over 44,000 students and staff from 100+ countries, speaking 50+ languages, with strong support for students with disabilities. More than 350 global companies operate near campus, offering students networking and placement opportunities. The university maintains exchange programs with 150 universities across 45 countries. Top recruiters include Commonwealth Bank, EY, Deloitte, Woolworths, and KPMG.

fields.name: Loyalist College
fields.about:
Loyalist College, located in Belleville, Ontario, was established in 1967 as part of the province’s initiative to expand access to post-secondary education. Named to honor the United Empire Loyalists who settled in the region after the American Revolution, the college was founded with a mission to provide practical, career-focused education tailored to the evolving needs of both students and local industries.

From its modest beginnings, Loyalist College quickly grew in reputation and size, developing a wide range of diploma, certificate, and degree programs. It emphasized applied learning and strong connections to employers, fostering hands-on experience through co-op placements and industry partnerships.

Over the decades, Loyalist expanded its campus facilities and program offerings, including specialized areas like health sciences, technology, business, and skilled trades. The college has also embraced innovation and community engagement, continuously adapting to changing educational demands and contributing to regional economic development.

Today, Loyalist College stands as a respected institution dedicated to student success, practical training, and lifelong learning, serving thousands of learners each year both locally and internationally.

fields.name: Macromedia University of Applied Sciences
fields.about:
History , Affiliations & Rankings.
Macromedia University of Applied Sciences was founded in 1993 as Macromedia GmbH in Munich by Herbert Schmid-Eickhoff and Sabine Terjung. The institution was established in response to the 1999 Bologna Reforms, which aimed to standardize higher education across Europe. In 2006, Macromedia transitioned into a private university of applied sciences, offering bachelor's and master's programs in media, design, and management. In 2013, Macromedia became part of the international education group Galileo Global Education, headquartered in Paris. Since 2020, the university has been led by President Castulus Kolo, supported by Vice Presidents Florian Haumer and Joschka Mütterlein. 
Affiliations & Partnerships
Institutional & Strategic Partnerships
Regent’s University London: Offers Macromedia students the opportunity to earn a UK degree while studying in Germany. 
macromedia-fachhochschule.
University of Westminster: Provides pathways for Macromedia students to obtain a Bachelor of Arts (Hons) degree from a renowned British university. 
macromedia-fachhochschule.
Istituto Marangoni: Exclusive access for Macromedia students to fashion programs at campuses in Milan, Florence, Paris, and London. 
macromedia-fachhochschule.
Global Network
Macromedia University is a member of the Cumulus Association, a global network of universities and colleges of art and design. This affiliation facilitates international collaboration and exchange opportunities for students and faculty. 
Rankings & Recognition
U-Multirank Performance
Global Top 25 Performer: Recognized for strong connections with the work environment, including internships, industry collaborations, and practical projects. 
International Orientation: Ranked among the top 100 most international universities worldwide, reflecting a diverse student body and faculty. 
macromedia-fachhochschule.
Institutional & Program Accreditations
German Council of Science and Humanities: Institutionally accredited since 2011, with the most recent reaccreditation in 2022. 
System Accreditation: Granted by the German Accreditation Council since 2019, allowing the university to accredit its own programs. 
macromedia-fachhochschule.
FIBAA & ZEvA: Program accreditations from these agencies ensure the quality of degree programs.

fields.name: Loyalist College - Toronto
fields.about:
Loyalist College: Overview

History & Rankings
Founded in 1967 as part of Ontario’s initiative to expand career-focused education, Loyalist College was named in honor of the United Empire Loyalists. It was established to provide diploma and certificate programs to support workforce development. The college is accredited by the Canadian Association of Schools of Nursing (CASN) and received a 7-year accreditation for its BSc program in partnership with Brock University. It currently ranks 150th in Webometrics’ national ranking.

Campus & Programs
Located in North York, Toronto, Loyalist offers easy access to transit, affordable housing, recreational spaces, and job opportunities across various industries. The campus supports over 70 diploma and certificate programs, with facilities designed for both academic and hands-on learning.

Achievements & Alumni
Loyalist has expanded significantly, including new student housing and the Bay of Quinte Skills Centre, a $16.6 million facility for skilled trades training. The college boasts a 96% graduate satisfaction rate and continues to rank among Canada’s top institutions. Notable alumni include Jamie Schmale (MP) and Todd Smith (MPP).

Diversity & Career Opportunities
With over 3,500 students, including 1,356 international students, Loyalist is one of Ontario’s most diverse colleges. It ranks in the top 25% for graduate employment in the province, with alumni working at top companies like IBM, Oracle, Google, and Accenture.

fields.name: Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology
fields.about:
Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology (MITT)

Founded in 1983 as the South Winnipeg Technical Vocational Centre, MITT was renamed in 2014 and has over 35 years of experience in providing quality secondary and post-secondary skills training. It is a recognized Designated Learning Institute (DLI) in Canada.

Campuses & Programs:
MITT operates multiple campuses across Manitoba, including Henlow, Fultz, Pembina, Erin, and the main street campus. It offers programs in Technology, Vocational Training, and Adult Education. Courses range from core subjects like English, Canadian History, and Math to technical programs such as Automotive Technology, Culinary Arts, Electrical Trades, Hairstyling, Motorsport Technician, and Welding.

Achievements & Alumni:
MITT is Manitoba’s only institute integrating employability skills into all programs. Its alumni work globally in roles like construction superintendent, data analyst, admissions manager, and technology services.

Industry Partnerships & Student Placement:
MITT has strong ties with local and multinational companies, providing students with real-world experience and job placements. Graduates commonly work at McDonald’s, Walmart, Subway, Tim Hortons, RBC, Shaw Communications, 7-Eleven, and more.

fields.name: Marist College
fields.about:
History & Affiliations
Founded in 1905 as a seminary for the Marist Brothers, Marist College evolved into a co-educational institution by 1968. It gained its current name in 1960 and is now recognized as a leading liberal arts and sciences college. It is affiliated with the National Association of Independent Colleges and Universities (NAICU) and accredited by CAEP under NCATE standards. U.S. News & World Report ranks Marist #10 among Regional Universities North (2022).

Campuses & Programs
Marist offers stunning campuses on the Hudson River in New York and in Florence, Italy. Students can choose from over 90 programs across 7 schools, including Communication, Liberal Arts, Management, Science, and more. It offers undergraduate, graduate, 5-year dual degrees, certificate, and doctoral programs (e.g., Physical Therapy, Physician Assistant). Marist Abroad provides 75+ global study options across six continents. Online offerings include MBA, MPA, and MS in Information Systems.

Recognition & Alumni
Recognized by Princeton Review, Kiplinger’s, and Forbes for academic quality and career outcomes, Marist is also listed among the "Top 50 Colleges That Create Futures." Its online MBA was ranked among the best by U.S. News in 2019. The college has a global alumni network of over 30,000, including journalist Bill O’Reilly, basketball player Jared Jordan, and actor Kathy Liebert.

Student Life & Career Support
Marist enrolls around 6,657 students (5,037 undergrads), with 58% female representation. The campus hosts 80+ student clubs and 23 varsity sports teams in the MAAC. Students enjoy a vibrant community with cultural outings, volunteer opportunities, and holistic support services, from health care to career counseling. Top employers include Deloitte, Microsoft, ESPN, Accenture, and Duchess Community College.
