fields.name: Loyola Marymount University
fields.about:
Loyola Marymount University (LMU) – Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1865, Loyola Marymount University is a private Jesuit and Marymount research university located in West Los Angeles, California. LMU blends two Catholic education traditions—Jesuit and Religious of the Sacred Heart of Mary. It also includes Loyola Law School, based in downtown LA. The university is a member of the Association of Jesuit Colleges and Universities (AJCU) and the Association of Catholic Colleges and Universities. LMU is ranked between 131–140 in the QS World Rankings.

Campus & Academics
LMU’s scenic Westchester campus overlooks the city and covers 99 acres. Notable campus landmarks include Sacred Heart Chapel and Regents Bell Tower. The university offers 60 undergraduate majors, 55 minors, 51 master’s programs, and doctoral degrees in law and education. It also offers study abroad programs across five continents and an Air Force ROTC program.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
LMU has been recognized for its sustainability efforts with awards from the EPA and California Interfaith Power & Light. It earned a Silver rating from the STARS assessment for sustainability in higher education. Distinguished alumni include screenwriter Brian Helgeland, film producer Barbara Broccoli, and director Francis Lawrence.

Student Life & Industry Connections
The university enrolls nearly 9,800 students, with around 6,500 undergraduates and 2,200 graduate students. LMU emphasizes diversity, equity, and inclusion, with active efforts to promote social justice. It maintains strong ties with top employers like Google, Boeing, IBM, KPMG, Nestlé, and Merrill Lynch, offering students valuable networking and career opportunities.

fields.name: Marquette University
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1881 by the Jesuits and named after explorer Rev. Jacques Marquette, the university became the first Catholic co-ed institution in 1909. Known as the Jesuit University of Milwaukee, it is affiliated with AJCU, ACCU, WAICU, and NAICU. U.S. News ranks Marquette among the Best Colleges for Veterans (#56), Best Undergraduate Teaching (#18), and Best Value Schools (#54).

Campus & Academics
Located on a 93-acre campus in Milwaukee, Marquette offers extensive facilities including libraries, gyms, chapels, and housing. The university hosts numerous student organizations and cultural events. Academically, it has 11 schools offering 83 undergraduate majors, 81 minors, graduate and professional programs in dentistry, law, and over 60 master’s and doctoral degrees.

Achievements & Alumni
Marquette is recognized for academic rigor and innovation, featuring in Princeton Review’s Best 387 Colleges and Top 20 Private Schools for Internships. It’s ranked Wisconsin’s Best College for Job Placement. Notable alumni include author Uncle Fester, actor Pat Finn, and journalist James Foley.

Student Diversity & Careers
With over 11,200 students, the campus is diverse: 68% White, 13% Hispanic/Latino, 6% Asian, and others. Career services provide resume help, interview prep, and job search support via the Handshake portal. Average graduate salary is $74,459. Employers like GE Healthcare, Baird, and Milwaukee Tool actively recruit from Marquette.

It started as a small liberal arts college in downtown Chicago, aimed at providing a Jesuit education focused on intellectual rigor and social justice. fields.name: Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich
fields.about:
LMU Munich: History, Rankings & Global Reach
Founded in 1472 in Ingolstadt, LMU Munich is one of Europe’s oldest universities and has played a key role in religious and political developments for over 550 years. Today, LMU is a top-ranked, co-educational institution with over 52,400 students, officially recognized by the Bavarian Ministry of Science and the Arts. It is affiliated with the European University Association (EUA) and the League of European Research Universities (LERU), and ranked 32nd globally by Times Higher Education in 2022.

Campuses & Academics
LMU’s four campuses across Munich offer state-of-the-art facilities and a rich academic environment. The historic main building at Geschwister-Scholl-Platz houses the University Library, which holds over 5 million volumes. LMU offers 300+ degree programs, many in English, along with summer schools, research, exchange opportunities, and public lecture series open to all.

Excellence & Alumni
A University of Excellence, LMU excels in research and education across all disciplines. It has consistently ranked among the world’s top 100 universities and collaborates with 600+ global partners. LMU boasts 43 Nobel Laureates, including Wilhelm Röntgen, Max Planck, and Thomas Mann, and has a vast international alumni network.

Diversity & Career Prospects
LMU hosts a diverse student body, including 9,300+ international students and over 31,700 women. The university offers vibrant student life through clubs, arts, sports, and media groups. Located in Munich—a tech and media hub—LMU connects students with top employers like Microsoft, Amazon, BMW, and Siemens through regular career events and seminars.

fields.name: Marshall University
fields.about:
History & Accreditation
Founded as Marshall Academy in 1837 and named after U.S. Supreme Court Chief Justice John Marshall, Marshall became a college in 1858 and gained university status in 1961. It is fully accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC), with additional program-specific accreditations. In 2022, U.S. News & World Report ranked it among the Best National Universities and Top Public Schools.

Campus & Academics
Located in the Tri-State area of West Virginia, Kentucky, and Ohio, Marshall has a strong regional and national presence. Its campuses include the Huntington main campus, Medical Center, Forensic Science Center, Visual Arts Center, and others. The university offers 60+ undergraduate, 56 graduate, and 35 certificate programs, with popular majors including Biology, Business Administration, Forensic Science, and Education.

Achievements & Alumni
Marshall is known for academic and athletic excellence, offering various clubs and 32 intramural sports. Notable alumni include NFL legend Randy Moss, actress Conchata Ferrell, and basketball star Hal Greer. Graduates have also become CEOs, Pulitzer Prize winners, and leaders across fields.

Diversity & Global Reach
With a student-faculty ratio of 19:1, over 44% of classes have fewer than 20 students, ensuring personalized learning. Students from 42 countries, including China, India, and Saudi Arabia, contribute to a diverse community of 455 international students, 159 of whom are undergraduates.

fields.name: Lundquist Business School
fields.about: The Charles H. Lundquist College of Business at the University of Oregon, located in Eugene, Oregon, traces its roots back to 1914 when the School of Commerce was established. It evolved into the College of Business Administration in 1967 and was renamed in 1994 after alumnus Charles H. Lundquist following his significant financial contributions, which helped fund programs like the Lundquist Center for Entrepreneurship. The college is housed in the modern Lillis Business Complex, known for its sustainable design, and offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and specialized business programs. Over the years, it has produced notable alumni such as Nike co-founders Phil Knight and Bill Bowerman, reflecting its strong influence on both the regional and global business communities.
fields.admission_requirements:
Application Steps:

Apply through the University of Oregon Office of Admissions website.

For undergraduate applicants:

Choose either Standard Admission (university acceptance + completing lower-division courses with a 3.0 GPA) or Direct Admission (for high-achieving high school seniors).

For graduate applicants:

Select your graduate program (MBA, MS, Master of Accounting, PhD, etc.).

Submit your application by the program-specific deadline.

Pay the application fee and submit your application.

Documents Required:

Academic transcripts (high school for undergrad, college/university for graduate).

Standardized test scores (optional for U.S. undergrad applicants; GMAT/GRE for some graduate programs).

Personal statement or Statement of Purpose.

Resume or Curriculum Vitae (required for graduate applicants).

Letters of recommendation (optional for undergrad, required for graduate).

Proof of English proficiency (TOEFL/IELTS) for international students.

Additional documents for international applicants: visa and financial support proof.

fields.name: National College of Ireland
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1951 as the Catholic Workers College in Dublin, the National College of Ireland (NCI) evolved from Jesuit roots and later gained recognition from Ireland’s National Council for Educational Awards (NCEA). Rebranded in 1998, NCI now affiliates with HETAC and offers programs from Foundation to Ph.D. level. Webometrics ranks it #3821 globally.

Infrastructure, Campus, and Courses
Located in Dublin’s International Financial Services Center (IFSC), NCI’s compact 0.8-acre campus is close to major tech firms like Facebook and LinkedIn. Facilities include modern classrooms, labs, library, and student housing. Popular programs cover Accounting, Business Management, AI, Cybersecurity, Fintech, MBA, and more, offering certificates through master’s levels.

Achievements and Alumni
NCI holds the Athena SWAN Bronze Award for gender equality and inclusivity. It partners with quality bodies like QQI, CIPD, and ICM to ensure accredited courses. The School of Computing ranks in Ireland’s top three. The alumni network exceeds 50,000, featuring notable figures such as Paul Reid (HSE Director-General), wrestler Sheamus, and former Dublin Mayor Brendan Carr.

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
With around 5,000 students (18% international), the gender ratio is 42% male to 58% female. Over 50 clubs and events foster student engagement. Leading employers recruiting from NCI include Google, PayPal, EY, IBM, Deloitte, KPMG, Bank of America, JP Morgan, Dell, HP, and Accenture.
fields.admission_requirements:
Application Process:
Choose your program on the NCI website.

Check entry requirements and English proficiency (e.g., IELTS 6.5).

Prepare required documents: transcripts, English test, CV, passport, personal statement.

Apply online via the NCI application portal.

Pay the €25 non-refundable application fee.

Submit your application before the deadline (usually July-August for Fall intake).

Await admission decision; you may be invited for an interview.

Postgraduate applicants (MBA) need a bachelor’s degree, 3+ years work experience, CV, and transcripts.

Required Documents:

Official transcripts and grade cards

Passport copy and photos

Visa (if applicable)

Updated CV/Resume

English proficiency test scores

Recommendation letters

Statement of Purpose

fields.name: Martin Luther University of Halle Wittenberg
fields.about:
Martin Luther University of Halle-Wittenberg (MLU)
Located in Saxony-Anhalt, Germany, Martin Luther University of Halle-Wittenberg (MLU) is a public research university with a rich history dating back to 1502, originally founded as the University of Wittenberg. It merged with Friedrichs University Halle in 1817. MLU is committed to providing accessible, high-quality education rooted in the values of social justice, community, and collaboration.

MLU offers a strong academic profile across a wide range of disciplines, including humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, and medicine. Programs emphasize transferable skills valuable for both academic and professional success. The university also offers unique minor subjects not available elsewhere in Germany and maintains close partnerships with other universities, research institutes, and industries.

In addition to its main Weinberg Campus, MLU has three key locations. At the center is University Square—one of Europe’s most beautiful and historic academic spaces. The new Steintor Campus houses institutes for the humanities and social sciences, while the Francke Foundations serve as a hub for teaching and research.

MLU stands out for its belief that higher education should empower individuals to create meaningful, positive change in the world.
fields.admission_requirements: NA

fields.name: National University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
National University is a private university founded in 1971, based in San Diego, California, with campuses in California and Nevada, plus extensive online programs. It’s one of California’s largest private non-profit universities, enrolling over 24,000 students across 130+ programs. In 2019, a $350 million donation led to the rebranding of its School of Education as the Sanford College of Education and a tuition reduction. It ranks #94-122 among Regional Universities West and #68 for Social Mobility.

Campus and Programs
National University’s main campus is in La Jolla, CA, with a second campus in Henderson, NV. It offers around 75 programs on-campus and online, including sciences, business, engineering, health care, cybersecurity, media, law, and international business. Student support includes wellness services, academic help centers, and language programs.

Achievements and Alumni
Founded by retired Navy Lt. Commander David Chigos to serve working adults, National University began with 27 students in 1972. It offers reduced tuition for qualified students and has notable alumni like business author Gerry Czarnecki, journalist Marti Emerald, and MLB coach Brian Graham.

Student Body and Employers
With about 23,000 students (average age 32), National University includes active military members and is among the largest graduate schools in the U.S. Its 150,000+ alumni work worldwide. Top recruiters include Fiverr, US Navy, Amazon, Microsoft, Deloitte, Google, and more.

fields.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded on April 10, 1861, just before the U.S. Civil War, MIT began classes in 1865 and moved from Boston to Cambridge in 1916. Conceived by William Barton Rogers, MIT aimed to be a new kind of polytechnic institute. It is affiliated with top academic consortia like the Association of American Universities and COFHE. MIT consistently ranks among the best universities worldwide, holding the #1 spot in the QS World Rankings 2021 and 2022, and top positions in THE and U.S. News rankings.

Campus & Academics
MIT’s 166-acre campus sits between Central and Kendall Squares and includes playing fields, gardens, residences, and public art installations. The university offers a wide range of programs in science, engineering, humanities, management, political science, gender studies, and cutting-edge fields like blockchain, quantum physics, and AI. With over 1,000 faculty members, MIT is a global leader in education and digital learning innovation.

Achievements & Alumni
MIT has produced 97 Nobel laureates, 26 Turing Award winners, 8 Fields Medalists, and 41 astronauts. Its Sloan School of Management ranks #3 globally for MBA programs. Notable alumni include physicist Richard Feynman, UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, astronaut Buzz Aldrin, economist Raghuram Rajan, and TCS founder F.C. Kohli.

Diversity & Career Opportunities
MIT enrolls about 12,000 students from 120+ countries, with 98.6% studying full-time. The student body is ethnically diverse and intellectually vibrant. Top global companies like Microsoft, Google, Accenture, Oracle, and Infosys regularly recruit from MIT.

fields.name: NEOMA Business School
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
NEOMA Business School, based in Paris, France, was formed in 2013 by merging Reims Management School (1928) and Rouen Business School (1871). It is part of the Conférence des Grandes Écoles and holds triple accreditation from EQUIS, AMBA, and AACSB. NEOMA ranked 251-300 in the 2022 QS World University Rankings by subject, and its Executive Education program placed 52nd globally in the Financial Times 2022 ranking.

Campuses and Programs
NEOMA operates three campuses in Paris, Reims, and Rouen, plus Europe’s first fully virtual campus. The school offers bachelor’s degrees, Masters in Management, MBA, EMBA, specialized MSc programs, PhDs, and executive education, supported by modern facilities and vibrant student life.

Achievements and Alumni
NEOMA is recognized globally for expertise in Marketing, Management, Entrepreneurship, Supply Chain, Finance, and Accounting. With 72% international faculty and partnerships with 200+ companies and 350 academic institutions, it boasts a strong alumni network including leaders at Hermes, Huawei, Amazon, and Ferrero.

Student Diversity and Recruiters
Out of 9,500 students, 2,500 are international from 100 countries, with 1,600 having work experience. About 27% receive scholarships or apprenticeships. Top recruiters include EY, Deloitte, Microsoft, Amazon, Accenture, Chanel, Danone, SAP, Salesforce, and Société Générale.

fields.name: Matrix College
fields.about:
Matrix College of Management Technology and Healthcare Inc.
Founded in 2014, Matrix College is a registered private career college in Montreal, Quebec, offering specialized programs in Business, Technology, and Engineering. It provides hands-on, job-focused training with courses approved by the Ministry of Education and recognized as a Designated Learning Institution under the International Student Program.

Programs and Training
Matrix offers a variety of vendor-authorized and independent IT certifications, including SAP, Cisco, and VMware. Students benefit from experienced instructors, accelerated training, and targeted course materials, helping them enter the workforce faster.

Student Experience and Support
The college fosters a diverse international community with vibrant social and cultural activities. Matrix supports student career growth through academic advising, internships, job placement, and resume workshops. Many graduates are hired by top international companies.

Affordability and Recognition
Matrix College emphasizes quality education at affordable rates, with up to 26% education tax credits for students.

fields.name: New England College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
New England College, founded in 1946, is a private liberal arts college regionally accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education. It had an enrollment of 4,327 students in Fall 2020. The Arundel campus operated from 1970 to 1998.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
The 225-acre campus features around 30 buildings and over 30 student clubs. Since 2019, NEC includes a modern esports arena with various sports and recreational options. It offers 30 undergraduate majors and 27 minors (BA, BS, BFA), plus graduate programs like MBA, MS in Computer Information Systems, Human Services, Health Informatics, and Applied Data Sciences.

Achievements and Alumni
NEC is known for quality programs and notable alumni, including actress Geena Davis, who attended as a freshman.

Student Diversity and Enrollment
The college serves about 1,060 undergraduates at Henniker, 255 at Manchester, and 650 online students. International students make up 32% of the population, representing over 28 countries, enriching campus diversity.

fields.name: New England Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
New England Institute of Technology (NEIT) is a private, non-profit university founded in 1940 and led by Richard I. Gouse since 1971. It is accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education. NEIT focuses on preparing students with technical and interpersonal skills that employers seek.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Courses
NEIT has three Rhode Island campuses—two in Warwick and a 220-acre main campus in East Greenwich near Providence. The main campus features classrooms, labs, a library, lounges, and cafeterias. NEIT offers certificate, associate, bachelor’s, graduate, and online programs, specializing in fields like nursing, software engineering, shipbuilding, manufacturing, criminal justice, and more.

Achievements and Alumni
NEIT balances hands-on training with analytical skills. Its Shipbuilding/Marine Trades and Advanced Manufacturing Institute offers free training for unemployed individuals. Notable alumni include Juan Rodriguez, who used his NEIT skills to succeed in media production.

Student Life and Industry Connections
With around 1,800 undergraduates (fall 2020), NEIT offers clubs related to technology, arts, and sports. It’s a SkillsUSA member, helping students improve vocational skills and connect with employers through competitions and events.

fields.name: Maynooth University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Established in 1795 by the government as a college for Catholic lay and ecclesiastical students, the College of Maynooth became a recognized college of the National University of Ireland in 1910 and was rebranded as Maynooth University in 2014. It is affiliated with the European University Association, National Universities of Ireland, Irish Universities Association, and Universities Ireland. It ranks between #751-800 globally (QS World Rankings), #501-600 (Times Higher Education), and #1198 (US News & World Report).

Campus and Academics
Maynooth University’s campus stretches from Maynooth to Kilcock, divided into North and South Campuses, with four student residence buildings: Rye, Village, River, and Courtyard. The university comprises three faculties—Arts, Celtic Studies & Philosophy; Science & Engineering; and Social Sciences—offering courses across 30 departments.

Achievements and Alumni
Maynooth University has a rich history of accomplishments, ranking 4th in the 2008 Irish Sunday Times University League Table and recording the highest growth in first-choice applications in 2010. Notable alumni include Noel Dempsey (TD and Cabinet Minister), Cornelius Denvir (mathematician and bishop), and Gerald Molloy (theologian and physicist).

Student Diversity and Career Services
Hosting over 2,700 international students annually, Maynooth offers extensive international exchange programs through partnerships with universities worldwide. The university provides comprehensive career services, including resume and cover letter support, interview preparation, and career fairs to connect students with employers.

fields.name: Mcgill University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1821 in Montreal by royal charter from King George IV, McGill University is named after Scottish trader James McGill, whose 1813 donation established its predecessor. Renamed McGill University in 1885, it has become one of Canada’s top institutions with a global reputation. Affiliations include Universities Canada, European University Association, Association of American Universities (one of only two outside the US), Global University Leaders Forum, and others. McGill is renowned as Canada’s leading medical university and ranks #27 in QS World Rankings 2022, #44 in Times Higher Education, and #51 by US News & World Report.

Campus and Academics
McGill operates two campuses: the Downtown Montreal main campus and the Macdonald campus on Montreal’s western edge, covering 1,600 acres with green spaces, an arboretum, greenhouses, and a sustainable farm. The university comprises 11 faculties and 13 schools, offering over 130 undergraduate and 74 graduate programs. Popular courses include Biomedical Engineering, Business Analytics, Architecture, Anthropology, MBA, and LLM programs. McGill boasts the highest percentage of PhD students among Canadian research universities and provides robust internship opportunities under expert faculty guidance.

Achievements and Alumni
McGill students enter with the highest average grades in Canada and win more national and international awards than peers at any other Canadian university. As a founding member of Universities 21, McGill is a leader in global research collaboration. It has pioneered numerous discoveries such as Plexiglass, the world’s first artificial cell, Phytotron, radioautography, and the AIDS drug 3TC. Notable alumni include 12 Nobel laureates, 145 Rhodes Scholars, 3 Canadian Prime Ministers, multiple Grammy and Pulitzer winners, Olympians, and Emmy Award recipients. McGill’s legacy includes innovations in sports rules and life-saving medical advances.

Student Diversity and Career Services
With nearly 40,000 students, McGill attracts international students from over 150 countries, making up 29% of the population. The university offers comprehensive career services through its Career Planning Service (CAPS), assisting students with resume building and job placement. International students must hold a valid work permit to participate in job placements. Leading employers recruiting at McGill include JPMorgan Chase, National Bank of Canada, Sustainalytics, and Grasshopper Energy.

fields.name: New European College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
New European College (NEC), a private business school in Munich, was founded in 2014 and approved by the Bavarian Ministry of Education in 2015. It offers bachelor’s and master’s degrees in business administration and international management in partnership with Wittenborg University of Applied Sciences. NEC’s programs are accredited by Dutch NVAO and FIBAA, and the college is a member of AACSB and AMBA. It ranks 2nd in the Netherlands for its BBA program and 4th among Small Applied Sciences Universities.

Campus & Programs
Located 15 minutes from central Munich, NEC’s campus features modern classrooms, libraries, student lounges, and housing services. Programs include Financial Services Management, Marketing & Communication, Economics & Management, plus a Business Preparation Program for undergraduates.

Achievements & Alumni
NEC is accredited by Bavarian and North Rhine-Westphalian education ministries and is known for affordable tuition and high acceptance. Graduates have strong job prospects in Germany. Notable alumni include entrepreneurs like Marco Kreuzer (Fairfleet) and Olga Gayduk (Il Signo restaurant).

Student Diversity & Employers
The college hosts students from 43+ countries speaking over 27 languages, embracing diverse backgrounds. Top recruiters include Amazon, Allianz, Fujitsu, AUTO1 Group, and Novartis.

fields.name: New Jersey Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1885, the New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) began with just 88 students and has grown into a leading public polytechnic university. It holds accreditations from MSA, ABET, AACSB, and NAAB, and is affiliated with Sea Grant and Space Grant programs. NJIT ranks #501–600 globally (THE 2022), #201–300 in Impact Rankings, and #177 among U.S. colleges.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
Located in Newark, just 20 minutes from NYC, NJIT offers 126 degree programs across six schools. The modern campus includes state-of-the-art academic buildings, residence halls, sports facilities, and dining options. NJIT offers around 50 undergraduate and 60 graduate programs in fields like Engineering, Business, Architecture, Computer Science, Media, Law, and Pharmacy.

Accomplishments and Alumni
NJIT contributes $2.8 billion annually to New Jersey’s economy and holds the R1 classification for high research activity. It spent $161 million on research in FY2019 and is home to the state’s largest tech and life sciences incubator. Notable alumni include Ian G. Durand, Arthur E. Hahn Jr., and Kevin F. Gallagher.

Student Diversity and Recruiters
With over 1,900 international students from 70+ countries, NJIT is highly diverse and ranks #1 in New Jersey for awarding engineering degrees to African-American and Hispanic students. The university supports 140+ student clubs and has strong employer ties, with graduates hired by Amazon, Verizon, JPMorgan Chase, Citi, and Johnson & Johnson.

fields.name: MDH University of Applied Science
fields.about:
History & Overview
MDH University of Applied Sciences, also known as Mediadesign Hochschule (mdh), was established in 2004 in Germany. With campuses in Berlin, Düsseldorf, and Munich, mdh offers a practical, project-based education in creative and digital disciplines. The university is known for its innovative programs in areas such as Media Design, Game Design, Digital Film Design, Fashion Management, and Digital Leadership.
Affiliations & Global Connections
mdh maintains international partnerships with leading universities in China, the USA, Brazil, and New Zealand. These collaborations facilitate student exchanges and global learning opportunities.
Rankings & Recognition
While specific global rankings are not detailed, mdh is recognized for its industry-oriented education and strong connections with the media and tech sectors. The university's emphasis on practical skills and innovation positions it as a reputable institution in its field.
Scholarships & Financial Support
MDH Education Fund
The MDH Education Fund offers flexible tuition financing through an income-based repayment model. Students can study without upfront tuition fees, repaying a percentage of their income after graduation, provided it exceeds €25,000 annually. This model is designed to ease financial burdens and support diverse career paths.
External Scholarships
International students may also explore external scholarships, such as the Education Future International Scholarship, which offers partial funding for studies abroad

fields.name: New Mexico State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
New Mexico State University (NMSU) began as Las Cruces College in 1888 and became a university in 1960. It is a land-grant and NASA space-grant institution, as well as a Hispanic Serving Institution. NMSU is ranked among the top U.S. universities by U.S. News & World Report and placed #821 in the 2022 Best Global Universities ranking.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
NMSU’s 900-acre main campus offers over 90 undergraduate and 50 graduate programs. It operates five campuses, 12 research centers, and a satellite campus in Albuquerque. The university has two major libraries housing over 1 million volumes. Programs include bachelor’s, master’s, certificates, associate degrees, and 28 doctoral programs in fields like agriculture, engineering, and sciences. Key schools include Business, Nursing, Liberal Arts, and Criminal Justice.

Achievements and Alumni
NMSU leads in federal science and engineering funding among minority-serving institutions and is recognized for research in agriculture, energy, and space science. It supports student development through NCAA Division I athletics and extracurricular activities. Notable alumni include Sarah Stewart (scientist), Roosevelt Skerrit (Prime Minister of Dominica), and actor Scott Bailey.

Student Body and Employers
With over 11,000 students, including 700+ internationals from 80+ countries, NMSU boasts a diverse community. About 16% live on campus. Graduates find jobs at major companies such as Microsoft, Amazon, Intel, and Google.

fields.name: Medicine Hat College
fields.about:
Overview
Medicine Hat College is a public community college established under the Alberta Post-secondary Learning Act. It focuses on skill-based training aligned with industry needs, offering apprenticeships and continuing education for students of all backgrounds.

Campuses and Programs
The college has two campuses: the main one in Medicine Hat (home to 95% of students) and a smaller Brooks campus. Key programs include Science and Technology, Health and Human Services, Visual and Performing Arts, Business, Liberal Arts, and new applied degrees in Ecotourism and Visual Communications.

Student Experience and Alumni
With small class sizes and strong support services—such as counseling, residence, and cultural programs—the college aims to prepare students for fast, rewarding careers through diplomas, certificates, and applied courses.

Diversity and Affiliations
About 8,000 students enroll in various programs, including many international students mainly from China, India, Japan, and the Philippines, with a significant Indian student presence. Medicine Hat College is part of Campus Alberta, a network of post-secondary institutions.

fields.name: Melbourne Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History & Growth
Founded in 1996 by Shesh Ghale and Jamuna Gurung in Melbourne, initially offering diplomas in business, IT, and English; expanded to a Sydney campus in 2003 through a partnership with the University of New England.
In 2016, MIT opened a second Melbourne campus in the heritage-listed Argus Building.
Affiliations & Accreditation
Affiliated with Federation University Australia (FedUni): FedUni oversees academic quality and awards degrees, while MIT delivers teaching and support.Accredited by TEQSA and CRICOS-registered for international students.
Professional accreditations include Engineers Australia (telecom engineering) and CPA Australia, ICAS (accounting) .

fields.name: New York Institute of Technology (Canada)
fields.about: Founded in 1955 in New York, the New York Institute of Technology (NYIT) has grown over the past six decades to establish campuses worldwide, including locations in China and the Middle East. NYIT holds prestigious national and international accreditations such as those from The Middle States Commission on Higher Education and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). The Vancouver campus offers a variety of programs, including Cyber Security, Finance, Management, Instructional Technology, and Energy Management. Among these, the Master of Science in Information, Network, and Computer Security (MS-INCS) stands out as a highly sought-after program. The institute features a dedicated innovation lab where research is conducted in areas like 3D printing and design, electronics and programming, multimedia production, and virtual reality technologies. To support its student community financially, NYIT provides scholarships for incoming freshmen, current students, transfers, and graduate learners. Situated near popular attractions such as Granville Island, Stanley Park, Chinatown, and English Bay, the campus offers a vibrant environment. Notable alumni include Olympic skating medalist Allison Baver, UAE’s Minister of Climate Change and Environment Thani Ahmed Alzeyoudi, and Indera Rampal-Harrod, HR Director at American Express.

Bachelor's degree (4-year or equivalent) from an accredited institution

Minimum GPA of 2.85/4.0 (GMAT may be required for MBA if GPA < 3.0)

Complete the online application form via NYIT Vancouver portal.
Pay the non-refundable application fee (approx. CAD $50–$75).

Upload required documents as listed below.

Submit your application and wait for confirmation.

Monitor your application status through the application portal.

Document Required:
Completed online application form

Application fee payment receipt (CAD $50–$75)

Valid passport copy

Proof of English proficiency (IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, or Duolingo)

Bachelor’s degree completion certificate

Semester-by-semester transcripts for all years of bachelor’s degree

Resume or CV (1–2 pages)

Statement of Purpose (recommended)

Any additional transcripts or certificates earned beyond the bachelor's degree

fields.name: Niagara College
fields.about:
Niagara College Overview
History & Affiliations
Founded in 1967, Niagara College was established to provide career-focused diploma and certificate programs. It launched Canada’s first teaching winery in 2002 and first teaching brewery in 2011. The college is affiliated with CCAA, ACCC, AUCC, and CBIE.

Campuses & Programs
Located in Ontario’s Niagara Region, the college operates campuses in Welland and Niagara-on-the-Lake, plus an international campus in Ta'if, Saudi Arabia. It offers over 130 programs across credentials like diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, and apprenticeships.

Rankings & Recognition
Niagara College has consistently ranked among Canada’s top research colleges and was recognized with a Minister’s Lifetime Achievement Award in 2021. It ranks among the top 10 research colleges in Canada and boasts strong sustainability efforts, diverting 65% of campus waste from landfills.

Student Diversity & Outcomes
With more than 10,000 full-time students, including 1,000+ international students from 70 countries, Niagara College fosters an inclusive environment with active clubs and societies. 88.1% of graduates are employed within 6 months, and 91% of employers report high satisfaction with NC grads.

Alumni Network
The college has a strong alumni base of nearly 80,000 graduates working worldwide across diverse industries.

fields.name: Memorial University of Newfoundland
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1925, Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) was established to honor Newfoundlanders who died in World War I. As Newfoundland and Labrador’s only university, MUN plays a vital role in education, research, and community development. It’s recognized for academic excellence, innovation, and social impact. Globally, it ranks #751–800 (QS 2022) and #601–800 (THE 2022), and has earned national awards like the SSHRC Insight Award.

Campuses, Programs & Facilities
MUN has multiple campuses, including St. John’s, Grenfell, Harlow, and the recently opened Signal Hill Campus. It offers over 100 programs, from certificates to doctoral degrees, in fields such as Engineering, Pharmacy, Arts, Business, Nursing, Science, and Marine Studies. The Marine Institute is globally recognized for ocean training and applied research. MUN is also home to the world’s only co-op program in Marine and Naval Architectural Engineering.

Achievements & Alumni
MUN ranks among Canada’s top 20 universities, with over $100 million in research funding (2017). Its faculty includes Canada Research Chairs and fellows of national academies. Notable alumni include Lt. Gen. Rick Hillier, novelist Wayne Johnston, and business leader Moya Greene.

Student Diversity & Employers
MUN hosts over 19,000 students from 118 countries, with more than 20% international students. Major recruiters include Verafin, Scotiabank, Deloitte, and EY, reflecting strong industry connections and employability.

fields.name: Nipissing University
fields.about:
Nipissing University Overview
History & Affiliations
Founded in 1967 through a partnership with Laurentian University, Nipissing gained full university status in 1992. It maintains academic partnerships with institutions such as Algonquin, Centennial, Lambton, and St. Clair Colleges. It is affiliated with several academic bodies, including AUCC, IAU, COU, and the Fields Institute.

Campus & Academics
The main campus is in North Bay, Ontario, with a satellite location in Brantford. Canadore College shares space on the North Bay campus. Facilities include academic buildings, labs, sports areas, and student spaces. The university offers 12 bachelor’s programs, 8 master’s/professional courses, 19 certificates, and 4 joint programs with Canadore. Research areas include robotics, biomechanics, geomatics, and nuclear studies. Student life is supported by the Nipissing University Student Union (NUSU).

Research & Alumni
Nipissing actively supports research through funding programs and participates in the Canada Research Chairs initiative. The university emphasizes research ethics and long-term impact. Notable alumni include Colin Simpson, George Chiang, Judi Longfield, and Natalia Kusendova.

Diversity & Community Engagement
With strong ties to local Indigenous communities, Nipissing offers programs like the Aboriginal Advantage and Peer-to-Peer Mentorship. International students make up around 4% of the population, and the gender ratio is 31% male to 69% female.

fields.name: Michigan Technological University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1885 as the Michigan Mining School, MTU was established to train engineers for Michigan’s copper mining industry. Over the decades, it expanded its academic offerings and underwent several name changes—becoming Michigan Technological University in 1964 to reflect its broader mission. Today, MTU is known globally for excellence in engineering, technology, and applied research.

Campus, Programs & Infrastructure
Located in Houghton, Michigan, MTU is recognized as one of the safest U.S. campuses and offers a lively student experience. The university provides over 57 undergraduate and graduate programs in fields like engineering, science, business, mathematics, and the humanities. It also offers career-focused certificates in areas such as:

Data Science

Electric Power Engineering

Nanotechnology

Hybrid Vehicle Engineering

Sustainability

Achievements & Notable Alumni
MTU has a long-standing reputation for academic excellence. Distinguished alumni include:

Melvin Calvin, Nobel Laureate

Chris Conner, NHL player

Jill Dickman, Nevada State Assembly member

Student Diversity & Career Outcomes
MTU enrolls students from over 100 countries and all 50 U.S. states, fostering a diverse and inclusive campus. With a strong focus on innovation and entrepreneurship, MTU reports a 93% job placement rate and an average graduate salary of $67,400 USD.

fields.name: Norquest College
fields.about:
NorQuest College Overview
Founded in 1965 as the Alberta Vocational Centre in Edmonton, NorQuest College began with just a few classrooms and training labs aimed at equipping underemployed Albertans with practical workforce skills. As demand grew, a main campus was established in downtown Edmonton in 1970, and the institution expanded its programs to better meet labor market needs.

Renamed Alberta Vocational College in 1990, it officially became NorQuest College in 1999 after transitioning to a public, board-governed institution. That same year, it introduced additional learning centers in core subjects.

Today, NorQuest offers a wide range of diploma, certificate, and foundational programs through three main faculties:

Skills & Foundational Learning

Health & Community Studies

Business, Environment & Technology

Programs include Business Administration, Mental Health, Pharmacy Technician, Dental Nursing, ESL, Academic Upgrading, and more. Specialized centers such as the Centre for Intercultural Education and the Centre for Growth and Harmony offer additional training opportunities.

NorQuest’s main campus is in downtown Edmonton, with regional campuses in Drayton Valley, Wetaskiwin, and Whitecourt, as well as correctional education sites at Edmonton Remand Centre and Fort Saskatchewan. The college serves over 17,000 full-time and part-time students, supported by around 800 staff members.

fields.name: North Island College
fields.about:
North Island College – Overview
 History & Affiliations
Founded in 1975, North Island College (NIC) has educated over 155,000 students. Its co-op programs are nationally accredited by CEWIL Canada. NIC is affiliated with Colleges and Institutes Canada (CICan) and British Columbia Colleges, and is known for excellence in Healthcare, Trades, Business, Fine Arts, and Tourism.

Campuses & Programs
NIC is located on the traditional territories of 35 First Nations and has 4 campuses:

Campbell River

Comox Valley

Port Alberni

Port Hardy
It offers 90+ programs including diplomas, certificates, and degrees. Notably, NIC offers:

3 BBA degrees (Marketing, Accounting, General Management)

Bachelor of Science in Nursing (in partnership with VIU)

Achievements & Alumni
NIC is recognized for delivering affordable, high-quality education and fostering local workforce development. It has built a strong alumni network of over 155,000 graduates globally.

Student Diversity & Career Support
NIC has over 6,300 students, including 1,012 Indigenous and 419 international students. Students benefit from:

Career services (resume help, mock interviews, networking)

Regular events & webinars

Paid international work opportunities – including with Walt Disney Corporation in California!

fields.name: Middlesex University (Dubai)
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Middlesex University traces its roots to the late 1800s, becoming a university in 1992. The Dubai campus, established in 2005, is its first international branch and is licensed by KHDA and audited by the UK's Quality Assurance Agency (QAA). It’s recognized globally for academic excellence—ranked in the top 500 by Times Higher Education 2022 and in the #701–750 band by QS World Rankings 2022. Its MBA program was named Dubai’s best by Forbes Middle East (2012).

Campus, Courses & Infrastructure
Located in Dubai Knowledge Park, the campus serves over 4,000 students from 100+ countries. Spread across four buildings, it features modern lecture halls, labs, auditoriums, and student clubs. Programs offered span:

Business & Management

Marketing & Digital Media

Law & Global Governance

Engineering & IT

Psychology, Education, Criminology

Creative Fields like Journalism, Graphic Design, and Film

Achievements & Notable Alumni
Middlesex Dubai is known for its innovative programs and award-winning Media School. It’s the only university in the region offering a face-to-face British LLB. Recognized as University of the Year (UAE) by iStudy Awards 2019/20, its graduates excel globally. Notable alumni include:

Husamuddin Khan, Marketing Manager, Creatives

Stefanie Ost, CEO, ATPRO

Mohamed Al Zarooni, HR Partner, Etihad Airways

Student Diversity & Top Recruiters
With students from over 100 nationalities, Middlesex promotes inclusivity across gender, culture, and background. Females comprise 43% of the student body. Top employers that recruit from the university include:
L’Oréal, Accenture, Air Arabia, HSBC, Deloitte, BBC, IBM, and Zomato.

fields.name: North Park University
fields.about:
North Park University – Overview
History & Values
Founded in 1891 in a Minneapolis church basement to support Swedish immigrants, North Park University moved to Chicago’s North Park area and became a university in 1997 with a theological seminary. It emphasizes Christian faith, community engagement, and cultural diversity. Ranked 401-500 in the 2022 THE World University Rankings.

Campus & Academics
Located on Chicago’s Northwest Side, the campus features modern facilities like the LEED-certified Johnson Center and Brandel Library. Programs are offered on two campuses (Chicago and Grayslake) and online. Academic divisions include:

College of Arts and Sciences

School of Business and Nonprofit Management

School of Education

School of Music, Art, and Theater

School of Nursing and Health Sciences

School of Professional Studies

Theological Seminary

Over 40 undergraduate majors and graduate programs are available in fields like Business, Nursing, Education, Music, and Theology.

Achievements & Alumni
North Park supports numerous student organizations and has a strong athletics program, including recent baseball championships. Notable alumni include former Illinois Governor James R. Thompson and theologian Stephen T. Franklin.

Student Body & Mission
The university enrolls over 3,200 students. Its mission is to prepare students for meaningful lives through education grounded in liberal arts, professional studies, and theology.

fields.name: Midwestern State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Midwestern University began in 1922 as Wichita Falls Junior College and was renamed in 1950. It joined the Association of Colleges and Secondary Schools in 1948 and is affiliated with the Council of Public Liberal Arts Colleges. The university competes in NCAA Division II – Lone Star Conference. It ranks 77th among Regional Universities in the West by U.S. News and falls within the 601-800 range nationally according to Times Higher Education.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Programs
Located on a 255-acre Texas campus with red stone buildings and gardens, Midwestern State has six undergraduate schools and one graduate school. It offers programs in Business, Engineering, Fine Arts, Health, Humanities, and Education.

Achievements and Alumni
Known for liberal arts, Midwestern State supports over 100 student clubs and hosts 200+ events yearly. Notable alumni include TV host Phil McGraw, AFL player Chad DeGrenier, and U.S. Ambassador Mark Boulware.

Diversity and Career Support
International students make up over 8% of the student body. The university offers exchange programs and strong career services, including resume help, interview practice, and career fairs connecting students with employers.

fields.name: Northeastern Illinois University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1867 in Chicago, Northeastern Illinois University (NEIU) began as Cook County’s first teacher training school. It became a university in 1971 and is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and multiple specialized bodies, including AACSB, CACREP, NASAD, CSWE, NASM, CAEP, and NCRE. NEIU ranks #251-300 in the QS World University Rankings (2022), #363 in US News (2022), and #401-500 in Times Higher Education (2022).

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Programs
NEIU’s main campus covers 60 acres with 18 buildings in North Park, Chicago. It has four campuses: Main, El Centro, Jacob H. Carruthers Center, and University Center of Lake County. The university offers undergraduate, graduate, and professional degrees across four colleges: Arts and Sciences, Business and Technology, Education, and Graduate Study and Research. Programs span Arts, Education, Science, and Business.

Accomplishments and Alumni
NEIU is known for global academic partnerships and experienced faculty, most holding PhDs. Its community radio station WZRD Chicago 88.3 FM is a long-standing campus feature. Notable alumni include singer Tim McIlrath, actor John Pankow, State Senator Iris Y. Martinez, baseball pitcher Alan Hargesheimer, TV anchor Robert Jordan, and activist Juliana Taimoorazy.

Student Life and Career Support
NEIU offers vibrant campus life with sports fields, pools, fitness centers, and regular cultural and athletic events. It supports student well-being through health counseling and career guidance. Using the Handshake platform, NEIU connects students with top employers like Amazon, Microsoft, Deloitte, Accenture, and Google for job placements.

fields.name: Milwaukee School of Engineering
fields.about:
Overview:
MSOE, a private nonprofit founded in 1903 by Oscar Werwath in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, was created to address the growing demand for skilled engineers. It competes in NCAA Division III athletics and is affiliated with several regional sports conferences. In 2022, it ranked 372nd in US Colleges (Times Higher Education) and 8th among Regional Universities Midwest (U.S. News).

Campus and Academics:
MSOE’s compact 22-acre campus is located in downtown Milwaukee’s East Town neighborhood, featuring historic and modern buildings like the 1890 Alumni Partnership Center and 2019’s Diercks Hall. Known for its Cream City brick architecture, the school offers 16 undergraduate programs mainly in engineering, business, mathematics, nursing, and cardiovascular perfusion, with a strong focus on ABET-accredited Bachelor of Science degrees. It also provides nine master’s programs.

Notable Alumni:
Prominent graduates include Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella (MS Computer Science, 1990), Wisconsin Energy CEO Gale E. Klappa, and former CEOs Dennis J. Kuester and William H. Lacy Jr.

Student Body and Employers:
MSOE enrolls over 2,800 students (about 2,500 undergraduates and 200 postgraduates), with 200+ international students and a male-to-female ratio of roughly 19:50. Leading recruiters include Google, Amazon, EY, McKinsey, and Apple.

fields.name: Northeastern University
fields.about:
Northeastern University: Overview

Founded in 1898, Northeastern University began as an evening institute by the Boston YMCA. It became Northeastern College in 1916 and adopted its current name in 1921 to reflect its expanding curriculum. Known for its strong programs and prime Boston location, it ranks #176 globally by U.S. News and #168 by THE in 2022.

Campuses and Programs

Northeastern’s main campus is in Boston, with satellite campuses in Burlington, Charlotte, London, Nahant, Portland, San Francisco, Seattle, Silicon Valley, Toronto, and Vancouver. It acquired London’s New College of Humanities and opened a Vancouver campus in 2016. The university offers 229 undergraduate and graduate fields, including popular programs in Biology, Business, Communications, Education, Public Health, and more.

Rankings and Alumni

Classified as an R1 research institution, Northeastern ranks #49 in U.S. News 2022 National University Rankings and #342 globally by QS. Notable alumni include NBA player Jose Juan Barea and activist Andrew Left. Faculty highlights include physicist Pran Nath and psychoacoustics expert Mary Florentine.

Diversity and Industry Connections

As of 2019, Northeastern enrolled over 27,000 students, with about one-third international from 144 countries. The university embraces diversity across many dimensions. Leading companies like Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Tesla, and McKinsey actively recruit from Northeastern, especially from its engineering and computer science colleges.

fields.name: Mississippi College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Mississippi College, founded in 1826 as Hampstead Academy, began classes in 1827. It is a private, Christian university affiliated with the Mississippi Baptist Convention and accredited by SACSCOC to offer degrees from bachelor's to doctoral levels.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
The main campus in Clinton spans over 80 acres, with the Law School located in Jackson. Historic buildings like Provine Chapel (1860) and Alumni Hall (1926) are notable landmarks. MC offers 80+ undergraduate majors, 50+ graduate programs, three doctoral degrees, a law school, and a top Physician Assistant program.

Achievements and Alumni
MC is recognized for academic quality and value. About 73% of MC applicants gain acceptance to medical schools, surpassing national averages. The college boasts a top-ranked aquatic program and a successful equestrian team. Notable alumni include Mississippi Governor Phil Bryant, wrestler Ted DiBiase Jr., and state representative J. Andrew Gipson.

Student Life and Diversity
With nearly 4,900 students, MC is Mississippi’s largest private university. It hosts over 50 student organizations, including men’s service clubs and women’s social tribes, fostering community, leadership, and social engagement.

fields.name: Northeastern University - Toronto
fields.about:
History and Rankings
Northeastern’s first international campus opened in Toronto in 2015. Since 1909, its renowned cooperative education program has partnered with tens of thousands of employers worldwide to prepare students for professional success. Its programs hold top international accreditations.

Campuses and Programs
Northeastern has campuses in Toronto, Vancouver, Boston, Charlotte, Portland, London (UK), San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and Seattle. The Toronto campus offers master’s degrees in Project Management, Regulatory Affairs, Analytics, Informatics, Biotechnology, and Information Systems, combining flexible learning with hands-on experience.

Research and Alumni
With over 40 research labs and $100 million in annual funding, Northeastern leads in sustainability, health informatics, data analytics, and more. Its global network includes 3,300+ organizations across 150+ countries and 255,000 alumni. Notable alumni include Beyoncé Knowles, Patrice O’Neal, and Jane Curtin.

Diversity and Career Support
Toronto’s campus enrolls 1,000+ students from over 120 countries, supported by diverse clubs and inclusive services. The university promotes a welcoming environment and offers career development through its Department of Careers and Experience.

fields.name: Northern Alberta Institute of Technology
fields.about:
Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) Overview

Founded in 1962 in Edmonton, NAIT is a public college offering programs in business, science, health, and skilled trades. It was created to expand apprenticeship and vocational training in Alberta, complementing Calgary’s SAIT. NAIT’s first class began in 1962, and its inaugural graduation was in 1965. The college collaborates with over 80 industry partners and has led 89 research projects, mostly in partnership with businesses.

Campuses and Programs

NAIT has four campuses: Main, Patricia, and South campuses in Edmonton, plus the Crane and Hoist campus in Spruce Grove. Facilities include dining, parking, and student media outlets. NAIT offers over 80 credit programs, including degrees, applied degrees, certificates, and diplomas, with courses in administration, technology management, network management, and finance.

Achievements and Alumni

NAIT boasts a 98% employer satisfaction rate and publishes the tech-focused journal Techlifetoday. Its research covers biotech, digital economy, energy, and environment. Notable alumni include St. Albert Mayor Nolan Crouse, former Edmonton Oilers CEO Patrick LaForge, and Alberta’s Finance Minister Travis Toews.

Student Diversity and Employers

With 25,000 students (22,000 undergraduates, 1,200+ postgraduates) and 1,200 faculty, NAIT is diverse and inclusive, drawing students worldwide. The campus supports many clubs and groups, fostering engagement. Top recruiters include AppleOne, Citrine Informatics, and Gap Inc.

fields.name: Missouri State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Missouri State University began in 1905 as the Fourth District Normal School, focused on training teachers for southwest Missouri. It merged with the State Fruit Experiment Station in 1974 to form the current university. MSU is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission since 1915 and competes in NCAA Division I – MVC. It ranks #299–#391 nationally and #156–#209 among public schools per U.S. News & World Report (2022), and is ranked over 600th by Times Higher Education.

Campuses, Facilities, and Programs
MSU has four campuses—three in Missouri and one in Dalian, China—plus an extensive outreach program. The main Springfield campus covers 225 acres with 40+ buildings. The university offers 90+ undergraduate majors, 60 graduate programs, 170 certifications, and 37 degrees. Popular fields include Business, Psychology, and Elementary Education.

Achievements and Alumni
MSU emphasizes ethical leadership, cultural competence, and community engagement, supporting research and creativity. The alumni network has over 110,000 members, staying connected through events and publications. Notable alumni include baseball player Ryan Howard, actress Kathleen Turner, and former U.S. Representative Todd Tiahrt.

Student Diversity and Employers
Springfield’s campus enrolls 23,618 students, including 1,618 international and 2,609 first-time college students. Over 200 student organizations are available. Major employers of graduates include Mercy, Cerner, Jack Henry & Associates, Walmart, and Edward Jones.

fields.name: Northern Arizona University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Northern Arizona University (NAU), founded in 1899 in Flagstaff, Arizona, began as a teacher’s college and is now a public research university classified as “R2: Doctoral Universities – High research activity.” It ranked #191 in the 2019 NSF national research rankings and is governed by the Arizona Board of Regents. NAU competes in NCAA Division I as part of the Big Sky Conference, with notable success in cross country running. In 2022, Times Higher Education ranked it #501-600 globally and in US college rankings.

Campuses and Programs
NAU’s main campus is in Flagstaff, supported by statewide campuses offering over 9,000 accredited online programs. Accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, NAU offers more than 158 undergraduate and graduate degrees. It features colleges such as Arts and Letters, Education, Engineering and Applied Sciences, Health and Human Services, Social and Behavioral Sciences, Environment and Forestry, Business, and more. The Pledge program lets undergraduates pay the same tuition for four years.

Achievements and Alumni
Serving over 30,000 students, NAU participates in the Western Undergraduate Exchange program, lowering tuition for students from Western states. The university hosts 400+ student organizations and offers extensive intramural and varsity sports. Notable alumni include U.S. Navy Vice Admiral Robin Braun, actor Samus Dever, author Diana Gabaldon, Olympian Lopez Lomong, and former Arizona governor Raúl Héctor Castro.

Student Diversity and Employers
NAU has a majority female student population and attracts international graduate students from 60+ countries. Graduates find opportunities at top employers like Arizona State University, Amazon, Vanguard, Carvana, Deloitte, and Banner Health.

fields.name: Missouri University of Science and Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Missouri University of Science and Technology (Missouri S&T) is a public research university in Rolla, Missouri. Founded in 1870 as the Missouri School of Mines and Metallurgy—the first technological school west of the Mississippi—it focuses primarily on engineering, science, business, and mathematics. Part of the University of Missouri System, Missouri S&T is known for its engineering programs but also offers degrees in business, information science, humanities, and social sciences. It ranks #401-500 in THE World University Rankings 2022, #511-520 in QS World University Rankings 2022, #192 in US College Rankings 2022 (Times Higher Education), and #821 globally in the U.S. News Best Global Universities 2022.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Courses
The Rolla campus features landmarks like a granite Stonehenge replica and the James E. Bertelsmeyer Hall, a top chemical and biochemical engineering research facility. Missouri S&T offers over 100 degree programs across 40 fields, including arts, biological sciences, business, engineering, computer science, social sciences, and sustainability, with more than 30 undergraduate and 30 graduate majors.

Achievements and Alumni
Missouri S&T boasts a strong research faculty, with 64 members recognized among top global researchers by Stanford University. Its research teams have secured $365,000 in Ignition Grants. In 2020-21, 41 faculty received Outstanding Teaching Awards. The university’s alumni network includes nearly 60,000 skilled professionals worldwide.

Student Diversity and Employers
With 6,662 students—including 557 international—and over 200 student organizations, Missouri S&T offers a vibrant campus life. The faculty totals 369, blending domestic and international staff. Graduates are highly employable, with top recruiters like Accenture, Microsoft, and Brewer Science.

fields.name: Northern College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Northern College of Applied Arts and Technology, founded in 1967 in Ontario, Canada, serves over 2,000 full-time and 15,000 part-time students. It was established as part of Ontario’s plan to offer career-focused diploma, certificate, and continuing education programs. The college has campuses in Kirkland Lake, Porcupine, Haileybury, and Moosonee. It is the first publicly funded Ontario college accredited by the Truck Training Schools Association of Ontario and is affiliated with Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association, Colleges and Institutes Canada, and Universités Canada.

Campuses and Programs
Northern College recently invested $3 million to upgrade facilities across its four campuses. The Haileybury Campus specializes in veterinary sciences, Kirkland Lake leads in welding engineering technology, Moosonee offers trades and apprenticeship training for James Bay communities, and Timmins hosts Ontario’s newest trade and technology facilities. The college offers over 75 full- and part-time programs, including certificates, diplomas, apprenticeships, and career prep courses.

Research and Community Impact
Northern’s Innovation Hub drives regional economic growth by supporting product and service development while offering students hands-on learning. The college also partners with local Indigenous communities to provide skilled trades training for elders focused on home renovations.

Student Diversity and Employment
Northern College attracts around 3,300 international students, primarily from India, Nigeria, and China. Students can work part-time during their studies or on campus, with some graduates returning as faculty members.

fields.name: Northern College at Pures
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Northern College, established in 1967 as part of Ontario’s college system, partners with Pures College of Technology in Toronto to offer quality education to international students. Pures College, a private institution founded in 2007, is governed by the Private Career Colleges Act. Northern College is affiliated with CCAA, ACCC, and AUCC, and ranks 9,210 globally in the QS World University Rankings 2022.

Campuses, Facilities, and Programs
Serving over 65 communities in Northeastern Ontario, Northern College operates four campuses in Timmins (Porcupine), Kirkland Lake, Moosonee, and Haileybury. The campuses feature modern labs, libraries, and other facilities. The college offers around 75 programs, including diplomas, certificates, and apprenticeships across business, healthcare, technology, social development, and trades.

Achievements and Alumni
Northern College’s Applied Research and Innovation department supports R&D and entrepreneurship. With over 35,000 alumni, the college is known for strong graduate employment and employer satisfaction rates. Notable alumni include opera singer Catherine Foster and pianists Olga Jegunova and Stephen Hough.

Student Body and Campus Life
Each year, about 1,500 full-time and 11,000 part-time students enroll, with international students making up roughly 2%. The college focuses on equipping students with practical skills in diverse fields. Graduate employment stands at 84.8%, and employer satisfaction at 89.5% (2016-17). Students can engage in various clubs and social groups to enrich campus life.

fields.name: Mohawk College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1966, Mohawk College is part of Ontario’s college system, established to provide career-focused diplomas, certificates, and continuing education. It is accredited and sponsored by the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities and a member of the Association of Community Colleges of Canada (ACCC). Mohawk ranks #6890 globally, #1384 in its continent, and #88 in Canada, with an Impact Ranking of #2765 (Webometrics).

Campuses, Infrastructure, and Programs
Mohawk operates three main campuses: Fennell, Stoney Creek (Skilled Trades), and the Institute for Applied Health Sciences at McMaster, plus partner locations at Six Nations Polytechnic and Ogwehoweh Skills and Trades Training Centre. The Fennell Campus recently underwent a major renovation to enhance accessibility, sustainability, and student experience. The college offers 161 programs, including Advanced Diplomas, Graduate Certificates, Diplomas, and Ontario College Certificates in fields like Business, Communications, Community Services, Health, Technology, and Skilled Trades.

Achievements and Alumni
Mohawk is recognized globally for applied research and innovation, including Ideaworks and its Student Success Innovation Centre. It was Ontario’s first college to launch a comprehensive environmental management plan targeting carbon reduction across campus operations. The alumni network boasts nearly 134,000 graduates worldwide.

Student Diversity and Engagement
With over 13,000 students annually—including 3,000+ international students from 80+ countries—Mohawk offers a vibrant campus life with numerous clubs, societies, and leagues. The college consistently receives high student satisfaction ratings among Ontario colleges.

fields.name: Northern Illinois University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Northern Illinois University (NIU) began in 1895 as a teachers’ college and has grown into a major public research university. It is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and classified among “High Research Activity” universities by the Carnegie Foundation. NIU is a member of key academic organizations and ranks #201-250 in the QS US University Rankings. U.S. News places it between #299-391 nationally, with notable rankings in social mobility and public schools.

Campuses, Facilities, and Programs
NIU’s main campus is in DeKalb, offering a traditional campus experience on 765 acres. Satellite campuses serve Chicago, Naperville, and Rockford, along with online degree options. With over 100 programs, popular majors include Psychology, Accounting, Marketing, Computer Science, and Mechanical Engineering.

Achievements and Alumni
NIU is a leader in sustainability, saving millions through energy-efficient upgrades and solar projects funded by state and federal programs. The university’s alumni network exceeds 250,000 worldwide, including notable figures like actress Joan Allen and Ball State’s former president Jerry M. Anderson.

Student Diversity and Career Support
NIU enrolls over 16,000 students, with a diverse population including 743 international students from 111 countries. The university supports student career growth through robust services and connections to top employers like Amazon, Deloitte, Microsoft, and PwC.

fields.name: Monash University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Monash University, established by an Act of Parliament in 1958, welcomed its first students in 1961 at Clayton campus, becoming Victoria’s first new university in over 100 years and the region’s second oldest. It quickly expanded beyond science and technology, merging with Chisholm Institute in 1990 (adding Caulfield and Peninsula campuses) and partnering with the Victorian College of Pharmacy in 1991 (adding Parkville). Monash was the first Australian university approved to operate in China, forming a joint graduate school with Southeast University in 2012. It is affiliated with the Group of Eight, ASAIHL, World Health Summit, John Monash Science School, and Monash College. Globally, Monash ranks #57 in THE, #58 in QS, and #40 in US News 2022 rankings.

Campuses, Infrastructure & Courses
Monash is one of Australia’s largest universities, with campuses in Melbourne (Clayton, Caulfield, Peninsula, Parkville, plus city locations) and learning centers in India, Italy, China, Malaysia, and Indonesia. It also partners with the University of Warwick (UK) and delivers courses at Monash South Africa. Offering around 200 programs across fields like Architecture, Engineering, Arts, Business, Nursing, and Fine Arts, students can specialize through majors and minors in 10 study areas.

Achievements & Alumni
Ranked #1 in Australia for innovation by Reuters Asia-Pacific (2019), Monash pioneered IVF research, achieving the world’s first clinical IVF pregnancy in 1973 and Australia’s first IVF baby in 1980. Its education is internationally recognized, with 80% of graduates employed within four months. Monash boasts over 130,000 alumni worldwide, including celebrities and leaders like Boity Thulo, Alyssa Soebandono, Joshua Tan, Muhamad Faisal Manap, and Nikolai Nikolaeff.

Student Diversity & Career Opportunities
Monash supports Indigenous Australians, LGBTQ+ students, and those with disabilities, with mostly mixed-gender accommodations. Hosting over 85,000 students—45% international—it offers a truly global community. Graduates are highly sought after by top employers like NAB, ANZ, Microsoft, Google, PwC, University of Melbourne, and RMIT.

fields.name: Montana State University
fields.about:
Montana State University Overview

Founded in 1893 in Bozeman, Montana State University (MSU) is the largest research university in Montana with over 16,700 students. MSU offers a flagship campus plus three extensions: MSU Billings, MSU Northern, and Great Falls College MSU. It provides 51 undergraduate, 41 postgraduate, and 18 doctoral programs.

MSU is nationally recognized for its research, with over $120 million in annual expenditures, and holds both regional and specialized accreditations. It ranks between #601-800 globally (THE World Rankings 2022) and #587 (U.S. News 2022). The university’s sports teams compete in NCAA Division I.

The campus features cultural resources like KGLT Radio, the Museum of the Rockies, and KUSM Television. MSU employs over 1,000 faculty members, combining full- and part-time staff.

As a Carnegie Foundation "very high research activity" institution, MSU supports community welfare through programs like its Agricultural Experiment Station. Its graduates have earned prestigious scholarships including Goldwater, Rhodes, and Marshall.

MSU’s diverse student body includes 350+ international students from 60+ countries. The university promotes inclusion through programs such as the Diversity Development certificate and the Women’s Center, celebrating events like Black History Month and Martin Luther King Day.

Notable alumni include comedian Craig Kilborn, author Sarah Vowell, and politician Denise Juneau. Graduates work at top companies like Oracle, Microsoft, and the Montana Department of Transportation.

fields.name: Montclair State University
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1908 as a teacher training school, Montclair State University (MSU) evolved into a comprehensive public university. Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, MSU is recognized for academic excellence and social mobility. It ranked #179 in National Universities and #19 in Top Performers on Social Mobility (U.S. News 2021), and #401–500 in U.S. College Rankings (THE 2022).

Campus & Academics
MSU’s expansive New Jersey campus features modern facilities like Kasser Theater, Yogi Berra Stadium, and the George Segal Gallery. With over 120 student clubs, it offers a vibrant and secure campus life. The university offers 300+ programs across nine colleges, including 54 bachelor’s majors, 130+ master’s programs, and multiple doctoral degrees in fields like business, arts, education, and sciences.

Achievements & Alumni
MSU pioneered New Jersey’s first master’s and doctoral programs at a public college and launched the nation’s first educational TV broadcasts. It’s also home to New Jersey’s first campus microgrid. Notable alumni include politicians Barbara Buono, Scott Garrett, and former Newark Mayor Sharpe James.

Diversity & Career Outcomes
MSU boasts a diverse student body: 43% White, 30% Hispanic, 13% Black, and 6% Asian. Within two years of graduation, 93% of students are employed. Average salaries include $91,000 for MBA graduates, $85,000 for BSc, and $66,000 for BA holders.

fields.name: Northern Lights College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Northern Lights College was founded in May 1975, originally known as BC Vocational School Dawson Creek. It offers programs focused on pre-apprenticeship and pre-employment training. The college was renamed Northern Lights College after a naming contest. It is accredited by the British Columbia Council on Admissions and Transfer (BCCAT) and the Association of Canadian Community Colleges (ACCC).

Campuses and Programs
Northern Lights College has five campuses located in Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Fort Nelson, Tumbler Ridge, and Chetwynd—all in northeastern British Columbia. The college offers a range of programs across these campuses.

Achievements and Alumni
NLC provides numerous awards and scholarships to support students financially. The college’s foundation raises funds to help reward academic success. Notable alumni include Canadian politician Bob Zimmer.

Student Body and Fees
Approximately 1,800 students enroll annually, including over 500 international students from 15 countries. The college encourages a healthy, inclusive campus life with activities organized by the Northern Lights College Students’ Association (NLCSA). Tuition varies by program; international students pay around $359 per credit hour, plus a $100 application fee. Part-time students pay 55% of the full tuition rate.

fields.name: Mount Saint Vincent University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Mount Saint Vincent University (MSVU) in Halifax, Nova Scotia, was founded in 1873 by the Sisters of Charity as a women’s college. It became a full university in 1966 and now serves over 4,400 students. MSVU is committed to social responsibility and access to education for underserved communities. It’s accredited by professional bodies like the Canadian Dietitians and affiliated with Universities Canada, IAU, CBIE, and CUP.

Campus & Programs
MSVU’s green campus is near downtown Halifax. It offers 40+ undergraduate and master’s degrees in arts, sciences, and professional fields including Nutrition, Business, IT, Public Relations, and Tourism. Classes are small (average 23 students), fostering interactive learning. All undergraduates have opportunities for work placements like internships or co-ops.

Achievements & Alumni
MSVU was Canada’s first university with a Women’s Studies department and the first to offer an English-taught Public Relations program. It partners on a unique joint PhD in Educational Studies. The university hosts specialized research centers in nutrition, aging, and more. Its 35,000+ alumni include notable figures like actor Barrie Dunn, Olympian Ryan Cochrane, and former Nova Scotia Premier Iain Rankin.

Diversity & Career Opportunities
With 4,000+ students from over 70 countries and 300+ faculty, MSVU champions equity and women’s advancement. Its Centre for Women in Business supports female entrepreneurs through networking and learning. Graduates work at organizations like the Government of Nova Scotia, Scotia Bank, RBC, and IWK Health.

fields.name: Northern State Medical University
fields.about:
Northern State Medical University Overview

Founded in 1936 in Arkhangelsk, Russia, Northern State Medical University (NSMU) is a leading medical school known for its quality MBBS and other medical programs. The university is recognized by the WHO, ECFMG (USA), and India’s NMC.

NSMU offers undergraduate and postgraduate degrees like MBBS, BDS, MD, MPH, and Ph.D., including a one-year internship in the MBBS course. Its global partnerships and secure campus provide a vibrant student life with many extracurricular activities.

The university attracts over 5,000 students annually from Russia and countries like India, Nigeria, and Belarus. Ranked among Russia’s top 150 and within the top 4,000 worldwide by UniRank, NSMU supports students in pursuing international exams such as USMLE, PLAB, and FMGE.
