fields.name: Muma College of Business
fields.about:
Founded in 1956 and located in the Tampa Bay area, the University of South Florida (USF) is a major state research university with campuses in Tampa, St. Petersburg, and Sarasota. Serving 50,000 students, USF offers undergraduate, graduate, specialist, and doctoral programs across 14 colleges and over 180 majors, including Business, Engineering, Health, and the Arts.

USF is committed to student empowerment and closing the success gap between Black and white students. Its graduate programs are highly ranked, with eight in the top 50 according to U.S. News & World Report (2018). The university supports affordability through fellowships, assistantships, and grants.

Known as a “Golden Age University,” USF emphasizes innovative research and education. Its on-campus Technology Incubator has generated over 230 local jobs. In 2016-17, USF spent $568 million on research, leading advancements in medicine, engineering, science, and the arts.
fields.admission_requirements:

Pay the non-refundable $30 application fee.

Provide official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.

Submit GMAT or GRE scores (waivers available for certain applicants).

For international applicants, submit proof of English proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or GRE Verbal scores).

Updated résumé/CV

Statement of Purpose (1–2 pages)

Three letters of recommendation (at least one professional)

English language proficiency test scores (for international applicants)

Application fee payment

fields.name: Northwest Missouri State University
fields.about:
Northwest Missouri State University: Overview

History & Rankings
Founded in 1905 as a teacher’s college, Northwest Missouri State University is designed after Forest Park and serves as Missouri’s official State Botanical Garden. Governed by a state-appointed Board of Regents and led by President John Jasinski, it is affiliated with NCAA Division II and the Mid-America Intercollegiate Athletics Association. It ranks #600 in the Times Higher Education US College Rankings 2022 and #31 in US News & World Report’s Top Public Schools.

Campus & Academics
The university offers diverse programs across faculties such as Business, Education, Computer Science, Agricultural Sciences, Health Sciences, and the Arts. Students benefit from modern labs, libraries, and IT facilities, with full-time students receiving laptops and access to book rental services. Northwest emphasizes hands-on learning through workshops and skill-driven courses to prepare students for real-world careers.

Achievements & Alumni
Northwest has won the Missouri Quality Award four times (1997, 2001, 2005, 2008), recognizing excellence in leadership and operational quality. Notable alumni include Missouri politician Jason R. Brown, former U.S. Representative Pat Danner, and Iowa Congressman Steve King.

Student Body & Career Opportunities
With over 7,800 students (including 435+ international students), the university maintains a student-faculty ratio that supports personalized learning. The male-to-female ratio is 41:69. Top recruiters include Bose, Mastercard, Citibank, Facebook, and Nutanix.

fields.name: Munich Business School
fields.about:
History
Munich Business School (MBS) was founded in 1991 as a private business school located in Munich, Germany. It has established itself as a leading institution focused on international management education, emphasizing practical and entrepreneurial approaches. Over the years, MBS has expanded its offerings to include bachelor’s, master’s, MBA, and doctoral programs with a strong global perspective, aiming to prepare students for leadership roles in international business environments.

Accreditations and Affiliations
The school holds important accreditations such as FIBAA (Foundation for International Business Administration Accreditation) and IACBE (International Accreditation Council for Business Education), reflecting the high quality of its programs. It is also a member of the German Council of Private Universities (VPKA) and has numerous international partnerships with universities and corporations. These affiliations support student exchange programs, double degrees, and real-world business projects, ensuring students benefit from extensive networking and practical experience.

Rankings
While Munich Business School may not frequently appear in global rankings like the Financial Times or QS World University Rankings, it is highly regarded within Germany and Europe for its specialized business programs. It consistently ranks among the top private business schools in the region, known for its strong international orientation, quality teaching, and high graduate employability.

Scholarships
MBS offers several scholarships aimed at supporting diverse groups of students. Merit-based scholarships reward academic excellence and professional achievements, while diversity scholarships promote inclusion of students from various backgrounds. The school also provides early bird discounts and occasionally offers alumni scholarships. Additionally, partnerships with corporate sponsors can result in scholarship opportunities. The availability and criteria for these financial aids can vary depending on the program and academic year.

fields.name: Northwestern Polytechnic University
fields.about:
Northwestern Polytechnic University (NPU) Overview

History & Rankings
Founded in 1984 by Dr. Ramsey Carter and Dr. Barbara Brown, NPU gained institutional status from the California Department of Education in 1989 and established its Business School in 1995. The university focuses on academic and civic development, helping students reach their full potential. NPU is affiliated with the Fremont Chamber of Commerce and ranked #601–800 in Times Higher Education World Rankings 2022 and #589 in U.S. News & World Report Global Universities 2022.

Campus & Programs
NPU has a single main campus equipped with modern facilities including libraries, labs, and student clubs. It offers programs in MBA, MS, and BS degrees through its Schools of Engineering, Business, and Information Technology, specializing in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, and communication skills development.

Accreditation & Alumni
NPU is accredited by WASC (WSCUC) and its English program by the Commission on English Language Program Accreditation. Known for its career-focused curriculum, NPU alumni hold leadership roles or run successful businesses globally.

Student Diversity & Recruiters
NPU attracts a diverse student body, especially from India and China, fostering cross-cultural learning. Top recruiters include HCL, Dell, HP, AT&T, and Wipro.

fields.name: Northwestern University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1850 by nine visionaries, Northwestern University aimed to educate residents of the Northwest Territory. The main campus was established in 1853 near Lake Michigan, about 12 miles from Chicago. Today, Northwestern has three campuses and a global presence. Known for its collaborative environment, diverse student body, and expert faculty, the university fosters personal and professional growth. It is affiliated with organizations such as the Association of American Universities (AAU), Universities Research Association (URA), NAICU, COFHE, IAMSCU, and the 568 President’s Group. Northwestern is also a member of the U.S. Space Grant Consortium and ranks 9th among National Universities by U.S. News & World Report.

Campuses, Facilities, and Academics
Northwestern is a private university with campuses in Evanston (25 acres), along Lake Michigan (240 acres), and Doha, Qatar. It comprises 12 colleges and schools, including the Bienen School of Music, Weinberg College of Arts and Sciences, McCormick School of Engineering, Medill School of Journalism, Kellogg School of Management, Feinberg School of Medicine, and others. Northwestern Qatar is internationally recognized for its quality programs.

Achievements and Alumni
Northwestern is one of only four U.S. universities ranking in the top 10 nationally and top 20 for graduate programs across disciplines such as Business, Law, Medicine, and Engineering. A Big Ten Conference member, its Wildcats compete vigorously in athletics. The university secures around $893 million annually in research funding and ranks 15th among AAU schools in NIH awards. Its alumni include influential figures like Harold Washington (Chicago’s first Black mayor), author George R.R. Martin, comedian Stephen Colbert, Meghan Markle, Pharrell Williams, and actor David Schwimmer.

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
With over 8,000 undergraduates and 13,000 graduate students, Northwestern welcomes a diverse population from all 50 U.S. states and over 120 countries, including 4,300 international students. More than 90% of undergraduates rank in the top 10% of their high school classes. Leading companies such as Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Meta, Apple, McKinsey, Salesforce, and Goldman Sachs actively recruit Northwestern graduates.

fields.name: Nova Southeastern University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1964 as Nova University of Advanced Technology, Nova Southeastern University (NSU) expanded in 1994 by merging with Southeastern University of Health Sciences. NSU is affiliated with organizations like ICUF, NAICU, SFEC, and Sea-grant. It ranks #213 among National Universities according to U.S. News & World Report 2022.

Campuses, Facilities, and Programs
NSU has four campuses, with its main campus in Davie, Florida, covering 314 acres, plus a campus in Puerto Rico. Facilities include classrooms, libraries, health clinics, housing, and athletic centers. The Alvin Sherman Library is Florida’s largest academic library. NSU offers over 150 programs, including both Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (D.O.) and Doctor of Medicine (M.D.) degrees, the first in the Southeast to offer both.

Achievements and Alumni
Classified as a “high research activity” institution by the Carnegie Foundation, NSU is also recognized for community engagement and is the largest private Hispanic-serving institution in the U.S. Notable alumni include Isabel Saint-Malo, former Vice President of Panama; Will Kirby, dermatologist and reality TV winner; and MLB player J.D. Martinez.

Student Body and Recruiters
NSU enrolls over 24,000 students—5,600 undergraduates and nearly 15,000 postgraduates—with a diverse community including 1,150 international students. The gender ratio is roughly 29% male to 71% female. Major employers recruiting from NSU include Amazon, Blackwells Capital, and MEDNAX.

fields.name: Munster Technological University
fields.about:
Munster Technological University (MTU)

Established in 2021, MTU is a public technological university formed by merging Cork Institute of Technology and Institute of Technology, Tralee. Initially, a three-way merger including Waterford IT was considered but later dropped. After submitting a formal application in 2019 and receiving approval in 2020, MTU began classes in January 2021.

MTU has six campuses across Cork and Kerry: Dromtacker and Clash (Kerry), Tralee, Bishopstown, Cork School of Music, Crawford College of Art and Design, and the National Maritime College of Ireland in Ringaskiddy. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and Ph.D. programs in Humanities, Engineering, Business, Computing, Nursing, Art, and Music.

Notable alumni include NFL player Joe Berger, Nobel laureate Melvin Calvin, NHL player Chris Conner, and politician Jill Dickman. MTU students won the €4,000 top prize at the 2023 Innovation Showcase for a medical device.

With over 18,000 students and 2,000 staff, MTU is Ireland’s second-largest technological university after the Technological University of Dublin.

fields.name: Novosibirsk State University
fields.about:
Novosibirsk State University, established in 1959, is a leading Russian institution located in Novosibirsk’s Akademgorodok—an internationally recognized research center of the Russian Academy of Sciences. The university is closely connected to over 70 research labs and nearly 50 institutes specializing in diverse scientific and mathematical fields. NSU is renowned for cultivating Russia’s academic elite by integrating research into education and involving prominent scientists in teaching.

The university offers 23 bachelor’s, 17 master’s, and 13 postgraduate programs, along with a specialty course and nine residency tracks in its medical faculty, serving over 7,250 students. NSU maintains six international partnerships in Physics, Astrophysics, and Elementary Particles, as well as 12 collaborations with the Budker Institute of Nuclear Physics. Academically, NSU is organized into six departments, three institutes, a specialized center, and a college, and also provides Russian language courses at various levels.

Notably, two NSU alumni—Viktor Kbaritonin and Yegor Kulkov—were listed among Russia’s 200 richest businessmen in Forbes 2016.
fields.admission_requirements:
Application Process
Register on NSU’s applicant portal.

Upload required documents through your account.

Wait for document verification and respond to any requests.

Take entrance exams if required (online or in-person).

Receive admission decision and accept the offer.

Obtain invitation letter for student visa.

Arrive before the academic year begins.

Documents Required
Valid passport (at least 1.5 years validity)

Original educational certificates and transcripts with notarized Russian translations

Medical certificates (general health and HIV-free) valid for 3 months

Two recent passport-sized photos (3x4 cm)

Language proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS), if applicable

Motivation/personal statement

Curriculum Vitae (CV)

Letters of recommendation or other supporting documents (if available)

fields.name: Murdoch University
fields.about:
Murdoch University: Overview

Founded in 1973 in Perth, Western Australia, Murdoch University is the state’s second university and is known for promoting "free-thinking." Named after Sir Walter Murdoch, a notable author and former Chancellor of the University of Western Australia, it is a research-intensive institution and a member of the Innovative Research Universities (IRU) consortium. According to the 2022 US News & World Report, Murdoch ranks #679 globally.

Campuses and Academics

Murdoch operates five campuses across three countries: three in Western Australia (Perth, Mandurah, Rockingham) and international campuses in Singapore and Dubai. The Perth campus, the largest, is located on the Somerville Pine Plantation, a hub for research and education.

The university follows a two-College model:

College of Arts, Business, Law and Social Sciences

College of Science, Health, Engineering and Education

It offers 175 courses across Bachelor’s, Master’s, Graduate Certificate, and Doctoral levels in areas such as Business, Law, Creative Arts, Engineering, Health, Science, Social Studies, Teaching, and Technology. Pathway programs for international students include English for Academic Purposes and Foundation Studies.

Achievements and Alumni

Murdoch was named Australia’s top university for graduate employability in 2018 and ranked third in student satisfaction among WA public universities in 2019. Notable alumni include sustainability expert Glenn Albrecht (who coined "solastalgia"), politician Visam Ali, and sociologist Cora Baldock. The university has a global alumni network of over 70,000 from more than 90 countries.

Student Body and Industry Links

With around 23,000 students, 37% are international. The Murdoch International Study Centre in Dubai opened in 2008, supporting its global presence. Recognized among the world’s top 100 young universities, Murdoch offers extensive Work Integrated Learning and internship opportunities. Its Career and Employability Unit helps students with job placements, resume building, and industry connections through the myMurdoch Career platform.

fields.name: Pace University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1906 as a small accountancy school by Charles and Homer Pace, Pace University evolved into a full university by 1973. Now serving 13,600+ diverse students in New York, it ranks in the top 9% of U.S. private universities for return on investment. Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, Pace was ranked #337 by Times Higher Education in 2022. Its motto, "Opportunitas," reflects its focus on creating opportunities.

Campuses, Infrastructure & Programs
Pace operates three campuses in NYC and Westchester County, offering modern facilities near Wall Street, arts hubs, Fortune 500 companies, and startups. It provides over 100 undergraduate majors, minors, and combined degrees, plus 100+ graduate programs across six schools, including Accounting, Business, Computer Science, Nursing, and more. Pace also offers 600+ summer courses and flexible online learning with personalized advising.

Achievements & Alumni
Known for academic excellence, Pace supports cutting-edge research funded by organizations like the NSF and hosts international environmental projects. According to The Equality of Opportunity Project, 8.4% of students from low-income backgrounds become wealthy adults post-graduation, with 54% reaching the top 20% income bracket nationally. Its 155,000+ alumni include notable figures such as Mike Adenuga and Lalit Modi. The university is recognized by The Princeton Review, Forbes, and US News.

Diversity & Career Opportunities
Pace's student body represents 48 states and 120 countries, with 11% international and 64% women students. Popular undergraduate nationalities include China, India, Brazil, and France. Campus life features 150+ clubs and 14 varsity teams (8 women's). Thanks to its location, students access internships and careers at top firms like Citi, JPMorgan, IBM, Deloitte, Amazon, and Salesforce.

fields.name: Murray State University
fields.about:
History, Rankings & Programs
Founded in 1922, Murray State University is a public institution with over 10,000 students from 46+ countries. It offers more than 143 bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral programs, including English language courses. The university ranks highly, including #24 in Regional Universities South and #11 among Top Public Schools.

Campus & Admissions
Located in a community named the "Friendliest Small Town in America" by USA Today, Murray State provides a safe and supportive environment. The university emphasizes career readiness and requires international students to apply online, meet eligibility criteria, and demonstrate English proficiency.

Student Life & Alumni
With 170+ student organizations, Murray State promotes active involvement and leadership. Its Young Alumni Council connects graduates to foster ongoing engagement and networking.

Diversity & Scholarships
Murray State values diversity and inclusivity, welcoming students from all backgrounds. The university offers scholarships to international students to support academic excellence and reduce financial barriers.

fields.name: Pacific Lutheran University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Pacific Lutheran University was chartered in Washington in 1890, operating mainly as an academy until becoming a full university in 1960. It’s affiliated with the Northwest Conference and the Evangelical Church in America. Nationally, QS ranks it between 251-300, Times Higher Education places it at 333, and U.S. News ranks it 14th among regional universities in the West.

Campus, Facilities & Programs
Located six miles south of Tacoma, WA, the campus is split into an upper area with academic buildings and a lower area for athletics. The university offers 44 majors and 55 minors across schools like Arts & Humanities, Business, Nursing, and Education, along with interdisciplinary programs.

Achievements & Alumni
Since 1890, Pacific Lutheran has earned recognition including the 2009 Senator Paul Simon Award for Campus Internationalization. Notable alumni include sports broadcaster Craig Fouhy, opera singer Angela Meade, and Alaska Airlines CEO Brad Tilden.

Diversity & Career Support
With over 3,000 students, 3% are international from 24+ countries. More than two-thirds of faculty have international experience. The university supports career readiness through resources like CV workshops and mock interviews to help graduates find employment.

fields.name: Paris College of Art
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Paris College of Art (PCA) is an international art and design university based in France, authorized to grant U.S. degrees and accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design. Founded in 1981 as “École Parsons à Paris,” it was affiliated with Parsons The New School for Design until 2010, when it became independent. PCA blends American teaching methods with French and European artistic influences.

Campus & Programs
Located in Paris’ 10th arrondissement, PCA features studios for fashion, sculpture, photography, printing, and digital arts, plus a 200-seat amphitheater, gallery, and student lounge. Its vibrant neighborhood includes creative agencies, theaters, and textile shops. PCA offers 6 undergraduate and 8 graduate programs.

Notable Alumni
Alumni include renowned fashion designers and artists such as Natalia Fedner, Tom Ford, Erin Fetherston, Lazaro Hernandez (Proenza Schouler), and Georgia Hardinge.

Diversity & Career Opportunities
PCA hosts students from over 40 countries, fostering a diverse and inclusive environment free from discrimination. Graduates are recruited by top companies like HP, J.Crew, and Kunde and Co., benefiting from the rich artistic culture of Paris.

fields.name: Pennsylvania State University
fields.about:
Overview of Pennsylvania State University

History & Affiliations:
Founded in 1855 as the Farmers' High School of Pennsylvania, Penn State became the state's land-grant college in 1863. It is affiliated with prestigious organizations such as the Association of American Universities and the CDIO Initiative. Globally, it ranks 96th by QS, 114th by Times Higher Education, and 80th by US News & World Report.

Campuses & Academics:
Penn State operates 24 campuses statewide, with University Park recognized as a "Public Ivy." It comprises 18 colleges offering diverse programs in fields like Agriculture, Engineering, Business, and Arts.

Achievements & Alumni:
A top research university with a 167-year legacy, Penn State’s World Campus ranks highly in business and psychology programs. Notable alumni include Mark Parker (former Nike CEO), Keegan-Michael Key, and Terry Pegula.

Diversity & Career Services:
International students make up over 16% of the 98,000-strong student body, representing 130+ countries. The Career Service Center provides support and hosts career fairs to connect students with employers.

fields.name: Pepperdine University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1937 by George Pepperdine, Pepperdine University is a leading Christian university based in Malibu. Affiliated with the Churches of Christ, it offers a semester-based curriculum emphasizing academic excellence and Christian values. Students attend 14 spiritual events per semester and complete at least three religion courses. With a diverse student body from 80 countries, Pepperdine’s motto is “Freely ye receive, freely give.” It ranks #49 among National Universities, #23 for Veterans, and #13 for Best Undergraduate Teaching.

Campus, Schools, and Courses
Pepperdine’s 830-acre campus includes academic, athletic, and student facilities such as the Harnish Law Library and Firestone Fieldhouse. It has four campuses: Malibu, West Los Angeles, Calabasas, and Irvine. The university comprises five schools—Seaver College, Caruso School of Law, Graziadio Business School, Graduate School of Education and Psychology, and School of Public Policy—offering diverse programs including Business, Communication, Humanities, Sciences, and Law. Degrees range from Bachelor’s to Doctorate, covering fields like Accounting, Cyber Risk, Creative Writing, and more.

Achievements and Alumni
Pepperdine earned GOLD (2019) and SILVER (2018) CASE VII Awards of Excellence for its General Interest Magazine. It launched initiatives supporting equity and social justice in 2021. The university has over 133,000 alumni, including NBA player Brandon Armstrong, artist Kevin A. Short, MSNBC correspondent Joel Widzer, and eHarmony co-founder Neil Clark Warren.

Student Diversity and Recruitment
In Fall 2021, Pepperdine received 12,934 applications (11,343 domestic, 1,591 international), enrolling 1,209 students. Top recruiters include Boeing, Bank of America, Ernst & Young, Kimberly-Clark, IBM, and Amgen.

fields.name: Oakland University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1957 by Alfred and Matilda Dodge Wilson, Oakland University is a public research institution classified as "R2: Doctoral Universities – High research activity." Located in Oakland County, it attracts both domestic and international students and offers flexible, technology-driven learning. It is uniquely accredited by AACSB for both accounting and business programs among 186 business schools.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Programs
The 1,433-acre campus north of Detroit features 50 buildings, including residence halls, athletic facilities, theaters, art galleries, trails, and nationally ranked golf courses. The nearby Rochester area ranked #39 in CNN/Money’s Top 100 American cities to live in (2005). Oakland offers 146 undergraduate and 130 graduate, doctoral, and certificate programs across multiple schools, including business, engineering, health sciences, and medicine. Study abroad options are also available.

Achievements and Alumni
With over 122,000 alumni worldwide, Oakland University is active in alumni engagement and ranks in the second-highest tier of research universities (2018 Carnegie Classification). It collaborates with Fortune 500 companies, hospitals, and government agencies to support education and research.

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
Oakland has over 17,000 students, including 4.6% international students, with a 58:42 male-to-female ratio. Top companies visiting campus include Amazon, Microsoft, Accenture, Netflix, and Google.

fields.name: Polytechnic University of Valencia
fields.about:
Founded in 1971, the Polytechnic University of Valencia (UPV) is a leading Spanish institute born from the Higher Polytechnic School of Valencia. It offers flexible, modern education and strong student support. UPV collaborates with top global research and educational institutions. It has about 2,661 faculty, 36,823 students, and 1,422 staff members.

UPV includes 2 polytechnic schools and 3 faculties across three fully equipped campuses in Valencia, Gandia, and Alcoy. The Vera campus spans about 2 km. Offering over 1,800 courses annually across various fields, UPV lets students pursue diverse interests. Originally focused on research and science, the university has 8 undergraduate branches. Its architecture department is now part of engineering and architecture. UPV also offers Spanish and other language courses for all students.
fields.admission_requirements:
Application Process:
Visit the UPV website and start pre-registration:

Bachelor’s: Use UNEDasiss for credential evaluation.

Master’s: Apply via UPV’s online portal.

PhD: Submit online application with research proposal.

Upload required documents (can add missing ones before final admission).

Provide language proficiency proof (Spanish or English, usually B2 level; accepted tests include DELE, IELTS, TOEFL).

Wait for admission decision based on academic records, language skills, and program criteria.

Once admitted, complete enrollment by registering for courses and paying fees.

Passport

Secondary education diploma (or Bachelor’s for Master’s, Master’s for PhD)

Academic transcripts

UNEDasiss accreditation (for non-EU Bachelor’s applicants)

Curriculum Vitae (CV)

Motivation letter

Letters of recommendation (if requested)

Research proposal (PhD only)

Language proficiency certificate (Spanish or English, B2 level)

Additional program-specific documents (if any)

fields.name: Portland State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Portland State University (PSU) was founded in 1946 as the Vanport Extension Centre to serve WWII veterans. After surviving a flood in 1948, PSU settled in downtown Portland in 1952. It’s affiliated with Great Cities’ Universities, Coalition of Urban and Metropolitan Universities, and is accredited by NWCCU. PSU ranks #1001-1200 in QS World University Rankings and holds spots in U.S. News & World Report for innovation (#29) and social mobility (#51).

Campus, Infrastructure, and Courses
Located on a vibrant 44-acre campus in downtown Portland, PSU offers easy access to internships, local culture, and nature. The city is famous for its coffee, food, and music scenes. PSU offers 200+ majors and minors, including Business, Social Sciences, Engineering, Psychology, and Visual & Performing Arts.

Accomplishments and Alumni
PSU is Oregon’s most diverse and affordable research university with a $61.5 million research budget. It’s recognized for innovation and focuses on issues like digital cities, sustainability, and homelessness. The university has about 180,000 alumni worldwide, including philosopher Peter Boghossian, model Sara Jean Underwood, and actor Mark Dacascos.

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
With 23,177 students (62% full-time), PSU attracts students from all 50 states and 78 countries. Major international groups include students from India, China, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Vietnam. The University Career Center connects students with top employers like Intel, Nike, Providence Health, and Kaiser Permanente.

fields.name: Pratt Institute
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1887 by industrialist Charles Pratt, Pratt Institute is a private college in New York specializing in architecture, engineering, and fine arts. Early courses covered diverse fields like mechanical engineering and furniture construction, with drawing as a foundational skill. A strong liberal arts program complements its technical training. Pratt is affiliated with the American Collegiate Athletic Association and the Hudson Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. It ranks #8 in QS World University Rankings by Subject and #244 in the 2022 Times Higher Education US College Rankings.

Campuses, Facilities, and Programs
Pratt has three campuses: Brooklyn (main), Manhattan, and Utica. The historic Brooklyn campus features Romanesque Revival architecture housing art, design, architecture, and liberal arts schools. The Utica campus includes the MWPAI Museum of Art. The library holds over 200,000 volumes focused on visual arts, architecture, and design. With 110+ student clubs—such as Animation, Ceramics, and Fashion & Sustainability—Pratt offers more than 25 bachelor’s and 26 master’s programs across six academic schools.

Achievements and Alumni
Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, Pratt boasts 62,000 alumni worldwide, including notable figures like electrical engineer Lloyd Espenschied and designer Joshua Davis. The Black Alumni of Pratt (BAP), founded in 1990, supports students and alumni of African and Latino descent.

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
With over 4,100 students—70% female and 1,500+ international—Pratt values diversity. Top recruiters include Amazon, Goldman Sachs, Deloitte, and Apple.

fields.name: Princeton University
fields.about:
Princeton University Overview

History & Rankings:
Founded in 1746, Princeton is the fourth-oldest university in the U.S. and has had 20 presidents. John Chavis was its first African American student in 1792. Princeton is a member of major academic organizations like the AAU and URA, and a U.S. space-grant university. In 2022, it ranked #7 (Times Higher Education), #16 (U.S. News), and #20 (QS World Rankings).

Campus & Academics:
Located on a 600-acre campus in Princeton, New Jersey—midway between NYC and Philadelphia—the university includes 180 buildings and 10 libraries holding over 14 million books. It draws 800,000 visitors annually and offers 39 undergraduate degrees across 36 majors, plus 42 graduate departments and programs.

Achievements & Alumni:
A leader in research and undergraduate education, Princeton counts two U.S. presidents—James Madison and Woodrow Wilson—among its alumni. Other notable graduates include Michelle Obama, Jeff Bezos, Jimmy Stewart, Brooke Shields, and astronaut Pete Conrad.

Student Body & Recruitment:
Princeton enrolls 8,419 students (98% full-time retention). Its student body is 37% White, 17% Asian, 9% Hispanic, and 6% Black. In 2019, it awarded 1,314 degrees to men and 1,021 to women. Top recruiters include Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Goldman Sachs, and McKinsey & Co.

fields.name: Purdue University Northwest
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1876, Purdue University Northwest in West Lafayette, Indiana, has over 45,000 students from nearly 130 countries and all 50 US states. It’s the fourth-largest university in the US and hosts one of the highest international student populations. The university joined NCAA Division II and the GLIAC conference in 2019. Globally, it ranks 105th by Times Higher Education and 127th by US News, with a strong reputation in research and startup creation.

Campus, Infrastructure, and Programs
The campus, originally built in the 1870s, has evolved with only the University Hall remaining from its original six buildings. Purdue offers more than 200 undergraduate majors and over 70 graduate programs, including professional degrees in pharmacy, veterinary medicine, and nursing. It supports 18 varsity sports teams and over 900 student organizations.

Achievements and Alumni
A founding member of the Big Ten Conference, Purdue has the largest student body in Indiana and a significant international presence. Its alumni have earned over 15,000 US patents, including astronauts Gus Grissom, Neil Armstrong, and Eugene Cernan. Nearly a third of NASA’s crewed missions have included Purdue graduates.

Diversity and Industry Connections
Purdue’s diverse campus includes students from around 180 countries. The university frequently hosts industry recruitment events and placement programs, partnering with local and global companies to provide students with job opportunities and real-world experience.

fields.name: Queensland University of Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1966 as Queensland Institute of Technology (QIT), the university evolved into Queensland University of Technology (QUT). It began with six departments and grew rapidly, especially in full-time and female student enrollment. QUT is accredited by top business bodies like AACSB, EQUIS, and AMBA. It ranks around 193–213 globally in QS and THE 2022 rankings and 176th in U.S. News Best Global Universities 2022.

Campuses and Programs
QUT has two main campuses—Gardens Point and Kelvin Grove—featuring modern facilities, libraries, labs, and arts venues. Gardens Point houses the Science and Engineering Centre, while Kelvin Grove includes the Creative Industries Precinct. The university offers over 100 programs, including diplomas, certificates, and undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, with strengths in Arts, Sciences, Medicine, Engineering, Business, and Computer Science.

Achievements and Alumni
QUT is committed to gender equality and was recognized as an Employer of Choice for Women multiple times. Renowned faculty include robotics expert Peter Corke. Alumni include notable Australian actresses Zoe Naylor, Gigi Edgley, and Deborah Mailman. The university’s alumni network is growing steadily.

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
QUT enrolls about 5,459 undergraduates and 3,433 graduate students from over 100 countries, supported by more than 4,800 staff members. Its Career Centre offers internships, job fairs, and mentoring. Top graduate employers include Deloitte, EY, Rio Tinto, KPMG, PwC, and Microsoft.

fields.name: Quinnipiac University
fields.about: uinnipiac University, located in Hamden, Connecticut, was founded in 1929 in New Haven as the Connecticut College of Commerce and moved to its current location in Hamden in 1966. Originally a small business school, it gradually expanded under various leaders, especially President John Lahey (1987–2018), who oversaw its transformation into a comprehensive university with over 10,000 students and multiple professional schools, including law and medicine. The institution adopted the name “Quinnipiac” in 1951 to honor the Indigenous Quinnipiac people of the region. Since relocating to Hamden, the university has significantly influenced the local economy and community, though its expansion has occasionally stirred tensions over land use and historic preservation. Today, Quinnipiac stands as a nationally recognized university known for its academic offerings, scenic campuses, and NCAA Division I athletics.

fields.name: OCAD University
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1876, OCAD University in Toronto is Canada's oldest institution dedicated to art and design education. Formerly known as the Ontario School of Art, it became the first Canadian school to train professional artists in both fine and commercial arts. OCAD is affiliated with AICAD, Universities Canada, COU, CBIE, and IAU. It ranks among the top 101–150 art and design schools globally (QS World Rankings 2022).

Campus & Programs
OCAD has a commuter campus split into north and south sections in downtown Toronto. Key facilities include the Sharp Centre for Design, Butterfield Park, and the Inclusive Design Institute. It offers 18 undergraduate and 7 graduate programs through its Faculties of Art, Design, Liberal Arts, and Sciences. The university also supports research, executive training, and business incubation.

Alumni & Achievements
OCAD has a rich legacy, with early leaders like George A. Reid and Group of Seven members. Notable alumni include painter Jack Bush, artist Rebecca Belmore, writer Madeline Ashby, and sculptor Shary Boyle.

Student Life & Career Opportunities
OCAD hosts over 4,700 students, including 21% international students. It offers student clubs, campus jobs through CEPIS, and alumni career support. Employers like RBC, Shopify, and the City of Toronto recruit OCAD graduates.

fields.name: Radboud University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1923 as the Catholic University of Nijmegen, Radboud University was established to advance the emancipation of Dutch Roman Catholics. Today, it’s affiliated with the European University Association, the International Federation of Catholic Universities, and the Guild of European Research-Intensive Universities. It ranks #220 (QS), #139 (THE), and #107 (U.S. News) globally.

Campus & Academics
Located in Nijmegen’s green Heyendaal estate, Radboud boasts one of the Netherlands’ most scenic campuses. It has seven faculties offering programs in humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, medicine, law, management, philosophy, and theology.

Achievements & Alumni
Radboud has been named the Netherlands’ top broad university for seven consecutive years. It played a key role in capturing the first image of a black hole. Notable alumni include Thom de Graaf, Lilian Marijnissen, and neuroscientist Wim Crusio.

Student Body & Career Support
Over 10% of students are international, supported by strong global partnerships and exchange programs. The university also offers extensive career services, including résumé support and regular employer fairs

fields.name: Red Deer Polytechnic
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1964, Red Deer College transitioned into Red Deer Polytechnic (RDP) in July 2021, gaining the authority to offer bachelor's degrees. Known for small class sizes and a strong community focus, RDP emphasizes hands-on learning. It is affiliated with organizations like ACCC, CCAA, AACTI, CBIE, and ACAC.

Campus, Facilities & Programs
RDP's main campus lies between Edmonton and Calgary, with its Donald School of Business located downtown Red Deer. The campus features modern learning spaces, labs, art galleries, and event venues, with a strong focus on sustainability. The institute offers over 75 programs, including certificates, diplomas, degrees, apprenticeships, and academic upgrading in fields such as arts, engineering, trades, and business.

Achievements & Alumni
RDP is home to one of Canada’s top athletic programs, with teams excelling in volleyball, basketball, soccer, hockey, and more. Around 96% of graduates report satisfaction with their education, and 92% find employment within six months. Notable alumni include k.d. lang, Kari Matchett, and Tim Tamashiro.

Student Diversity & Employers
With over 7,500 students, RDP has a diverse mix of learners—51% women and many in the 20–24 age group. Its Continuing Education division serves more than 38,000 individuals annually. Employers like NOVA Chemicals, Suncor, and RBC actively recruit from RDP, and Indian students are welcome regardless of study gaps.

fields.name: Regent University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1977 by Pat Robertson in Virginia Beach, Virginia, Regent University began as Christian Broadcasting Network University and was renamed in 1990. Rooted in Christian values, Regent has expanded steadily, adding new schools and campus facilities. Its sports teams compete in the NCAA.

Campus, Facilities & Programs
Regent’s main 70-acre campus features historic Georgian-style architecture combined with modern amenities like sports facilities, study spaces, and tech-equipped classrooms. It comprises eight schools offering undergraduate to doctoral programs in Business, Theology, Psychology, Law, Communication, and Public Administration.

Achievements & Alumni
Regent is known for its strong online programs and active research centers. The university promotes equality and inclusion, earning a Silver Award from the Employers Network. Notable alumni include best-selling authors and legal experts like Cheryl McKay, Mark Batterson, Jay Sekulow, and Charles Martin.

Diversity & Career Opportunities
With students from 90 countries and alumni worldwide, Regent fosters a diverse, inclusive community, including strong support for LGBTQIA+ students. Top employers of graduates include Anthem, Sentara Healthcare, Old Dominion University, and Liberty University.

fields.name: Odessa National Medical University
fields.about:
History & Rankings
Founded in 1900 as part of Novorossiysk State University in Odessa, the university quickly gained prestige, with figures like Nobel laureate I. Mechnikov among its faculty. After Ukraine’s independence in 1993, it became Odessa State Medical University, achieving the highest accreditation level. In 2019, it merged with the S. Georgievsky Medical Academy. Despite past corruption issues, the university remains recognized, with degrees approved by Ukraine’s Ministries of Health and Education. It ranks #6455 globally and #1541 in Europe.

Campus & Academics
The university features one of Ukraine’s oldest medical libraries, with over a million volumes and a growing digital collection. It also has a large sports complex with multiple departments and activities. Programs include undergraduate degrees in Medicine, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Nursing, and postgraduate clinical residencies.

Global Ties & Alumni
A member of major international academic organizations since 1996, the university collaborates with institutions like Washington University, University of Milan, and the Polish Academy of Medicine. Notable alumni include physician Valeriy Zaporozhan and surgeon Gennadiy Patlazhan.

Diversity & Faculty
The university hosts over 6,000 students, including 1,500+ international students from 57 countries. Courses are offered in Ukrainian, Russian, and English. The academic staff includes over 800 professionals, including professors, doctors, and assistant lecturers.

fields.name: Ohio Dominican University
fields.about:
Located in Columbus, Ohio, Ohio Dominican University (ODU) was founded in 1911 as a women’s college and became co-educational in 1964. It was renamed Ohio Dominican College in 1968 and achieved university status in 2002. The 75-acre campus serves over 1,700 students and 200 staff, offering more than 40 undergraduate and graduate programs across various fields.

ODU features modern facilities, including digital classrooms and a well-equipped library. Classes are small, with a maximum of 18 students, ensuring personalized attention. As a Catholic institution, it emphasizes values-based education, spiritual growth, and pastoral support. On-campus housing is available in fully furnished residence halls, complete with air conditioning and Wi-Fi.

fields.name: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1824, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) in New York is one of the oldest and top engineering research universities in the USA. It’s affiliated with NAICU, AITU, and Space-grant programs. RPI ranks #50 among U.S. National Universities (US News) and #383 globally (QS World Rankings).

Campus and Programs
RPI offers a wide range of programs beyond engineering, including architecture, arts, sciences, and business. The university focuses on training leaders who use technology to solve real-world challenges.

Achievements and Alumni
RPI is recognized for innovation and has notable alumni like Washington Gale Ferris Jr. (inventor of the Ferris Wheel) and Allen B. DuMont (pioneer of commercial TV and radar).

Student Body and Industry Connections
The institute enrolls around 8,100 students, including 1,800 international students, supported by 500 faculty members. Top recruiters include Amazon, Walmart, Citibank, and BNP Paribas.

fields.name: Ohio University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Ohio University, founded in 1804, is one of the oldest public universities in the U.S. It started with one building, three students, and Professor Jacob Lindley. The university was a pioneer in engineering education, offering early civil and electrical engineering courses. Located in Athens, Ohio, it covers 1,850 acres and is the first university chartered by an Act of Congress. In 2022, it ranked #1001-1200 in QS World University Rankings and #601-800 by Times Higher Education.

Campuses, Infrastructure, and Courses
The main campus is in Athens, with five regional campuses across Ohio and extension campuses in Cleveland and Dublin. Ohio University offers 250+ undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs to students from 108 countries. Popular majors include Nursing, Business, Humanities, Liberal Arts, and Journalism. The Vernon R. Alden Library holds over 3.3 million volumes. OU supports students with award-winning faculty, 500+ clubs, and various extracurricular activities. The “Bobcats” are its notable intercollegiate sports teams.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Ohio University is known for its diverse alumni and unique programs like the J. Warren McClure School’s communication degrees. It has received awards such as the 2010 ITERA Program of Excellence. The Institute for International Journalism offers global internships in major cities. It also provides one of the first Social Media Certificate programs nationally. Notable alumni include wrestler Abyss, comedian Jamie Alcroft, and poet/filmmaker Nujoom AlGhanem.

Student Diversity and Employers
With about 1,500 international students, Ohio University embraces cultural diversity and inclusion. Graduates find jobs at top companies like Hewlett-Packard, Xerox, Dell, Google, and Boeing, supported by the university’s career services.

fields.name: Rhine Waal University of Applied Sciences
fields.about: Rhine-Waal University of Applied Sciences, founded in 2009, has two campuses located in Kleve and Kamp-Lintfort. It serves around 7,300 students from over 120 countries. The university offers 25 bachelor’s and 11 master’s programs through four faculties: Technology and Bionics, Life Sciences and Society, Economics (all in Kleve), and Communication and Environment (in Kamp-Lintfort). Students can study full-time, part-time, or via dual-vocational programs. Close partnerships with industry and multinational companies provide practical learning opportunities. Additionally, the university emphasizes research across various fields.

fields.name: Rice University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Rice University, founded in 1891 in Houston, Texas, is a prestigious private research university on a 300-acre campus. Established by William Marsh Rice to promote literature, science, and art, it opened as Rice Institute in 1912 and became a university in 1960. Rice launched the first U.S. space-science department in 1963. Accredited by top organizations and affiliated with several research consortia, Rice ranks #94 in QS World University Rankings 2022 and holds strong global positions in other rankings.

Campus, Schools, and Programs
Rice houses schools including the Jesse H. Jones Graduate School of Management, Shepherd School of Music, Wiess School of Natural Sciences, George R. Brown School of Engineering, and others. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral programs, with over 50 undergraduate majors. The campus features 11 residential colleges where most undergraduates live. Rice also hosts research centers like the Baker Institute for Public Policy and the Rice Quantum Institute.

Achievements and Alumni
Rice contributed to Apollo missions with experiments developed by its professors. It received the NASA Ambassador of Exploration Award on the 40th Apollo anniversary. Notable alumni include astronauts Peggy Whitson, musician Caroline Shaw, entrepreneur Brian Armstrong, and others.

Diversity and Career Opportunities
Rice promotes inclusivity through its Diversity and Inclusion Office and supports a diverse student body—25% international and nearly half from outside Texas. The student-faculty ratio is 6:1. Top recruiters include Capital One, Dell, Deloitte, Chevron, ExxonMobil, Google, and Boeing.
fields.admission_requirements:
Application Process
Choose your application type:

Early Decision I (Deadline: Nov 1)

Early Decision II (Deadline: Jan 4)

Regular Decision (Deadline: Jan 4)

Complete the Common Application with Rice Writing Supplement.

Pay the $75 application fee.

Submit all required documents by the deadline.

Optionally request an interview with a current student or alumnus (not guaranteed).

Documents Required
Official high school transcript (submitted by your school)

Two teacher recommendation letters

One school counselor recommendation

Midyear report (senior midyear grades)

Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT) — optional

International student financial statement and supporting documents (for international applicants)

The Box (a unique submission where you share something personal beyond academics)

fields.name: Okanagan College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Okanagan College, established in 1963, is one of British Columbia's oldest public post-secondary institutions. It was renamed Okanagan University College in 1995 but reverted to Okanagan College in 2005 after splitting into UBC Okanagan and OC. The college’s engineering technology programs are nationally accredited, offering pathways to professional certification.

Campuses, Infrastructure & Courses
With four campuses, Okanagan College offers over 120 programs including degrees, diplomas, trades, and vocational training. Popular fields include Business, Science, Technology, Health, and Trades. The college combines strong academics with extracurricular opportunities, producing industry-ready graduates through career-focused education.

Accomplishments & Alumni
The college’s Sustainable Construction Management Technology (SCMT) program is globally recognized. Its Jim Pattison Centre of Excellence earned LEED Platinum certification and was named Canada’s greenest post-secondary building in 2016. Notable alumni include poet Shane Koyczan, politician Dan Albas, and educator Robyn Bourgeois.

Student Diversity & Employers
Okanagan College hosts 8,500 students, including around 1,000 international students from 40+ countries. It also has the highest Indigenous student enrollment in British Columbia, reflecting its commitment to inclusivity and community engagement.

fields.name: Richard J. Wehle School of Business
fields.about:
Canisius College, a private Jesuit institution in Buffalo, New York, was established in 1870 by German Jesuits and named after St. Peter Canisius. The college is led by President John J. Hurley and employs 368 staff members (174 full-time and 194 part-time). It serves about 3,464 students, with 2,398 undergraduates and 1,066 postgraduates. Known as the Golden Griffins and Lady Griffins, Canisius offers over 100 undergraduate majors and minors and around 34 master’s programs.

The college holds affiliations with ACCU, NAICU, and AJCU. Canisius sponsors 20 NCAA Division I teams and competes mainly in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference (MAAC), except for men’s ice hockey, which plays in the Atlantic Hockey Association. Men's sports include ice hockey, baseball, and golf; women’s sports include softball and volleyball. It was also the first home field for the Buffalo All-Americans of the NFL. Canisius is a key ROTC center for Western New York and features a student-run media outlet, The Griffin, a weekly newspaper that went online in 2013, succeeding The Canisian from 1933.

Standardized test scores (GMAT or GRE) if required by program.

English language proficiency test scores (TOEFL, IELTS, etc.) for non-native speakers.

Financial documents and Certification of Finances (for international students).

fields.name: Oklahoma City University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1904, Oklahoma City University (OKCU) began as Epworth University and has grown into a leading private Methodist institution. Known for excellence in Liberal Arts and Sciences, it is affiliated with CIC, IAMSCU, and NAICU. OKCU was ranked #239 in the U.S. News & World Report 2022 National Universities list.

Campus, Infrastructure & Courses
Located on a scenic 104-acre urban campus in Oklahoma City’s Uptown 23rd District, OKCU offers vibrant access to the city's cultural scene. The university has 9 schools and colleges offering programs in Arts, Sciences, Business, Dance, Music, Nursing, Law, Theatre, Visual Arts, and advanced degrees like DPT and PA programs.

Achievements & Alumni
OKCU is recognized by Forbes among the Best Christian Colleges and 100 Best College Buys. Its AACSB-accredited business school ranks in the top 4.5% in the U.S. Notable alumni include Broadway stars Kristin Chenoweth and Kelli O’Hara, composer Mason Williams, and Oklahoma City Mayor David Holt.

Student Diversity & Employers
Home to 2,300+ students from 46 U.S. states and 43 countries, OKCU is known for its diverse and inclusive community. With 80+ student organizations, Greek life, and global networking opportunities, graduates are recruited by top companies like Microsoft, Dell, and Oracle, including several Fortune 500 firms.

fields.name: Rider University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1865 as Trenton Business College, Rider University evolved into a comprehensive university by 1994. Known for its “Engaged Learning” approach, Rider helps students blend academics with career goals and personal interests. It’s affiliated with organizations like the Council of Independent Colleges (CIC) and ranks among Princeton Review’s Best 387 Colleges.

Campus & Academics
Located on a 280-acre campus in Lawrenceville, New Jersey, Rider offers modern facilities including labs, theaters, and recreation centers. It has four colleges: Norm Brodsky College of Business, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, College of Education and Human Services, and Westminster College of the Arts. Programs include 100+ undergraduate majors and minors and over 50 graduate degrees and certificates, with options for study abroad, internships, and assistantships.

Achievements & Alumni
With 94% of full-time faculty holding doctorates, Rider guarantees graduates a spot in higher education or a paid internship within six months through its “Cranberry Investment.” The university’s alumni network exceeds 60,000, including notable figures like basketball coach Digger Phelps and former Pennsylvania Governor Mark Schweiker.

Student Diversity & Employers
Rider enrolls over 4,600 students, with 3% international students from 53 countries. The student body is 58% female and 45% ethnically diverse. Known as the “Rider Broncs,” students enjoy active campus life and sports. Top employers recruiting graduates include Merrill Lynch, Deloitte, EY, Bloomberg, and Johnson & Johnson.

fields.name: Olds College
fields.about:
Olds College, founded in 1913 in Olds, Alberta, began as a small agricultural school focused on practical farming skills. It evolved over the years, changing its name to Olds Agricultural and Vocational College in 1963 and then to Olds College in 1970. In 2022, it rebranded as Olds College of Agriculture & Technology to highlight its focus on agri-tech innovation, including the development of its advanced Smart Farm research platform.

While not featured in global university rankings, Olds College is highly regarded within Canada’s research community. It ranked #4 among Canada’s top 50 research colleges in 2023 and #14 in 2024, excelling in applied research areas like precision agriculture and smart farming.

The college is affiliated with groups such as the Alberta Association of Colleges & Technical Institutes, Colleges and Institutes Canada, and the University and College Consortium of Alberta. Its athletic teams, the Olds College Broncos, compete in provincial and national collegiate leagues. It also partners with local communities through initiatives like the Community Learning Campus.

Olds College offers over 475 scholarships and bursaries annually, totaling more than $555,000. These support a wide range of students, including targeted awards for Indigenous learners, such as the TransAlta Aboriginal Educational Awards. Additional funding comes from farmland donations and government bursary programs.

fields.name: Riga Technical University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1862 as Riga Polytechnicum, one of Russia’s first polytechnic colleges, it was renamed Riga Technical University (RTU) in 1990. RTU offers programs in engineering, agriculture, chemistry, architecture, and more, with affiliations including BSRUN, BALTECH, NORDTEK, and EUt+. It is Latvia’s top-ranked university in the 2020 Times Higher Education Sustainability Assessment.

Campus and Courses
The campus features faculties, labs, library, student housing, creative centers, sports facilities, and social spaces. RTU offers five English-taught programs from undergraduate to doctoral levels, spanning disciplines like Civil Engineering and Aeronautics. Students enjoy vibrant cultural and athletic activities.

Achievements and Alumni
With over 150 years of scientific excellence, RTU boasts Nobel laureates and notable alumni like Wilhelm Ostwald (Chemistry Nobel Prize) and Paul Walden (chemist). It holds the European Quality Mark and has Latvia’s oldest accredited library with around 2 million items.

Student Body and Employers
RTU enrolls over 14,300 students, including 1,800 international students, with a balanced gender ratio of 65% male to 35% female. Top recruiters include Amazon, Oracle, KPMG US, and Google.

fields.name: OMNES - ESCE Business School
fields.about:
OMNES ESCE Business School, founded in 1968 as ESCE (École Supérieure du Commerce Extérieur), is a renowned French business school specializing in international business education. Since joining OMNES Education in 2017, it has become part of a larger network of 16 schools across 10 global campuses, including locations like Paris, Lyon, London, and Shanghai. This provides students with a multicultural and international learning environment, enriched by opportunities such as language training, networking, and company visits.

The school offers a variety of programs aimed at preparing students for global careers. Its flagship International Bachelor is a three-year program focusing on management, business, and international relations, with specialization options in fields like Digital Marketing and Corporate Finance. For advanced studies, ESCE provides a Master in Management (Grande École) program along with Master of Science, Doctorate, and Ph.D. options, covering areas such as Marketing, Finance, Entrepreneurship, and Supply Chain Management.

Internationalization is a core part of ESCE’s identity, with over 190 partner universities across 44 countries, allowing students to participate in exchanges and double degrees. The curriculum is delivered mainly in English, with students able to learn up to four languages from a choice of 20. Recently, OMNES Education expanded in India by opening offices in New Delhi and Bangalore, aiming to strengthen academic and industry partnerships and provide greater access to quality education for Indian students.

fields.name: RMIT University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1887 by Francis Ormond, RMIT University (Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology) began as a night school focused on Art, Science, and Technology during Australia’s industrial growth. It became a public university in 1992 after merging with the Phillips Institute of Technology. RMIT is guided by six core values: Inclusion, Agility, Courage, Imagination, Passion, and Impact. It’s affiliated with colleges like International House and organizations such as the Australian Technology Network. RMIT is highly ranked globally—#206 by QS, #301-350 by THE, and #244 by U.S. News (2022).

Campuses and Programs
RMIT operates three Australian campuses—Melbourne City, Bundoora, and Brunswick—and two in Vietnam, plus a collaboration center in Spain. It also partners with institutions in Asia and Europe. The Melbourne City campus sits in the vibrant city center, Bundoora offers a peaceful park setting, and Brunswick is known for its creative culture. RMIT offers 200+ undergraduate and postgraduate courses in fields including Architecture, Engineering, Business, Design, IT, Health Sciences, and Social Sciences.

Achievements and Alumni
RMIT’s research ranks in the top 1% globally, with notable recognition like the 2020 Melbourne Achiever Award and international sustainability accolades. The university has produced distinguished alumni including filmmaker James Wan, astronomer Arthur Hogg, and physicist Elizabeth Gardner.

Diversity and Industry Links
With 97,000 students from over 230 countries, RMIT values diversity and inclusion through a dedicated framework promoting access and equity. It collaborates with major organizations such as BMW, Deloitte, and the United Nations, offering students over 15,800 industry placements.

fields.name: OMNES - INSEEC School of Business and Economics
fields.about:
INSEEC School of Business and Economics is a well-established private business school with a robust international presence, boasting campuses across several countries, including France, Switzerland, Monaco, and the United Kingdom. Founded in 1975, the school has grown over nearly five decades into a respected institution recognized for its comprehensive range of academic programs. These include undergraduate degrees, master’s programs, and executive education courses that cover key areas such as business administration, management, and economics.

The school’s educational philosophy centers around nurturing the next generation of global business leaders by combining rigorous academic training with real-world experience. INSEEC places particular emphasis on entrepreneurship, innovation, and sustainable business practices, equipping students with the skills needed to navigate the complexities of today’s fast-evolving economic landscape. Its curriculum is designed to foster creativity, critical thinking, and responsible leadership, preparing graduates to make meaningful contributions in diverse professional environments worldwide.

INSEEC’s faculty is composed of a dynamic mix of seasoned industry practitioners and distinguished academics, ensuring that students benefit from a well-rounded education that balances theory with practical application. This blend allows learners to engage with contemporary business challenges through case studies, internships, and collaborative projects. The school also prioritizes international exposure and multicultural learning, offering numerous opportunities for students to study abroad, participate in exchange programs, and build global networks that are essential for successful careers in today’s interconnected world.

fields.name: Oregon State University
fields.about:
Oregon State University: Overview

Founded in 1856 as Corvallis Academy, Oregon State University (OSU) evolved through various stages—becoming Oregon State College in 1937 and achieving university status in 1961. It is a Carnegie Community Engagement institution and a top-tier doctoral research university. OSU is one of 73 U.S. land-grant universities and uniquely holds designations as a Sun-grant, Space-grant, and Sea-grant institution. In 2022, U.S. News & World Report ranked it #295 globally and #162 nationally.

Campuses and Academics

OSU operates multiple campuses: the main Corvallis campus, OSU-Cascades in Bend, Portland, the Hatfield Marine Science Center, and extension centers in 36 countries. It offers over 200 undergraduate and 100 graduate programs across 11 colleges, including Engineering, Public Health, Veterinary Medicine, Forestry, and Business. An Exploratory Studies program helps students find their academic path.

Achievements and Alumni

Ranked among the top 1.4% of global universities, OSU is recognized for innovation and is Oregon’s #1 public university for mid-career salary. It receives $384 million in research funding and ranks #3 worldwide for climate change research. Four faculty are in the top 1% of cited researchers. OSU’s 210,000+ alumni span over 70 countries and include notable figures like inventor Douglas Engelbart and chemist Linus Pauling.

Student Diversity and Employers

With 34,100+ students from 50 states and 106 countries, OSU fosters a culturally diverse campus supported by 7 Cultural Resource Centers. Graduates are recruited by major employers such as Intel, Nike, Boeing, Amazon, Microsoft, Apple, Google, and Meta.

fields.name: Saarland University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1948 with support from the French government and the University of Nancy, Saarland University blends French and German academic traditions with a European outlook. It was the first university established west of the Rhine after WWII. All degree programs are internationally recognized and accredited. Saarland ranks #447 in the QS World University Rankings, #933 globally (U.S. News), #368 in Europe, and #53 in Germany.

Campus & Academics
The main campus, located near Saarbrücken in a scenic forest setting, features social spaces and modern facilities. The medical faculty and University Hospital are based in Homburg. Saarland offers bachelor’s and master’s degrees across various fields, with strong global recognition in computer science, life sciences, and nanosciences.

Research & Alumni
Saarland University collaborates with over 550 institutions across 52 countries, including 240 in Europe and 46 beyond. It is widely recognized in France and globally for its research excellence. Notable alumni include computer scientists Susanne Albers and Michael Kohlhase, and former Saarland Minister-President Peter Müller.

Student Life & Careers
With 16,700 students—20% of whom are international—Saarland offers a diverse academic community. Top represented countries include France, India, China, and Iran. The Career Service supports student employability, with graduates recruited by Google, Amazon, Bosch, EY, Siemens, and CISPA.

fields.name: Sacred Heart University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1963 by Bishop Walter W. Curtis, Sacred Heart University (SHU) was the first Catholic university in the U.S. established by laypeople. It is affiliated with major academic and athletic associations, including the ACCU, NAICU, and NCAA Division I. According to THE US College Rankings 2022, SHU ranks between #401–500.

Campuses & Programs
Located in Fairfield, Connecticut, SHU has campuses in Stamford, Griswold, Bridgeport, Ireland, and Luxembourg. It comprises five colleges, including the Jack Welch College of Business & Technology, and offers over 80 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs. The university is accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education.

Achievements & Alumni
SHU is recognized as a Catholic College of Distinction. Notable alumni include Suzanne Greco (former Subway CEO), musician Jeff LeBlanc, and State Senator Carlo Leone.

Student Diversity & Careers
With over 6,000 students, including international students from 50+ countries, SHU fosters a global community. The university offers strong career support and hosts regular job fairs, with top employers recruiting graduates.

fields.name: Robert Morris University
fields.about: Accountancy and later renamed after financier Robert Morris. Its Engineering programs ranked 110th in the 2020 U.S. News Best Colleges. The university enrolls about 4,895 students, with undergraduates making up 4,005 and roughly 10% international students. Originally focused on business, it now includes four schools: Business; Informatics, Humanities & Social Sciences; Engineering, Mathematics & Science; and Nursing, Education & Human Studies. It offers a wide range of bachelor's, master's, doctoral, and certificate programs, with popular fields like Manufacturing Engineering, Nursing, and Business Management. The university boasts strong outcomes, including a 95% placement rate one year after graduation and 84% of graduates working in their field, with 77% in leadership roles.
fields.admission_requirements:

fields.name: Rochester Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1829 as Rochester Athenæum and Mechanics Institute, it became Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) in 1944 and achieved university status. RIT is a leading National Research university with global campuses in China, Croatia, Dubai, and Kosovo. It is affiliated with AITU, RAC, NAIC, and Space-grant. In 2022, RIT ranked #1001-1200 in QS World University Rankings and #801-1000 in Times Higher Education.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
RIT’s main campus in Henrietta offers modern facilities, a vast library with over 500,000 books and extensive digital resources, and more than 300 student clubs. It provides 78 undergraduate, 73 postgraduate, and 49 accelerated dual-degree programs across 12 fields such as Art, Design, Business, Engineering, and Digital Media.

Achievements and Alumni
Accredited by MSCHE, RIT ranks among the top 12 U.S. schools for co-ops and internships and is the 3rd largest private STEM university in the U.S. It has produced over 15 Pulitzer Prize winners. Notable alumni include author Katherine Hayles, software engineer John Resig, and politician Robert J. Duffy.

Student Body and Employers
RIT enrolls over 19,000 students, including 5,800 international students, with a 65:35 male-to-female ratio. Top recruiters include Whirlpool, 3M, Johnson & Johnson, Schneider Electric, Xerox, Dell, and Marriott.

fields.name: SAE Institute
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1976 in Australia, the SAE Institute was the world’s first audio engineering school. Its success led to global expansion, with the first U.S. campus opening in New York City in 1999. Today, SAE campuses across the U.S. are accredited by relevant education boards.

Campuses & Programs
SAE now operates over 50 campuses in more than 25 countries. Originally focused on audio, it now offers programs in Animation, Design, Film, Games, and Web & Mobile. Courses are designed to be practical, industry-relevant, and theory-based. The flagship Sydney campus features top-tier equipment, including Neve Custom Series 75 consoles, and is located in a vibrant arts district.

Achievements & Alumni
SAE provides hands-on training with professional equipment, guided by experienced industry professionals. Its global alumni network includes over 15,000 professionals. Notable graduates include Oscar and BAFTA winner Mark Paterson (Les Misérables), Grammy winner David Donaldson (Ray), and musician Shabareesh Varma.

Student Diversity & Careers
With 52 campuses worldwide, SAE attracts students from around the globe. Clubs and societies support student engagement, while dedicated career services connect graduates with top employers such as Apple, Amazon, Upwork, Sky, Accenture, and Capgemini.

fields.name: Saginaw Valley State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1963, Saginaw Valley State University (SVSU) is a public university in Michigan. Originally Saginaw Valley College, it became a four-year institution and launched the “Talent. Opportunity. Promise” campaign in 2013 to raise $25 million. SVSU is affiliated with Space-Grant and NCAA Division II – GLIAC (North Division). It ranks #112 in Regional Universities Midwest (U.S. News) and #600 in U.S. College Rankings 2022 (Times Higher Education).

Campus, Colleges, and Programs
SVSU has five colleges: Arts and Behavioral Sciences, Business and Management, Education, Health & Human Services, and Science, Engineering and Technology. The campus features research labs, a library with 200,000 print and 400,000 digital resources, and nearby amenities like cafes and shops. The university offers over 100 undergraduate and graduate programs with opportunities for research, study abroad, conferences, and internships.

Accreditations and Alumni
SVSU is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission. Its Business College holds AACSB accreditation, a prestigious global business school standard. Alumni work across all 50 states, including notable figures like State Representative Matt Koleszar and Congressman Bart Stupak.

Student Body and Employers
SVSU enrolls over 8,500 students (7,400 undergraduates, 750 postgraduates), with 900+ international students and a 36:64 male-to-female ratio. Over 650 faculty serve the community. Leading recruiters include KPMG, Google, and Empire Spirits.

fields.name: Saint Peter's University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1872 in Jersey City, Saint Peter’s University is a private institution that gained university status in 2012. Originally an all-male college, it now operates on a 25-acre campus near New York City. The university is accredited by CCNE, IACBE, CAEP, and others, ranking #58 in Regional Universities North and #24 for Best Undergraduate Teaching.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
The 30-acre campus features the 125,000 sq. ft. Yanitelli Recreational Life Centre and a vibrant student life with over 50 clubs. It has two libraries holding nearly 300,000 books and extensive digital resources. Saint Peter’s offers over 60 programs across one college and four schools, covering fields like Economics, Education, Science, Business, Law, Computer Science, and more. The Meadowlands campus partners with Bergen Community College nearby.

Achievements and Alumni
Saint Peter’s is the only NCAA Division I school with a peacock mascot, symbolizing local heritage. Its alumni network includes 33,000 graduates worldwide, with notable names like writer Will Durant, politician Robert Menendez, and actor Ken Jennings.

Student Body and Recruiters
The university enrolls about 3,200 students, with a 14:1 student-faculty ratio and 62% female population. Top recruiters include Ernst & Young, PwC, Amazon, JP Morgan Chase, and KPMG.

fields.name: Roosevelt University
fields.about: Roosevelt University in Chicago was founded in 1945 by Edward J. Sparling and a group of faculty and students who left Central YMCA College in protest of proposed discriminatory admission quotas. Originally named Thomas Jefferson College, it was quickly renamed in honor of President Franklin D. Roosevelt with the blessing of Eleanor Roosevelt. From its inception, the university was committed to inclusive education regardless of race, religion, or gender—a rare stance at the time. It soon moved into the historic Auditorium Building and expanded its offerings through a 1954 merger with the Chicago Musical College. Over the decades, Roosevelt grew into a progressive urban university, opening a Schaumburg campus in 1996, unveiling the Wabash Building in 2012, and merging with Robert Morris University Illinois in 2020. Today, it remains dedicated to social justice, diversity, and access to education for all.
