fields.name: South Dakota State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1881 as a land-grant agricultural college, SDSU became a university in 1964. Located in Brookings, it is the largest and most comprehensive university in South Dakota and a member of the Space Grant Consortium. SDSU has earned national recognition, including:

#196 – Sierra Magazine’s “Cool Schools” ranking

#13 – Best Value Nursing Schools (College Factual, 2021)

Top 5% – For bachelor’s in nursing programs

#272 – National Universities (U.S. News, 2020)

#135 – Top Public Schools (U.S. News, 2020)

#471 – Forbes' America’s Top Colleges (2019)

#40 – Best Agricultural Sciences Colleges (Niche, 2020)

Campus & Academics
Spread across 387 acres, SDSU’s campus includes 179 buildings and housing for 4,600 students. The university has nine colleges offering:

82 majors, 94 minors, 36 master’s, 15 PhDs, and 2 professional doctorates

Strong distance education programs

Disciplines include Arts, Humanities, Sciences, Engineering, Nursing, Pharmacy, and more

Accomplishments & Alumni
SDSU is known for innovative, student-centered education. Its alumni network includes over 96,000 graduates, with notable names like:

Gene Amdahl – Inventor of IBM 360

Adam Vinatieri – NFL legend and 4-time Super Bowl champion

Ben Reifel – First Lakota Indian in U.S. Congress

Theodore Schultz – Nobel Laureate in Economics

Student Diversity & Career Opportunities
With over 11,000 students from 49 states and 70+ countries, SDSU’s international student body makes up 5.3% of enrollment. The university hosts job fairs through the Office of Career Development, offering in-person and virtual recruitment opportunities with various employers.

fields.name: The University of Tulsa
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
The University of Tulsa began as the Presbyterian School for Indian Girls in 1882 and became Henry Kendall College in 1894. It has been accredited by the Higher Learning Commission since 1929. According to the QS World University Rankings 2022, TU ranks between #801-1000 globally.

Campus, Facilities, and Programs
Located near Tulsa’s downtown, the campus centers around Dietler Commons ("The U") and includes historic Skelly Field on Route 66. TU offers over 67 undergraduate, 47 graduate, and 10 doctoral programs, along with minors, certificates, and joint degrees.

Achievements and Alumni
TU is recognized as Oklahoma’s greenest university and manages the Gilcrease Museum. Its students volunteered 76,000+ community service hours in 2019-20. Notable alumni include Drew Edmondson (former Attorney General of Oklahoma), NFL player Steve Largent, and actress Rue McClanahan.

Student Life and Employers
With 196 student organizations and a diverse student body of about 3,800, including 34% multicultural and 9% international students, TU offers a vibrant community. Employers connect with students via the Handshake platform for jobs and internships.

fields.name: The University of Western Australia
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
The University of Western Australia (UWA), founded in 1911, is Australia’s sixth oldest university and was the only university in Western Australia until 1973. Known as one of the “sandstone universities” for its historic status, UWA started with 184 students and now enrolls over 25,000 from 100 countries. It ranks among the world’s top 1%, positioned #79 by US News, #92 by QS, and #132 by Times Higher Education (2022).

Campus, Infrastructure & Courses
Located in Perth with a main campus at Crawley, UWA spans 160 acres and offers nearly 300 undergraduate and graduate programs across fields like Education, Law, Business, and Philosophy. The campus features six major libraries (including Australia’s largest, Reid Library), on-campus housing, sports and cultural clubs, and theatre venues. Research centers include the Oceans Institute and the Centre for Energy & Minerals.

Achievements & Alumni
UWA is highly rated for teaching quality (5 stars by Good University Guide) and holds prestigious AACSB and EQUIS business accreditations. It ranks #1 in Western Australia for Graduate Employability and has earned 23 Citations for Student Learning. Notable alumni include 2005 Australian of the Year Fiona Wood, former Ansett CEO Rod Eddington, and comedian Tim Minchin.

Student Diversity & Career Support
UWA’s 25,000+ students include over 4,000 internationals. The Student Guild represents student interests with a focus on inclusivity and sustainability. Located in multicultural Perth, UWA offers extensive career services—job fairs, workshops, resume help, and networking—to connect students with employers in sectors like IT, Finance, Legal, and Management.

fields.name: South East Technological University (SETU)
fields.about:
South East Technological University (SETU), established in May 2022 through the merger of Waterford IT and IT Carlow, is a fast-growing institution rooted in decades of regional education. It operates multiple campuses across southeast Ireland and serves around 18,000–20,000 students, focusing on technological education, research, and regional development.

Despite being new, SETU has earned strong rankings—top 500 in QS World Rankings 2025 and top 400 in Times Higher Education. It leads among Irish technological universities for graduate employability, with 95% of graduates finding work within six months. Its research reputation is rising, with four faculty members named among the world’s top 2% of scientists.

SETU offers various scholarships, including merit-based awards (€1,000–€4,000), international student discounts, and sports scholarships. It also supports refugees and asylum seekers through University of Sanctuary scholarships. Known for its practical, industry-linked programs, SETU appeals to students seeking affordable, career-focused education, though it continues to build its facilities and reputation.

fields.name: Southeast Missouri State University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1873, Southeast Missouri State University (SEMO) is a public institution located in Cape Girardeau, Missouri. It has steadily improved its rankings over the years, particularly in the US News & World Report – Regional Universities Midwest category, where it ranked 76th in 2021, up from 78th in 2019 and 2020, and 90th in 2018. The university is recognized for its global and regional research reputation and publication impact. Additionally, Times Higher Education placed SEMO at around the 600th position in its U.S. College Rankings 2022.

Campus, Infrastructure & Academic Offerings
SEMO spans over 400 hectares in an urban setting and serves approximately 12,000 students. It offers more than 200 academic programs, including bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral degrees. Nearly all programs include internships and experiential learning, and students have access to study abroad opportunities ranging from two weeks to a full year. The university also houses the River Campus, home to the Holland School of Arts and Media, reinforcing its dedication to arts education.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
SEMO continues to rise in national rankings, recently achieving the #1 spot in Top Performers on Social Mobility and climbing from its previous 16th place among Top Public Schools. Its alumni network includes notable figures such as Neal E. Boyd (singer), Linda M. Godwin (scientist and astronaut), Cedric the Entertainer, Peter D. Kinder (former Lieutenant Governor of Missouri), and Rush Limbaugh (radio personality).

Student Diversity & Career Opportunities
SEMO boasts a 93% visa acceptance rate and a diverse student population, with programs available in over 32 international locations. The university embraces inclusivity across race, gender, religion, and nationality. Incoming students typically have SAT scores between 1030–1200 or ACT scores between 19–25, though scores outside this range are also considered. The application deadline is July 1. Major recruiters include Ascension Health, Enterprise Holdings, and O'Reilly Automotive, highlighting SEMO’s strong industry connections and career support services.

fields.name: Thomas Jefferson University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Thomas Jefferson University was formed in 2017 through the merger of Thomas Jefferson University and Philadelphia University, combining over 100 years of expertise. It emphasizes interdisciplinary learning through its Nexus Learning approach. The university is affiliated with NCAA Division II – CACC and is ranked #148 among National Universities by U.S. News & World Report (2022).

Campus, Programs, and Courses
Located on a 100-acre urban campus, Thomas Jefferson University offers undergraduate, graduate, medical, professional, and online programs. Popular fields include Engineering, Architecture, Business, Health, Science, and Design, all integrated through its innovative Nexus curriculum.

Achievements and Alumni
The university focuses on practical education to prepare students for future job markets, boasting high employment rates for graduates. Notable alumni include James P. Bagian (physician and former NASA astronaut) and Curtis King (former baseball player).

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
The merger broadened its global outlook, attracting diverse students worldwide. TJU maintains a 96.5% employment or graduate school success rate, with graduates achieving some of the highest earnings reported by U.S. News.

fields.name: Thompson Rivers University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1970 as Cariboo College, TRU began offering bachelor’s degrees in 1989 and gained university status in 2005. It launched its Law School in 2010—Canada’s first in over 30 years. TRU holds accreditation from the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU) and a Platinum rating for sustainability from AASHE. It is a member of the Research Universities Council of British Columbia and Universities Canada. TRU ranks #1 in Canada for sustainability (STARS), #51 globally for Political Science (QS), and #46 in Canada (UniRank).

Campus, Infrastructure & Courses
TRU operates two campuses in Kamloops and Williams Lake, within the traditional Secwepemc territory. The Kamloops campus overlooks the meeting point of the North and South Thompson Rivers. TRU offers over 140 on-campus and 60 online programs through its Open Learning division, including trades, certificates, diplomas, and undergraduate and graduate degrees. Courses emphasize hands-on learning, flexible delivery, and student-centered support.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
TRU is among only five universities worldwide to achieve Platinum STARS status. Its Law School has over 800 alumni in diverse legal roles across Canada. Notable alumni include Lorne Cardinal (actor), Steven Galloway (novelist), and John Gordon Perrin (volleyball player). The university raised over $61,000 during its Day of Giving to support students.

Student Diversity & Recruiters
Home to over 3,500 international students from 100+ countries, TRU offers a vibrant multicultural environment. Through partnerships with 40+ global institutions, students benefit from exchange and study-abroad opportunities. International Student Advisors offer dedicated support. Top recruiters include RBC, Sherwin-Williams, Stats Canada, Axis Forestry, and Calgary Police.

fields.name: Tilburg University
fields.about:
Tilburg University – Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1927 as the Roomsch Katholieke Handelshoogeschool (Roman Catholic Business School), Tilburg University is a leading Dutch public institution known for academic excellence and interdisciplinary learning. It collaborates with institutions like MindLabs and Jheronimus Academy of Data Sciences (JADS), and holds memberships with the EUA, AACSB, and VSNU. Tilburg consistently ranked as the best general university in the Netherlands (2015–2017, National Student Survey) and is globally ranked in the top 50 for Law, Business, Economics, and Psychology (THE 2022).

Campus, Facilities & Courses
Located in Tilburg, the university offers Bachelor's and Master's programs in Law, Business, Economics, Humanities, Social and Digital Sciences. It comprises five schools and is home to several research institutes and centers. The AACSB-accredited School of Economics and Management highlights Tilburg’s strong business focus. Campus amenities include lecture halls, research labs, a sports center, dining areas, housing, and libraries.

Achievements & Alumni
Tilburg emphasizes small class sizes, personal mentoring, and strong industry ties through career services, seminars, and networking events. Over 60% of its research is published open-access, and its alumni network includes 78,000+ graduates globally. Notable alumni include Attje Kuiken (Dutch Parliament), Ralph Hamers (CEO, UBS), and Amit Goyal (Innovator).

Student Diversity & Career Opportunities
Home to students from over 130 countries, Tilburg fosters an inclusive, international environment. Exchange opportunities are available at 200+ partner universities worldwide. Graduates are recruited by top employers like Deloitte, ASML, PwC, Rabobank, and Google.

fields.name: Southern Alberta Institute of Technology
fields.about:
Infrastructure, Campus, and Programs
SAIT offers a modern, well-equipped urban campus with extensive facilities including a fitness centre, squash courts, saltwater pool, hockey arena, theatre, and multiple dining options. The Stan Grad Centre serves as the heart of campus, housing the library, bookstore, student union, food courts, classrooms, and study spaces. On-campus residences feature furnished units, high-speed internet, study areas, and 24/7 security. SAIT has been a proud member of the Alberta Colleges Athletic Conference since 1964.

Notable Alumni and Achievements
SAIT has produced many distinguished graduates, including politicians Robert Alford, Ken Allred, Evan Berger, and TV personality Kaella Carr, showcasing the university’s strong legacy in public service and media.

Diversity, Inclusion, and Career Focus
SAIT is deeply committed to equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI), creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all students. EDI is central to SAIT’s mission to prepare graduates for meaningful careers and global leadership in applied education.

fields.name: Southern Cross University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Southern Cross University (SCU) is a multi-campus public university in Australia, officially established in 1994, though it traces its roots to the former Lismore Teachers’ College. Over the years, SCU has expanded significantly, launching a Gold Coast campus in 2010 and a new Health Sciences building at the Coffs Harbour campus in 2019. The university is a member of the Regional Universities Network and is globally recognized for its growing impact.

Times Higher Education (THE) World Rankings: #601–800 globally, #30 in Australia

QS World University Rankings: #701–750 globally

Ranked among the top 200 young universities worldwide (THE Young University Rankings 2022)

Campuses, Infrastructure, and Programs
SCU has campuses in Gold Coast, Coffs Harbour, and Lismore, offering a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Key study areas include:

Business, Tourism, Hospitality, Law, Engineering, Education, Health, Creative Arts, IT, and Humanities

Specialized programs in Osteopathy, Indigenous Knowledge, Midwifery, Marine Science, and Psychology
SCU also offers flexible learning through Pathway Programs and a unique Design Your Degree initiative, allowing students to tailor interdisciplinary studies—such as combining Business and Psychology or Arts and Digital Media.

Achievements and Alumni
Southern Cross University has earned a 5-star rating in the Good Universities Guide 2022 for Overall Experience, Student Support, and Graduate Salary. Its research output is highly rated by ERA (Excellence in Research for Australia), with 24 research fields ranked at or above world standard. SCU ranks in the top 4% globally for Forestry and Agricultural Sciences.
Notable alumni include:

Ashok Lavasa (Former Election Commissioner & Finance Secretary of India)

Poto Williams (New Zealand Politician)

Justin Harrison (Rugby Player)

Jodi Martin (Singer-Songwriter)

David Heilpern (Lawyer & Author)

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
SCU has a student body of over 18,800, with 3,300+ international students and nearly 7,700 online learners from across the globe. The university fosters a culturally diverse community, with 97 of its 417 faculty members coming from international backgrounds.
Graduates find employment across prominent organizations such as:

NSW Health

Queensland Health

Commonwealth Bank

Griffith University

Suncorp Group

fields.name: Torrens University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Torrens University Australia was established in 2011 and became the country's first new university in two decades. It began operations in 2014 and is accredited by the Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA). Acquired by Strategic Education Inc. in 2020, the university is now part of a global learning network of over 100,000 students. Torrens is ranked 40th in Australia and 2864th globally by uniRank.

Infrastructure, Campuses & Courses
With campuses in Adelaide, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and international locations in New Zealand and China, Torrens offers flexible on-campus, online, and hybrid study modes. The Adelaide Wakefield campus features modern facilities like open classrooms, breakout zones, and hot-desking. The university offers career-focused programs in areas such as business, public health, design, creative tech, hospitality, and sports management.

Achievements & Alumni
Torrens has launched several innovative initiatives, including the Voices of Autism course and the Thin Ice VR experience co-developed with environmentalist Tim Jarvis. In 2022, the university released a research-focused podcast series showcasing groundbreaking work. Notable alumni include Marcus Chan (Venli Consulting), musician Ben Salter, and cinematographer Nathan Frost.

Student Diversity & Placement
Torrens hosts over 19,000 students from 115+ countries, making it one of Australia's most diverse universities. It has a strong track record of graduate success, with 91% of students finding employment or pursuing further studies within a year. Top recruiters include Accor Hotels, Bank of Melbourne, and Allen Jack+Cottier, offering opportunities across various disciplines.

fields.name: Trent University
fields.about:
Trent University: Overview

History & Rankings
Founded in 1964 with support from Ontario Premier John Robarts, Trent University began with 100 students and quickly expanded. It was the first Canadian university to offer a Native Studies program (1969). Over time, Trent has grown into one of Canada’s respected public universities, launching initiatives like the Trent Research and Innovation Park (2017). The university is affiliated with institutions such as AUCC, IAU, and the Fields Institute. It is ranked #1497 globally and #35 in Canada.

Campuses & Programs
Trent has two main campuses: the scenic 1,400-acre Peterborough campus and the urban Durham GTA campus in Oshawa. It offers 60+ undergraduate and 20 graduate/professional programs in areas including Data Science, Forensics, Nursing, Computer Science, and Environmental Studies. Students enjoy access to 100+ clubs, 30+ international student groups, and 12 varsity teams.

Research, Diversity & Alumni
Trent emphasizes interdisciplinary studies such as Gender Studies and Aging. It supports international students with academic, financial, and housing services. The university employs nearly 2,000 staff and offers career opportunities across roles. Notable alumni include politician Maryam Monsef, Japanese MP Takako Suzuki, and former BC Premier John Horgan.

Student Body
The Peterborough campus hosts over 9,000 undergrads and 800+ graduate students. The Durham GTA campus serves over 1,900 students. Trent competes in Canadian Interuniversity Sport under the name Trent Excalibur.

fields.name: Southern Illinois University Edwardsville
fields.about:
Southern Illinois University Edwardsville (SIUE) is a public university established in 1957, located in Edwardsville, Illinois, as an extension of Southern Illinois University Carbondale. Known for its commitment to safety, The Daily Beast ranked SIUE 21st among the Top 50 Safest Colleges in the U.S. in 2010.

SIUE offers a wide range of graduate programs across eight colleges and schools, attracting students from across the country and around the world. A standout feature of the university is its no out-of-state tuition policy, meaning all U.S. students pay the same tuition rate regardless of residency.

Beyond academics, SIUE promotes student engagement through athletics, honor societies, student clubs, and organizations. Its athletic teams, known as the SIUE Cougars, compete at the NCAA Division I level as part of the Ohio Valley Conference.

The university is fully accredited by the Higher Learning Commission of the North Central Association of Colleges and Schools, ensuring high academic standards and quality education.

fields.name: Southern Methodist University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1911, Southern Methodist University (SMU) is a private institution affiliated with organizations like the American Council on Education, the International Association of Methodist-Related Schools, and Oak Ridge Associated Universities. Accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, SMU offers bachelor’s, postgraduate, doctoral, and professional programs. In 2022, SMU ranked #801-1000 in QS World University Rankings, #68 among National Universities, #614 in Best Global Universities, and #43 for Best Business Schools according to U.S. News & World Report.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
SMU’s main campus spans 237 acres, with additional campuses in Taos (423 acres) and Plano (16 acres). The university offers programs across eight schools: Business, Humanities and Sciences, Law, Engineering, Theology, Arts, Graduate and Advanced Studies, and Education and Human Development. Popular majors include Advertising, Anthropology, Business, Literature, Management, and Art.

Accomplishments and Alumni
SMU ranks #42 among U.S. Business Schools (Bloomberg) and #92 globally for MBA programs (Financial Times). Its alumni network includes prominent figures like Gerald Alley (CEO of Con-Real), Harry W. Bass (owner of Vail Resorts), Thaddeus Arroyo (CEO of AT&T Business Solutions), and astronaut Donald Holmquest.

Student Diversity and Recruiters
With around 11,500 students—including 6,500 undergraduates and postgraduates—from over 50 states and 85 countries, SMU fosters a diverse and inclusive campus culture that celebrates various traditions. The university hosts regular placement programs, attracting top employers such as Walmart, Walgreens, Xerox, CAT, Wells Fargo, and KPMG for on-campus recruitment.

fields.name: Southern New Hampshire University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Southern New Hampshire University (SNHU) was founded in 1932 in Manchester, USA, originally named the New Hampshire School of Accounting and Secretarial Science. It became the New Hampshire College of Accounting and Commerce in 1961 and was granted degree-awarding powers in 1963. SNHU is affiliated with the National Association of Independent Colleges and Universities and the New Hampshire College & University Council. In athletics, SNHU competes in NCAA Division II as a member of the Northeast-10 Conference. The university is ranked #131 among Regional Universities in the North by U.S. News & World Report.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Programs
SNHU is situated on an urban campus featuring over 70 student clubs, state-of-the-art laboratory facilities, NCAA Division II sports, on-campus housing, and a dedicated career center. The university comprises seven schools: College for America, College of Engineering, Technology and Aeronautics, College of Online and Continuing Education, School of Arts and Sciences, School of Business, School of Education, and School of International Engagement. Together, they offer more than 130 undergraduate and graduate programs available both on-campus and online.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Since its inception, SNHU has earned numerous accolades. In 2014, the School of Business and the College of Online and Continuing Education received multiple “Best of Business” awards for Best MBA Program and Best Online Degree Program, respectively, from the New Hampshire Business Review. The Chronicle of Higher Education recognized SNHU as one of the best universities to work for. Notable alumni include Rebecca Adamson (Cherokee businessperson and advocate), Felix G. Arroyo (former Boston city councillor), and Ron Fortier (comic book writer).

Student Diversity and Career Support
SNHU hosts approximately 457 international students, making up about 0.4% of the student body. Over 130,000 students study online through distance learning programs. The university is committed to helping graduates launch successful careers by organizing employer meetups, virtual career fairs, practice interviews, experiential learning opportunities, and other career-focused events.

fields.name: Trier University
fields.about:
University of Trier Overview
Located in Trier, Germany—near the Luxembourg border—the University of Trier is a public, research-focused institution. Originally founded in 1493, it was closed during Napoleon’s reign and later re-established in 1970. Today, it offers a peaceful and historic setting ideal for academic study.

The university provides both full-time and part-time programs in fields such as Accounting, Finance, Humanities, Law, Psychology, Mathematics, Social Sciences, and more. Department coordinators assist students in selecting courses, while the International Office’s Welcome Service supports visiting scholars with entry, insurance, and housing.

Trier’s two nearby campuses feature libraries, labs, canteens, student housing, and green parkland with streams, sculptures, and quiet spots—ideal for both study and relaxation.

fields.name: SP Jain School of Global Management Dubai
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
SP Jain School of Global Management is a private business school that established its Dubai campus in 2004. The institute is named after Shahu Shreyans Prasad Jain, an Indian businessman and former member of the Indian Parliament. SP Jain is accredited by several global bodies, including the Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA) in Australia, the Knowledge and Human Development Authority (KHDA) in Dubai, UAE, and ABEST21 in Japan. The school is ranked among the top 5 one-year MBA programs worldwide by Times Higher Education–Wall Street Journal (2018-19) and listed in the top 15 best one-year MBAs by Forbes (2019-21).

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Programs
SP Jain operates four campuses located in Dubai, Sydney, Singapore, and Mumbai. The Dubai campus, situated in Dubai International Academic City, features a learning center, library, trading rooms with Reuters terminals, lecture halls, cafeteria, student residences, and a sports center with a gym and basketball court. The school offers a wide range of programs, including bachelor’s, master’s, doctoral, and professional technical courses specializing in Business Communications, Data Science, Economics, Global Business, and Global Luxury & Services Management.

Achievements and Alumni
SP Jain School of Global Management holds accreditations from global bodies such as TEQSA and has earned program-specific accreditation from the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) for its Bachelor of Business Administration. Notable alumni include Saurish Nandi (Co-founder & CTO of BlocBox), Kunal Aman (Head of Marketing & Communications at SAS India), Kautilya Bansal (Director at Abhinav Global School), and Subhendu Pattnaik (Global Head of Marketing at Cigniti).

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
SP Jain attracts a diverse student body from various industries, including healthcare, information technology, consulting, education and training, and real estate. The school offers students valuable internship opportunities with leading companies. Prominent recruiters visiting the campus include PwC, KPMG, Coca-Cola, Cognizant, Viacom, Grant Thornton, and Dell.

fields.name: Trine University
fields.about:
Trine University Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1884 in Angola, Indiana, Trine University began as Tri-State Normal College. It became Tri-State College in 1906, gained university status in 1975, and was renamed Trine University in 2008 in honor of trustees Drs. Ralph and Sheri Trine. The university is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and holds program-specific accreditations from ABET and CAEP. Trine is affiliated with Space Grant for academics and competes in NCAA Division III sports. It ranked #69 in U.S. News Regional Universities Midwest (2022) and #600 in Times Higher Education U.S. rankings (2021).

📍 Campus & Programs
Located on a 450-acre campus in Angola, Indiana, Trine offers modern facilities, unique student housing, and a championship golf course. The university provides undergraduate and graduate programs across fields like Business, Engineering, IT, Media, Design, Kinesiology, and Mechanical Engineering.
 Achievements & Alumni
Trine boasts a 99.3% career or graduate school placement rate within six months of graduation (Class of 2021). Notable alumni include Ralph Ketner (Food Town co-founder), Isabelle French (former SWE president), and Karen Austin (Pacific Gas & Electric VP).

👥 Student Life & Diversity
With over 5,400 students, Trine has a 17:1 student-to-faculty ratio and a vibrant campus life with 60+ clubs, Greek life, and diverse student representation. International students make up 2.3% of enrollment. The university fosters inclusion across backgrounds, identities, and abilities.

Recruitment & Industry Links
Top recruiters include Amazon, Ford, Walmart, Cummins, Zimmer Biomet, and Parkview Health—reflecting strong industry connections and career opportunities for students.

fields.name: SRH - Hochschulen Heidelberg
fields.about:
History:
SRH Hochschule Heidelberg is a private university located in Heidelberg, Germany. Founded in 1969 as part of the SRH Group—a network of private educational institutions—SRH Hochschule has grown into a well-regarded university offering a range of programs focused on applied sciences, business, engineering, and health sciences. The university emphasizes practical learning and innovation to prepare students for the global job market.

Affiliations:
SRH Hochschule Heidelberg is accredited by the German Council of Science and Humanities and recognized by the Ministry of Science, Research, and the Arts of the State of Baden-Württemberg. The university is also part of the SRH Group, which encompasses various universities and research institutions across Germany. It maintains collaborations and exchange programs with numerous international universities to promote global academic partnerships.

Scholarships:
SRH Hochschule Heidelberg offers various scholarships and financial aid options to support both domestic and international students. Scholarships are awarded based on academic merit, financial need, and specific criteria such as leadership, social engagement, or artistic talent. Additionally, the university provides assistance with external funding opportunities and access to government-sponsored programs to help students finance their education.

fields.name: Trinity College Dublin
fields.about:
Trinity College Dublin Overview
History & Rankings
Founded in 1592, Trinity College Dublin (TCD) is Ireland’s oldest and highest-ranked university, located in Dublin’s city center. It’s the sole college of the University of Dublin and one of Ireland’s largest state-funded universities since 1947. Trinity holds prestigious accreditations, including AACSB for its Business School, and ranks #101 in QS World University Rankings 2022 and consistently in top global lists.

Campus & Academics
The 51-acre campus blends historic and modern architecture, offering 600+ programs across three faculties and 24 schools. Around 18,000 students study undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral courses in arts, humanities, business, law, engineering, science, and health sciences. Trinity Hall provides housing for over 1,000 students. Notable schools include Business, Creative Arts, Theology, Education, and English.

Achievements & Alumni
Trinity is ranked 40th Most International University globally (THE 2020) and has over 100,000 alumni worldwide. Famous alumni include Oscar Wilde, Samuel Beckett, William Rowan Hamilton, Ernest Walton, Edmund Burke, and Mary Robinson. The university is recognized for innovation and entrepreneurship, ranked #1 in Europe for producing entrepreneurs (Pitchbook 2019).

Student Diversity & Industry Connections
Trinity attracts a diverse international student body and promotes inclusivity regardless of background. Leading companies such as Accenture, Deloitte, Microsoft, Facebook, and Ernst & Young regularly recruit from the university.

fields.name: Trinity Western University Langley
fields.about:
Trinity Western University (TWU) is a private liberal arts university established in 1962. Located on a spacious 157-acre suburban campus in Langley, British Columbia, TWU also operates four additional campuses in Salt Spring Island, Richmond, Bellingham, and Ottawa. Each year, nearly 4,000 students enroll in a variety of undergraduate, graduate, and adult degree programs. Of these, approximately 1,900 are undergraduates and 2,100 are graduate students.

TWU is particularly recognized for its Master’s programs in fields such as humanities, education, linguistics, psychology, business, nursing, and theology. The university is home to several research institutes, including the Dead Sea Scrolls Institute, Gender Studies Institute, Centre for Entrepreneurial Leadership, Centre for Spiritual Formation in Higher Education, and the Institute of Indigenous Issues and Perspectives.

Several programs at TWU have received accreditation from prestigious bodies: the Master of Arts in Counselling Psychology is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP), nursing programs are accredited by the Canadian Association of Schools of Nursing, and education programs are recognized by the BC Teacher Regulation Branch.

To support its students, TWU offers a wide range of scholarships and grants. Beyond academics, the university fosters student life with nearly 100 clubs and organizations to engage and develop its community.

While TWU’s tuition fees are considered among the highest in Canada, the average cost is approximately $22,260 CAD per year, a rate that applies equally to both domestic and international students.

fields.name: SRH - International College
fields.about:
SRH International College is a renowned private educational institution in Germany, known for its commitment to high-quality, practice-oriented, and globally focused education. With campuses strategically located in Heidelberg, Berlin, Hamburg, and Munich, the college offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, MBA, and certificate programs. Fields of study include Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, and other emerging disciplines tailored to meet the demands of the global job market.

Founded in 2007, SRH International College operates under the umbrella of the SRH Higher Education group, one of Germany’s largest private university networks. The college is officially accredited by the German Council of Science and Humanities and recognized by the German Ministry of Education, ensuring that its programs meet rigorous academic and professional standards.

One of the key strengths of SRH International College is its emphasis on hands-on learning and innovation. The institution follows the CORE (Competence-Oriented Research and Education) model, designed to foster critical thinking, collaboration, and real-world problem-solving skills. Most programs are taught in English, making the college highly accessible to international students and promoting a multicultural learning environment.

SRH International College attracts a diverse student population from across the globe, offering not just academic excellence but also support in areas such as career services, internships, and job placements. The institution maintains strong connections with industries and corporate partners, which enhances students' employability and exposure to real-world business challenges.

fields.name: Troy University
fields.about:
Troy University: Overview, History & Achievements

History and Accreditation
Founded in 1887 as Troy Normal School in Troy, Alabama, Troy University began as a teacher training institution. It became Troy State College in 1957 and later evolved into Troy University in 2005. The university expanded with satellite campuses in Montgomery, Phenix City, and Dothan to support military personnel. It is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award associate through doctoral degrees, affirming its academic and financial standards.

Campus and Academics
Troy University comprises five colleges and a graduate school, offering 46 undergraduate, 22 postgraduate, and 3 doctoral programs. Colleges include Arts & Sciences, Business (Sorrell), Education, Health & Human Services, and Communications & Fine Arts. The main campus is set in scenic Troy, Alabama, with additional campuses in Montgomery, Phenix City, and Dothan. The university also hosts the Confucius Institute and provides part-time and online learning options.

Accomplishments and Alumni
A pioneer in online education, Troy began offering online courses in 1997. Known for serving traditional, nontraditional, and military students, it ranked 640th in Forbes’ 2019 list of top U.S. colleges. Notable alumni include NFL players Lawrence Tynes and DeMarcus Ware, former Montgomery Mayor Bobby Bright, and former Federal Reserve Vice-Chair Manuel H. Johnson.

Student Body and Recruiters
Troy has over 100,000 alumni worldwide and hosts around 16,400 students, including 800+ international students from 75 countries. The undergraduate population is 62% female, while 74% of postgraduates are women. Major employers of Troy graduates include AT&T, Microsoft, the U.S. Department of State, and the U.S. Army.

fields.name: St. Lawrence College
fields.about:
St. Lawrence College (SLC), located in Ontario, Canada, was established in 1967 as part of a province-wide initiative to expand access to career-focused education in Applied Arts and Technology. The college was founded during a period of growing demand for technical education, especially in the postwar era when vocational training was essential for helping veterans reenter the workforce. By the late 1950s, Ontario had begun integrating technical wings into high schools, and in response to this momentum, Premier William Davis—often referred to as the "Father of the Ontario College System"—led the creation of colleges like St. Lawrence to better prepare young Canadians for emerging job markets. Today, SLC continues its legacy of practical education and student success. It is affiliated with organizations such as the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA), the Association of Canadian Community Colleges (ACCC), the Association of Universities and Colleges of Canada (AUCC), and the Canadian Bureau for International Education (CBIE).

St. Lawrence College has three campuses located in the cities of Kingston, Brockville, and Cornwall—all of which are within convenient reach of major metropolitan areas like Toronto, Ottawa, and Montreal. The campuses provide students with a supportive and vibrant environment, featuring newly renovated libraries, group study rooms with SMART board technology, student lounges, and healthcare simulation labs equipped with high-fidelity manikins. Surrounded by the natural beauty of the Thousand Islands and the St. Lawrence River, students have access to both academic and outdoor recreational opportunities. The college offers a wide range of programs including bachelor’s degrees, diplomas, advanced diplomas, certificates, as well as part-time and online learning options. Academic disciplines cover areas such as Business and Marketing, Behavioral Science, Civil Engineering Technology, Computer Science, and Supply Chain Management. A major recent development is the "Hello Future" capital project at the Kingston campus—a $42 million expansion that includes the construction of a new Centre for Behavioural Studies, reinforcing the college’s commitment to building world-class infrastructure.

Over the years, St. Lawrence College has earned a reputation for producing job-ready graduates and maintaining strong industry connections. According to the Key Performance Indicators (KPI) from April 2017, 86.5% of SLC graduates found employment within six months of graduation, and 84.5% were satisfied with how their education helped them reach their post-graduate goals. Additionally, 80% of students expressed satisfaction with the overall quality of their education, while nearly 100% of employers reported satisfaction with the college’s graduates. Among its notable alumni are William A. Barclay, a New York State Assemblyman; George Stade, a distinguished literary critic and professor; Dan Buckley, publisher of Marvel Comics; Jamie Baker, an NHL hockey player; and Derrick Pitts, chief astronomer at the Franklin Institute.

Recognizing the importance of diversity, SLC actively supports its international student body through a team of dedicated International Student Advisors who provide guidance from pre-departure through graduation. The college is home to a multicultural community, with 78% of the student population identifying as white, 8.5% as international (non-resident aliens), and the rest representing various global backgrounds. St. Lawrence College is known for its strong graduate employment rate, currently standing at 95%, reflecting its effective career preparation. Some of the top employers recruiting SLC graduates include Kingston Health Sciences Centre, Walmart, Empire Life, and the City of Kingston. With its blend of personalized education, state-of-the-art facilities, and a strong support system, SLC continues to be a leading choice for students in Canada and around the world.

fields.name: TU Dublin
fields.about:
TU Dublin is firmly rooted in the heart of the region, with campuses across Dublin City Centre (Grangegorman, Aungier Street, and Bolton Street) as well as in Blanchardstown and Tallaght. As part of a major development plan, the University is investing over €500 million in cutting-edge, tech-enabled facilities to enhance the student experience.

While widely recognized for its strength in STEM, TU Dublin also has Ireland’s largest student community in business, media, culinary arts, and the creative and performing arts. As a leader in part-time education, the University plays a key role in supporting lifelong learning and contributing to Ireland’s economic growth.

Our researchers drive innovation in science and technology, influence national policy, and enrich the creative landscape. TU Dublin’s award-winning business incubators and technology transfer initiatives have launched over 400 sustainable start-ups, adding nearly €700 million in economic value.

TU Dublin has a strong global perspective, welcoming students and staff from around the world. Through international collaborations, we offer exchange programs, research partnerships, and global career pathways. With a thriving alumni network of over 100,000 graduates, TU Dublin is shaping an ambitious future—one full of possibility.
fields.admission_requirements:

For International (Non-EU) Applicants:

Apply via the CRM Recruit online application portal.

Pay a €50 non-refundable application fee.

Upload all required documents (see below).

Wait for a conditional or full offer.

If accepted, pay the required deposit (usually 50% of tuition).

Apply for a student visa (if applicable).

For EU Applicants (via CAO):

Apply through the Central Applications Office (CAO).

Select your preferred course at TU Dublin, Bolton Street.

Submit your Leaving Certificate/QQI or equivalent qualifications.

Follow up on offer and acceptance via the CAO timeline.

For Part-Time Applicants (Bolton Street):

Apply online or via a course-specific form.

Pay the €50 application fee.

Submit required documents.

Pay 25% of the course fee or acceptance deposit upon offer.

fields.name: St. Thomas University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1910, the University of St. Thomas began as St. Thomas College in Chatham, New Brunswick, offering secondary and junior college education. It became a degree-granting university in 1934 and is formally recognized by the New Brunswick Department of Post-Secondary Education. The university is affiliated with Universities Canada, Canadian University Press, and the International Council of Universities of Saint Thomas Aquinas (ICUSTA).

Campus & Programs
Located in Fredericton, St. Thomas University is a small, undergraduate-focused institution specializing in liberal arts. The campus includes six academic buildings: James Dunn Hall, Edmund Casey Hall, George Martin Hall, Brian Mulroney Hall, Holy Cross House, and Margaret Norrie McCain Hall. Notable programs include criminology, journalism, human rights, and communications and public policy.

Student Life & Achievements
Known for academic excellence, 91% of first-year students rate their experience as good or excellent. The university invests $1.8 million annually in student aid, offering over 40 types of scholarships and bursaries. Students engage in research, conferences, international study, leadership roles, and community internships. The alumni network exceeds 12,000, with notable graduates such as Judge Carolyn Layden-Stevenson, President Dawn Russell, and lawyer Greg Byrne.

Diversity & Career Support
With a 53% female and 47% male student body, the university welcomes students from 41 countries, with international students making up 11%. A close-knit community supports their success. The Career Development Centre assists both students and alumni with career planning and development.

fields.name: Tufts University
fields.about:
Tufts University: Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1852 by Charles Tufts, Tufts University is located on scenic Walnut Hill in Medford and Somerville, near Boston. As a major research institution, Tufts is affiliated with prestigious organizations such as the Association of American Universities (AAU), URA, AICUM, NAICU, and the U.S. Space-Grant program. It ranked 29th in the U.S. News & World Report 2020 National Universities and #275 in the 2022 QS World University Rankings.

Campuses, Courses & Infrastructure
Tufts operates across four campuses: Medford/Somerville, Boston, Grafton, and an international site in Talloires, France. Its 150-acre Medford campus blends classic architecture with modern facilities and houses art by Picasso and Warhol. With a selective 15% acceptance rate and a 9:1 student-faculty ratio, Tufts offers over 90 undergraduate and 160 graduate programs in fields like Arts & Sciences, Engineering, Biomedical Sciences, Dental Medicine, Business, and Fine Arts.

Achievements & Alumni
Tufts has produced 7 Pulitzer Prize winners, 3 Nobel Laureates, and a global alumni network of over 120,000 graduates. Distinguished alumni include actor Hank Azaria, economist Eugene Fama, and diplomat Scott Brown. The university also ranks #48 in Best Undergraduate Teaching (U.S. News).

Student Life & Diversity
Tufts hosts 12,200+ students, with over 6,000 undergraduates from all 50 U.S. states and 71 countries—54% of whom are women. The university supports over 300 student organizations, including professional and graduate clubs. Leading employers of Tufts graduates include Cigna, Deloitte, Sanofi, and Predilytics.

fields.name: Stanford University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Stanford University, originally named Leland Stanford Junior University, was founded in 1885 by Jane and Leland Stanford in memory of their only child, Leland Jr., who tragically passed away from typhoid fever at age 15. After his death in 1884, the Stanfords dedicated their wealth to creating an institution that would benefit other young people. Stanford is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC) and is affiliated with the Association of American Universities (AAU), Conceive Design Implement Operate (CDIO), and the Space Grant Consortium. In global rankings, Stanford was placed 3rd by the QS World University Rankings 2022 and also ranked 3rd in the 2022 Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Academic Programs
Stanford’s main campus spans 8,180 acres in the heart of the San Francisco Peninsula. It features an extensive infrastructure including 49 miles of roads, two separate water systems, three dams, two open irrigation reservoirs, three closed potable water reservoirs, 88 miles of water mains, and a dedicated post office. The university’s Central Energy Facility utilizes heat recovery and thermal storage to enhance heating and cooling efficiency. Stanford comprises seven schools: the Graduate School of Business, School of Earth, Energy & Environmental Sciences, Graduate School of Education, School of Engineering, School of Humanities and Sciences, Stanford Law School, and School of Medicine, all offering a wide range of undergraduate and graduate degree programs.

Achievements and Notable Alumni
Stanford excels across its seven schools, research institutes, arts, and athletics programs. With an endowment of $37.8 billion, its faculty engage in groundbreaking research, currently managing over 7,900 externally funded projects with a combined budget of $1.69 billion. The university has 2,288 faculty members, including 682 endowed professors, who are recognized leaders in their fields. Since its founding, Stanford has produced 35 Nobel Prize winners. The Fall 2021 faculty also included 10 National Medal of Science recipients, 4 Pulitzer Prize winners, 6 National Humanities Medal recipients, 3 Kavli Prize laureates, and 7 A.M. Turing Award winners. Stanford boasts a global alumni network of over 220,000 individuals.

Student Diversity and Employer Connections
In 2021, Stanford awarded 1,511 bachelor's degrees and currently enrolls 7,645 undergraduates and 9,292 graduate students. The student body is nearly balanced by gender, with women representing 51% and men 49%. International students hail from 77 countries, making up almost 13% of the population. First-generation college students comprise nearly 18%. Stanford is celebrated for its ethnic diversity: 25% Asian, 8% Black or African American, 18% Hispanic or Latino, 12% International, 9% identifying as two or more races, and 23% White. Leading graduate employers include Google, Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, and Facebook.

fields.name: State University of New York
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1861 by Edward Austin Sheldon, the State University of New York at Oswego (SUNY Oswego) began as the Oswego Primary Teachers Training School. It was the first institution to integrate object-based learning with classroom instruction. Over the years, SUNY Oswego has continued to evolve, offering programs that align with the changing needs of employers and society. The university is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE).

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
SUNY Oswego offers a wide range of undergraduate programs, spanning from accounting to zoology. It comprises four distinct colleges, collectively offering over 60 undergraduate majors. Students benefit from a flexible curriculum that allows them to combine majors, pursue multiple minors, or specialize in specific fields through elective courses. The Office of International Education and Programs (OIEP) supports global engagement through two key services: Education Abroad and International Student & Scholar Services (ISSS), both dedicated to enhancing the experience of international students.

Accomplishments and Alumni
SUNY Oswego takes pride in fostering a collaborative and secure campus environment through education, communication, and community involvement. Its vibrant alumni network includes several distinguished individuals, such as renowned television personalities Al Roker and Linda Cohn.

Student Diversity and Career Opportunities
With students representing over 140 countries, SUNY Oswego boasts a diverse and inclusive campus community. The university emphasizes the development of transferable skills, preparing students for successful careers and ensuring they are well-equipped for the job market through various placement and recruitment initiatives.

fields.name: Tulane University
fields.about:
Tulane University: Overview

History & Rankings
Founded in 1884 in New Orleans, Tulane University began as the University of Louisiana, thanks to a major donation from philanthropist Paul Tulane. Today, it is a prestigious member of the Association of American Universities (AAU), representing top research institutions in the U.S. and Canada. Tulane is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools and offers undergraduate, graduate, and professional degrees. Recognized globally, Tulane ranks 42nd among U.S. national universities (U.S. News), #=436 in the QS World Rankings, and in the 401–500 band in THE World Rankings.

Campus & Academics
Tulane’s 100-acre campus features 89 buildings and over 70 majors across five schools: Architecture, Business, Engineering, Liberal Arts, and Science. Graduate-only programs are offered in Law, Medicine, and Social Work. The university also provides career development courses and is home to 200+ student organizations, including sports teams and Greek life.

Reputation & Alumni
Tulane is known for academic excellence and innovation, consistently ranked among the top 40 most innovative U.S. universities. Its alumni network includes leaders like former Costa Rican President Luis Guillermo Solís, CEO Matt Battiata, and poet Jennifer Grotz, with many giving back through scholarships and mentorship.

Diversity & Career Support
Tulane values diversity and offers extensive support services. Its Career Services Center lists over 1,600 job openings and provides access to an exclusive internship database shared with schools like Harvard, Duke, and Princeton. Tulane graduates are known for their strong qualifications and job readiness.

fields.name: Steinbeis University
fields.about:
History and Affiliations
Steinbeis University, originally established in 1998 as Steinbeis-Hochschule Berlin, is part of the broader Steinbeis Foundation, which has roots going back to 1868. The foundation was created by Ferdinand von Steinbeis to promote practical, dual-education models in Germany. The university was founded to extend this tradition into higher education, with an emphasis on industry-linked, project-based learning. Over the years, Steinbeis University has expanded its academic offerings to include bachelor's, master's, and MBA programs, often delivered through a network of specialized institutes and transfer centers.

The institution is structured around several key academic units, such as the School of Management and Innovation (SMI), the School of International Business and Entrepreneurship (SIBE), and the Steinbeis Center of Management and Technology (SCMT). It collaborates closely with numerous prominent companies—including Siemens, Bosch, SAP, Mercedes-Benz, and Deutsche Telekom—embedding real-world projects and consulting work into its academic model. Steinbeis University is state-recognized in Germany and some of its programs hold accreditations from agencies like FIBAA, ensuring academic quality and global recognition.

Rankings and Reputation
Steinbeis University does not appear in major global university rankings such as QS, Times Higher Education, or ARWU. This is largely due to its specialized, application-focused model and private status. However, based on independent academic metrics, it holds a modest national position. According to EduRank 2025, Steinbeis is ranked approximately #154 in Germany, #1,220 in Europe, and #5,189 globally. While it may not rank highly in traditional academic criteria, Steinbeis is respected for its unique educational model that bridges academia and industry.

The university's reputation among students and employers is mixed, as is common with many private institutions. On one hand, it is valued for its career-relevant curriculum and strong corporate partnerships. On the other hand, discussions in student forums (such as Reddit) occasionally raise concerns regarding transparency, tuition costs, and the overall recognition of private degrees in Germany. Still, many alumni commend Steinbeis for helping them gain practical experience and build direct industry connections during their studies.

Scholarships and Financial Support
Steinbeis University offers a variety of merit-based scholarships and tuition waivers to support both domestic and international students. These scholarships typically range from 10% to 50% of tuition fees and are awarded based on academic excellence, leadership potential, and motivation. Programs like the Global Talent Scholarship, Women in STEM Scholarship, MBA Leadership Scholarship, and the Entrepreneurship Scholarship are some of the most popular options. Many of these do not require a separate application, as students are automatically considered during the admission process.

Additional support is available through the Steinbeis Scholarship Fund, especially for students enrolled in MBA, MSc, and STEM-related programs. Some funding opportunities are tailored to undergraduate international students, such as the Steinberg Fund and TOEFL Achievement Awards, which offer annual tuition discounts ranging from USD 1,100 to USD 9,000. Depending on the program, students may be required to submit a motivation letter, updated CV, or evidence of academic achievement to be considered. Overall, while the university is privately funded, it does make efforts to reduce financial barriers for high-performing and underrepresented students.

fields.name: UCAM Catholic University of Murcia
fields.about:
UCAM: Overview, Campuses & Rankings

Founded in 1996 by Jose Luis Mendoza Perez, Universidad Católica San Antonio (UCAM) is a private Catholic university in Murcia, Spain, affiliated with the Diocese of Cartagena. Accredited by Spain’s ANECA and Ministry of Education, UCAM ranks between 1001-1200 globally in Times Higher Education 2022 and holds a QS four-star rating.

UCAM’s main Los Jerónimos campus covers 25,000 sqm, featuring modern classrooms, labs, sports facilities, a library, and dining areas. Additional campuses include Cartagena, Madrid, and online platforms. UCAM offers a wide range of programs: 7 undergraduate, 12 postgraduate, 3 online master’s, 4 PhDs, and various short-term and study abroad courses, available in both Spanish and English.

Known as Spain’s “University of Sports,” UCAM boasts Olympic athletes with 11 gold, 20 silver, and 12 bronze medals. Notable athletes include racewalker Miguel Ángel López and swimmer Jessica Vall.

With around 21,000 students, about 12% are international. Graduates find employment in top firms like Capgemini, Accenture, Deloitte, EY, and Telefonica.

fields.name: Stenberg College
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Founded in 1990 by Mary Jane Stenberg, Stenberg College has established itself as a leading institution in the fields of health care and human services education. In 2003, the college became part of The Education Company Inc. (TEC), which continues to oversee its growth and development. Stenberg College maintains strong academic affiliations with reputable institutions such as the British Columbia Institute of Technology (BCIT) and Yorkville University, enhancing the value and recognition of its programs.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
Stenberg College is known for its specialization in health care and human services education. Its primary campus is located in Surrey, British Columbia, a vibrant suburb of Vancouver and the province’s second-largest municipality. The campus occupies the 7th floor of the tower at Central City Mall, offering students convenient access to a range of amenities, including food outlets, study spaces, and retail stores—making breaks between classes both relaxing and enjoyable.

The college offers comprehensive support services, including English as a Second Language (ESL) programs for students needing language assistance and academic support services designed to improve study habits and exam preparation. Academically, the institution is organized into five key faculties: Education, Health Care Administration, Healthcare Technology, Nursing, and Human Services.

Accreditations and Alumni
Stenberg College is fully accredited by the Private Training Institutions Branch (PTIB) and recognized under Education Quality Assurance (EQA), ensuring high academic and operational standards. Its alumni work across a wide range of health and human services professions, reflecting the college’s commitment to preparing students for meaningful, impactful careers.

Student Diversity and Recruitment
Diversity is a core value at Stenberg College. With over 220 international students representing a variety of cultural backgrounds, the college fosters an inclusive and supportive learning environment. The student population maintains a fairly balanced gender ratio of 40:60 (male to female). Graduates from Stenberg are well-regarded in the job market, with top recruiters including companies like Amazon and Clearly, among others.

fields.name: Ulm University
fields.about:
Ulm University: Overview

Founded in 1967 in Baden-Württemberg, Germany, Ulm University is a young, research-focused public institution. It hosts research centers from major companies like Daimler, BMW, and Siemens, and is affiliated with the German Research Foundation (DFG) and other organizations.

The campus features modern facilities supporting research and education, with four faculties: Medicine; Engineering, Computer Science & Psychology; Mathematics & Economics; and Natural Sciences. Key research areas include Engineering, Life Sciences, Nanomaterials, and Financial Services.

Located by the River Danube—Albert Einstein’s birthplace—Ulm includes a science park with hospitals and tech centers. Notable alumni include CEO Dirk Jens Nonnenmacher and mathematician Gens Marklof.

With around 9,900 students (including 1,300 internationals) and 2,400 staff, the university has a female-majority student body (68%). Industry partners like Daimler, BMW, and Continental regularly engage with the campus.

fields.name: Umea University
fields.about:
Umea University: Overview

Founded in 1965, Umea University is a public research institution in northern Sweden and the country’s fifth-oldest university. It’s known for its Industrial Design institute and research on Norway spruce and Populus genomes. Affiliations include EUA and UArctic. It ranks #365 (QS 2022) and #351-400 (THE 2022).

Campus and Programs

Located in Umeå, the university has 36 departments, over 20 research institutes, and satellite campuses in Skellefteå and Örnsköldsvik. The main campus features modern facilities including an arts campus by the river. It offers master’s and doctoral programs in Architecture, Business, Design, Engineering, Computer Science, Genetic Engineering, and more.

Achievements and Alumni

Umea is one of Sweden’s top universities and highly international, with partnerships across 300+ institutions. It ranks #335 globally (US News 2022). The alumni network spans 20,000+ members worldwide, including notable figures like former Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Löfven and filmmaker Kay Pollak.

Student Body and Industry Links

With around 32,000 students (64% female), including 2,000 international students from 100+ countries, Umea offers diverse learning options, including online courses. The university employs over 2,100 academic staff. Key industry partners include IKEA, AstraZeneca, Volvo, EY, and the Swedish Armed Forces.

fields.name: Universita Di Padova
fields.about:
University of Padua: Overview

Founded in 1222 by scholars from Bologna, the University of Padua (Università di Padova) is Italy’s second-oldest and one of the world’s oldest universities. Located in northern Italy’s Veneto region, it has a long legacy of academic excellence and innovation. In the 16th and 17th centuries, it became a hub for scientific progress, hosting luminaries like Vesalius, Copernicus, and Galileo.

Rankings & Affiliations

The university is ranked among the top 200 globally (ARWU) and holds the #2 spot in Italy (Censis, 2021). It is a member of the Coimbra Group and the TIME network and ranks #119 in Best Global Universities and #45 in Europe.

Campuses & Programs

Padua offers programs through eight schools, including Medicine, Engineering, Psychology, and Law. Facilities like libraries and study halls are centrally located, with research centers spread across Veneto cities like Vicenza and Treviso. Notable research centers include CRIBI Biotechnology Centre and the Giuseppe Colombo Space Studies Centre. Popular courses include Data Science, Cybersecurity, Environmental Engineering, and Molecular Biology.

Achievements & Alumni

Padua is Italy’s top university for teaching quality and among the world’s top 250. Notable alumni include composer Giuseppe Tartini, philosopher Jacopo Zabarella, and Polish statesman Jan Zamoyski.

Student Body & Recruitment

With 48,651 students (3,844 international), the university has a staff of 2,223, including 103 international academics. Each year, thousands of degrees are awarded across undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral programs. Employers like Amazon, Deloitte, Luxottica, PwC Italy, and the European Commission recruit Padua graduates.

fields.name: Stevens Institute of Technology
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Located in Hoboken, New Jersey, Stevens Institute of Technology is a private research university founded in 1870, making it one of the oldest technological colleges in the United States. It holds the distinction of being among the first institutions in the country to offer a program in Mechanical Engineering. Stevens stands out for its commitment to civic community engagement, reflecting the diverse population of Hoboken. Many of its academic programs have earned accreditation from prestigious national and international organizations, including the American Chemical Society and the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET). The institute competes in 25 NCAA Division III varsity sports and is affiliated with organizations such as NAICU, AITU, AAC, Sea Grant, and Space Grant.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
The university’s vibrant urban campus spans 55 acres and features a wealth of facilities, including modern classrooms, libraries, cafes, residential halls, gyms, and notable landmarks such as Castle Point, Lawrence T. Babbio Center, and the Stevens Library Archives. Stevens offers a broad spectrum of programs across diverse fields such as Accounting and Finance, Law and Public Policy, Environmental Science, Biology, History, Mathematics, Creative Writing, and many others. These courses are designed to cultivate versatile skills, preparing students to thrive in a highly competitive global environment.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Stevens Institute of Technology emphasizes accessible, high-quality education while fostering leadership and professional ethics among its students. The university encourages its community to strive toward their fullest potential. Recognized for academic excellence, Stevens has been listed among the “Best Business Schools” by the Princeton Review and ranked within the top 25 U.S. colleges offering the best value by Business Insider. The institute regularly competes in national championships across its 25 sports programs and ranks second nationally, according to Forbes (2018), for colleges with the smallest gender gap in graduate earnings. Notable alumni include William W. Destler (Professor and Administrator), Frederick Winslow Taylor (Mechanical Engineer), David J. Farber (Professor), Henry Gantt (Mechanical Engineer and Management Consultant), and Debajyoti Mukhopadhyay (Scientist).

Student Diversity and Industry Connections
Stevens attracts a diverse and multicultural student body from across the globe. The university enrolls approximately 4,000 undergraduate students, with international students comprising about 2%, and 4,200 graduate students, of which 58% are international. Women represent 30% of the undergraduate population, and both students and faculty include significant numbers of underrepresented minorities. Graduates of Stevens have secured positions at leading global companies, including Amazon, Google, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Amazon Web Services, and others.

fields.name: Universität Leipzig
fields.about:
Leipzig University: Overview
History, Affiliations & Rankings
Founded in 1409, Leipzig University is Germany’s second-oldest continuously operating university. Located in Saxony, it was established by Frederick I and William II and initially had four faculties. The university is a member of the Utrecht Network and U15. In global rankings, it is placed #447 (QS 2023), #202 in Arts & Humanities (QS), and #350 (US News 2022). It also ranked within the 126–150 band in Times Higher Education’s European Teaching Rankings (2018).

Campus & Academics
Leipzig University spans 38 locations across the city, with the main campus in the city center. It hosts Germany’s oldest university library and botanical garden, as well as several museums. The university offers over 150 programs across 14 faculties, including undergraduate, master's, PhD, and diploma courses. Most programs are taught in German, so proficiency in the language is essential for international students.

Achievements & Notable Alumni
Leipzig is recognized for its research in global societal change, smart materials, and sustainable health. Prof. Daniel Huster was honored with the Thomas E. Thompson Award for contributions to membrane biophysics. Notable alumni include mathematician August Möbius, and professionals across fields from journalism to global studies.

Student Life & Career Support
International students make up over 11% of the student population. The university offers tailored career services, including resume workshops, job search support, and internship assistance. A global alumni network of over 2,300 provides additional support and connections.

fields.name: University College Cork
fields.about:
University College Cork: Overview
History & Rankings
Founded in 1845 under Queen Victoria’s act for advancing learning in Ireland, University College Cork (UCC) began in 1849 with faculties in Medicine, Arts, and Law. It is affiliated with networks like the Atlantic University Alliance and the European University Association. UCC ranks #198 in the QS World University Rankings 2022 and #3 among Irish universities (US News & World Report).

Campus & Academics
Located along the scenic Lee River, UCC blends historic limestone buildings with modern facilities like the state-of-the-art Computer Science building. The campus is close to cultural sites and student accommodations. Popular programs include Nursing, Agriculture, Law, English, and Pharmacy, offered at undergraduate and postgraduate levels.

Achievements & Alumni
UCC plays a key role in promoting gender equality in Irish higher education and has hosted major conventions on the topic. With over 150,000 alumni globally, notable graduates include Irish politician Norma Foley, actor Cillian Murphy, and writer Maureen Gaffney.

Students & Career Opportunities
The university enrolls around 15,700 students, with 3,000 international. About 85% are undergraduates, and 15% postgraduates. UCC employs over 1,600 staff, including 629 international faculty. Graduates enjoy strong job prospects, with 93% employed or in further study within nine months. Top recruiters include Apple, EY, Dell, Deloitte, and Accenture.

fields.name: Stockholm University
fields.about:
History, Affiliations, and Rankings
Stockholm University, founded in 1878, is one of Europe’s most distinguished educational institutions. Originally established as Stockholm College, it was designed to offer a more modern, inclusive alternative to the traditional universities of Uppsala and Lund. The college initially operated without formal exams or degrees and held its first public lectures in 1877 in the handicrafts school building on Mäster Samuelsgatan. Subjects such as mathematics, physics, chemistry, and geology were among the first to be taught, soon followed by cultural history and economics. In 1904, Stockholm College gained the right to award degrees, and in 1960, it officially achieved university status. The university is widely recognized today and ranks among the top 100 global institutions according to the Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU). It is accredited by both the European Union Association and UNICA. According to the QS World University Rankings, it was ranked #148 in 2022 and #153 in 2023, while Times Higher Education placed it at #176 in 2022.

Infrastructure, Campuses, and Courses
The main campus of Stockholm University is located in the Frescati area, stretching from the Bergius Botanical Garden in the north to Sveaplan in the south. Set within the world’s first national urban park, the campus offers a unique blend of natural beauty, architectural significance, and contemporary art. A notable landmark on campus is the Aula Magna, a modern auditorium used for lectures, conferences, and ceremonies. The university offers over 300 degrees in science and the humanities and provides more than 1,700 courses. Among these are 75 master’s programs delivered in English, covering a broad spectrum of disciplines such as Computer and Systems Sciences, Business and Economics, Arts and Humanities, Media and Communication, Law, Science, Mathematics, Language, Linguistics, and the Social and Political Sciences. Stockholm University also offers scholarship opportunities specifically for international students.

Accomplishments and Alumni
Students at Stockholm University benefit from a wide array of support services aimed at enhancing both their academic and personal experience. One such service is Academic Writing Support, which is available free of charge and includes study groups, individual counseling, presentations, and writing workshops. The university also provides counseling services to help both prospective and current students navigate academic decisions and life in a new country. Special support is available for students with disabilities to ensure equal access to education and university resources. Stockholm University takes pride in its distinguished alumni and faculty, including Nobel Laureates and global figures such as Svante Arrhenius (Nobel Prize in Chemistry), Tomas Tranströmer (Nobel Prize in Literature), Meemann Chang (renowned paleontologist), Christer Fuglesang (Swedish physicist and astronaut), Dag Hammarskjöld (former UN Secretary-General), and Horace Engdahl (literary historian).

Student Diversity and Global Partnerships
Located in one of Europe’s most international and dynamic capitals, Stockholm University is home to around 27,000 students, 1,400 doctoral candidates, and 5,700 staff members working across the sciences and humanities. The university fosters a diverse and inclusive academic environment and maintains partnerships with institutions across the globe. These include the European Civic University, Helsinki University, the University of Illinois, and the University of Tokyo, among many others. Strategic collaborations with research centers such as the Accelerator, the Baltic Sea Centre, and the Navarino Environmental Observatory further enhance the university’s role in driving impactful research, innovation, and sustainability.

fields.name: University College Dublin (UCD)
fields.about:
University College Dublin (UCD) Overview
History & Rankings
Founded in 1854 as the Catholic University of Ireland, UCD has evolved over time, adopting its current name in 1998. It is part of the National University of Ireland and affiliated with organizations like AMBA, EUA, and Universitas 21. UCD ranks #117 globally (QS 2021) and #1 in Ireland, with a strong reputation for graduate employability.

Campus & Academics
Spanning 330 acres, UCD’s campus hosts six colleges offering programs in Arts, Engineering, Law, Sciences, and more. Popular fields include Biological Sciences, Psychology, and Social Sciences. The university boasts top-tier facilities, a vibrant student life with 70+ clubs, and extensive sports options.

Achievements & Alumni
UCD has a history of academic innovation and external program reviews shaping its education degrees. Notable alumni include Canadian journalist Henry Champ and Tommy Douglas, known as the father of Medicare.

Student Body & Career Links
With over 33,000 students, including nearly 8,000 internationals from 144 countries, UCD embraces diversity. Its Target Connect platform offers job fairs and internships, linking students with top employers like Google, Microsoft, Accenture, and Facebook.
